loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a 50 year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Radwan has owned a factory in which he produces pickups since 1975. He also repairs them.  Radwan is requesting a loan of $1000 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a new tool for his work and to pay for an operation for his wife. This is the first time that Radwan has requested a loan.

Radwan is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of money but he decided to get started in this business because of he had experience, as he had learned the necessary skills when he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new tool for his work and to pay for an operation for his wife.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca A. works as a trader selling biscuits, toffee and Milo (a milk beverage) at Moree near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2001. She is married with four children and has received an education through senior high school. Her husband works as a blacksmith.

Francisca is responsible for paying for school fees, utilities and food. Her loan will be used to purchase more groceries and other food items to sell and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and other food items to sell

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehia is a 30-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. Yehia has owned a snack shop for seventeen years.  He sells all types of sandwiches. Yehia is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his snack shop. This is the first time that Yehia has requested a loan.

Yehia treats his clients well and is known for his good sandwiches. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others in the local area.  When he first started his business, Yehia had to face much competition.  In the future, he plans on expanding his snack shop by opening a restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his snack shop.

loans.name: Siguikame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguikame est constitué de cinq  femmes (dont trois mariées et deux  célibataires) qui ont en moyenne  de 34 ans  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3 ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus, pagnes wax, fruits, habillements pour enfants, charbon de bois etc. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. Tous les  deux prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter  20 sacs charbon de bois , 15 pièces de pagnes  wax, 20 régimes de bananes, 10 paniers de mangues et 20 complets d’habillements  pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako, de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues, la plupart au comptant, dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille   et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines femmes du groupe Siguikame ambitionnent d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation  et  d’autres  d’ouvrir leur propre boutique à Sikasso.
texts.en:
The group Siguikame is composed of five women (three who are married and two who are not). They average 34 years of age and 2 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Mancourani I, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do a diversity of work, including selling fabrics, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fruit, children's clothing, charcoal, etc. The group members are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer needs and are on their third solidarity loan. Both preceding loans were settled. With this new loan, they intend to buy 20 sacks of charcoal, 15 bolts of Wax pagnes, 20 bunches of bananas, 10 baskets of mangoes, and 20 outfits for children. Supplies are gotten at the marketplace of Bamako, from Médine in Sikasso City, and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold mostly in cash transactions at different marketplaces of Sikasso, within families, to customers composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 19,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business. Certain women of the group have the ambition to buy a plot of land on which to live, and the others, to open their own shop in Sikasso.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Khaled owns a jewelry shop. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase gold which he uses to make his jewelry.  This is his third loan and he has always paid on time.  Khaled's previous loans helped him to improve his work. His clients can be anybody. When he first started, he faced some financiA. difficulties but he decided on doing this type of work because he likes it and has experience.  In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase gold to make jewelry.

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi S. est une jeune femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de poissons au marché d’Avetonou, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise.  la bonne gestion de son commerce lui permis d’accroître considérablement ses ventes au cours de se derniers temps. Pour augmenter la capacité de son commerce, Akuvi souhaite avec ce crédit payer des poissons et des légumes pour la revente.
texts.en:
Akuvi S. is a young woman, 39 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is a fish retailer at the marketplace of Avetonou, a village located northeast of Lomé, the capital of Togo. Good business management has enabled her to increase her sales a great deal most recently. To increase her business capacity, she would like to use this loan to pay for some fish and vegetables for resale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mouchref

texts.en: Mouchref is a 26-year-old man who lives in Saida in southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Mouchref has been in the business of trading cereals for four years. He buys the cereals and then resells them.  Mouchref is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise and do some maintenance work on his pickup truck which he uses to transport his products. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time.  His previous loan helped him to improve his business.  When he first started his business he had some financial issues, but he decided on this type of work because he had learned a lot about it when he was young and therefore had some experience in it. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by opening his own shop.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and do some maintenance work on his pickup.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the town of Bambang. She is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a clothing business, primarily providing new clothing to local community members.

Josephine joined ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Through patience and sacrifices, Josephine believes that she can develop her business, paving her way to becoming a successful entrepreneur. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina E. is married with four children and has received no formal education.  She works as a seamstress and trader, selling such goods as rice, oil and canned tomatoes at Moree near Cape Coast.  She has been in business since 2008.  Georgina uses her income to pay for school fees, utilities, and food. She will use the loan to purchase rice in large quantities for resale and also to purchase sewing materials to broaden the services she renders to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale in bulk and sewing materials to broaden customer services.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is thirty-year-old Jane M. from Tukuyu. She is married with a 10-year-old child. Jane has been running a clothes and cereal business since 2008. She buys clothes and cereals  wholesale and sells them on a retail basis.
Jane works at her business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, with the assistance of one employee. She currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase cereals in bulk for resale. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Jane thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA, one of Kiva's field partners, has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose A. est revendeuse des légumes au marché d’Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé. Agé 49 ans,  elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Avec ce crédit, Rose souhaite redonner d’élan à son activité en achetant des légumes pour la revente. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rose A. is a vegetable seller at the marketplace of Avetonou, a village located about 100 km from Lomé. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of five. With this loan, she would like to bring some momentum to her business by buying vegetables for resale. She is counting on this opportunity to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Two years ago, Mary K. got her first loan from Sudan Microfinance. That was when she started a business selling charcoal in small quantities. Her business nearly failed due to the demolition of her house which was in the way of a new road. Nevertheless, she fully repaid her loan to Sudan Microfinance. 

Mary has now joined the Kiva field partner, Brac South Sudan. She sells charcoal wholesale at her store and wants a loan to hire a lorry for the transportation of charcoal from the producers to her store.  Mary is thirty-two years old and married to a businessman. She has three children who all attend school, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Hire a lorry to carry charcoal to her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Morakinyo

texts.en: Morakinyo A. is forty-two years old and married with four children. Her business is selling plantain. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bunches of plantain to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice E. is thirty-five years old and married with four children. Her business is selling palm kernels. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm kernels to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels to sell.

loans.name: Kotognontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognontala1 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du hameau Adamabougou de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles excellent principalement  dans la culture de l’arachide et du haricot.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Kotognontala ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de semences d’arachide et de haricot, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant et quelques rare fois  à crédit à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Kotognontala1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Kotognontala1 is composed of married women from the hamlet of Adamabougou of Koutiala City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They average 40 years of age and 6 children each. Their main business involves growing peanuts and beans. Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After having correctly repaid the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth farming loan. The current loan will be used to buy sacks of seeds to plant peanuts and beans and also to buy minor supplies and equipment for farming, exclusively at the grand marketplace of Koutiala City. Following the off-season, the harvests are stored for a certain time, so that they gain value. And then they are sold at the grand marketplace of Koutiala and in surrounding marketplaces at the retail level (often wholesale), in cash transactions and on credit in a few rare instances. Customers come generally from large cities. After selling their agricultural products, the group members each intend to realize a profit of 50,000 that will be use to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, equipment, and supplies

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Aku N. est une femme de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de pains à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Aku exerce ce commerce  depuis 3 ans. Avec ce crédit Aku souhaite  construire un four pour la production du pain. Ce faisant elle augmentera ses recettes et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aku N. is a 47-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three. She is a bread seller in Avetonou, a village located about 100 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this business for three years. With this loan, she would like to construct an oven for making bread. Once done, she will increase her receipts and consequently improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an oven and to buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Labiba

texts.en:
Labiba is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Labiba has been doing embroideries for twenty-seven years. She also sews. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and thread, as well as to pay for her children's school tuition. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

Her previous loans helped her improve her work. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided to start her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and thread and to pay her children's tuition

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 26-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his parents. Marwan has owned a mobile shop for one year and is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new mobile phones and phone accessories for his shop. This is the first time that Marwan has requested a loan. 

Marwan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have very much money but he decided on this line of business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase new mobile phones and accessories for his mobile shop.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia V. is from the town of Cabatuan. She is 54 years old. Nelia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns and operates a business making and selling fried foods in the local community. Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman someday.

About ASKI:

ASKI, a Kiva partner, is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Урунов Махмадали в возрасте 28 лет, живет в районе Турсунзаде. Махмадали женат, имеет 3 детей.Наш клиент занимается земледелием более 5 лет, плюс он работает рабочим на стройке. Т.к. его работа на стройке не поятоянная, он решил заняться земледелием. Махмадали хочет взять кредит для посева риса.  Он планирует купить семена и удобрения.
texts.en:
Mahmadali U. is 28 years old, he lives in the the Tursun-Zoda region. Mahmadali is married and has three children. He is in agriculture for more than five years plus he works in construction. Because his construction job in not permanent, he decided to start doing agriculture. Mahmadali wants to take out a loan to sow rice. He plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah S. currently sells smoked fish and is requesting a loan to stock more fish for sale in order to enhance her business. She is 20 years old and married to a man who is a builder. Sarah does not have children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs including economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Alassane A. est revendeur de vêtements à Womé, un village situé à environ 140 kilomètres de Lomé. Agé de 43 ans, il est marié et père de 2 garçons. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 6 ans. Alassane souhaite avec ce troisième crédit, augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Alassane est n bon client car les emprunts qu’il a contractés sont remboursés à temps sans retard. Il est dans la photo avec une cliente.
texts.en:
Alassane A. resells clothes in Womé, a village located approximately 140 kilometers from Lomé. He's 43 years old, married, and the father of two boys. He's been running his business for 6 years. Alassane wishes to use this third loan to bolster his business. Alassane is a good client since his previous loans were repaid on time. He's seen in the photograph with one customer.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell clothes

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en: Ekow D. is married with two children and has received an education through junior high school. He works as a taxi driver and trader selling engine oil for boats in Cape Coast, which he has done since 2008. His wife makes her living as a fishmonger. Ekow uses his income to pay for utilities, school fees and food for his family. He will use the loan to purchase more engine oil to sell to the fishermen and with the new profits from his expanded business Ekow plans to build more houses.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell to fishermen

loans.name: Pious

texts.en: Pious A. is married with 3 children and has received an education through junior high school. Since 2000, Pious has worked as a photographer selling pictures at Moree near Cape Coast. While Pious is employed as a photographer, his wife works as a baker.  Pious uses his income to pay for utilities and his children’s school fees. He will use the loan to purchase additional batteries, film, glasses, envelopes, and frames, which will enhance his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Pious plans to invest in farming and housing projects.

loans.use: Additional batteries, film, glasses, envelopes, and frames

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Agé de 29 ans, komi est célibataire sans enfants. il est à son deuxième crédit et les remboursements sont bien exécutés. Il souhaite avec ce nouveau crédit acheter une nouvelle moto et passé la première à son frère. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Komi A. is a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé. He's 29 years old, unmarried and without children. He's seeking his second loan, the previous one was repaid without problems. With this new loan, he wishes to buy a new motorcycle and give the old one to his brother. He counts on this opportunity to improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce d’articles de mercerie, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2006 et s’approvisionne  au grand marché de lomé. Actuellement  elle veut augmenter  son  stock et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 6 pièces de doublure, des fils et d’autres articles de couture.
Elle est mariée et mère de d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman whose business consists in selling sewing supplies. She started this business in 2006, and gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. At this time, she'd like to bolster her stock and she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 6 pieces of linings, thread, and other sewing items. She's married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 pieces of linings, thread, and other sewing items

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.ru: Калонов Икромиддин проживает  вгороде Турсун-заде. Возраст41 год, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет работает водителем такси. Кроме того он занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Откормив бычка , купленного на кредит он сможет продать по более выгодной цене. Это поможет ему улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
K. Ikromiddin lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 41 years old, is married and has four children. He has been working as a taxi driver for 15 years now. In addition, he raises livestock. He has turned to us for a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. After fattening the bull that he purchases on credit he will be able to sell it at a more profitable price. This will help him to improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo A. est un jeune homme de 30 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. son commerce a le vent en poupe. Il souhaite avec ce crédit, réalimenter son  magasin afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodzo A., age 30, is married and the father of one child. He owns a grocery store in Womé, a village located northwest of Lomé, the capital of Togo. His business is doing very well. With this loan, he wishes to resupply his store in order to meet customer demand. He counts on this opportunity to improve the standard of living of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To resupply his store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the town of Cabatuan. She is 46 years old, and married with 2 adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the primary source of income for the business comes from selling pork products in the local community. 

Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

“Only through patience an entrepreneur is able to be successful,” says Josephine. 


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Lwiza

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania!  This is  Lwiza M. from Mbeya. She is 43 years old, and married  with 5 children between the ages of 15 and 25.

Lwiza, an orphan, has been running a genge business since 1995. A genge (grocery store) is typically a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

Lwiza works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days a week.  Lwiza currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $300 in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. 

Lwiza thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, through micro-leasing. The organization supports the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca M. is married with 4 dependents.  She has received an education through junior high school. Rebecca sells fried plantain chips at Siwdo, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a mechanic. Rebecca uses her income to pay for school fees, utilities and food. She will use the loan to purchase more plantain to increase her trade. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain to increase her trade.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un jeune homme de 31 ans, marié et père d’une petite fille. Il est compté parmi les meilleurs menuisiers de sa localité. Pour mieux exécuter ses travaux et satisfaire aux commandes de sa clientèle, Komi désire avec ce crédit acheter des matériaux de travail et des planches pour l’exécution de ses œuvres. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi A., age 31, is married and the father of a little girl. He's among the best carpenters in his village. To improve his work and execute his customers' orders, Komi wishes to use this loan to buy work materials and planks to realize his works. This will enable him to increase his income to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials and planks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread. She is requesting a loan to open up a resturant. She is 21 years old and her husband is a builder. They have two children, a boy and a girl: both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Susan hopes to be able to build a house for the family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a restaurant business.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Орифджон проживает в городе Турсун-заде. По профессии экономист , но работает водителем такси. Занимается разведением крупно и мелко рогатого скота. Кредит планирует использовать для покупки овец и коз. Орифджон женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 26 лет. Опыт работы в данной сфере около пяти лет.
texts.en:
Orifjon A. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is an economist by profession, but works as a taxi driver. He also breeds large and small cattle. He plans to use the loan to buy sheep and goats. Orifjon is married and has two children. He is 26 years old. He has about five years of experience in this field.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi A. is 46 years old and she is a widow with six children. She sells women's shoes to her customers. She is hoping for a loan of 40,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more women's shoes to sell

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 16 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in weekly rural markets and fishing areas for resale in town

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla A. est âgé de 34 ans, mariée et père de 3 enfants. Komla réside à Wome, où il fait des pépinières des jeunes plants. Il revend ces derniers aux cultivateurs et organisations. Ses plants sont très sollicités par la population à cause de l’entretien qu’il donne à ses jeunes plants. Komla est à son deuxième crédit et les remboursements ont été réguliers.
texts.en:
Komla A., 34, is married and the father of 3 children. Komla resides in Wome, where he has nurseries with young plants. He sells them to farmers and organizations. His plants are very much in demand because he takes such care in raising them. Komla is on his second loan and his reimbursements have been regular.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of soil amendments and fast-growing plants

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Leizel is 22 years old.  She is married to Norlito L.. Her husband is a driver. They have two children, Christopher Joshua who is 4 years old and Christian Jade who is 2 years old. Though her two children have not started school, Leizel manages her store well to provide for her family’s needs, helping her husband earn income for their children’s future. The Larzaro live happily in Barangay Del Pilar Cabatuan Isabela. 

Leizel operates a typical general store, that is only a few months old, in their village. Her weekly net income from her business is PHP 700 --just enough to cover their daily basic necessities. Leizel decided to request a loan for PHP 8,000 from ASKI. She will use this loan to purchase additional working capital for her general store. She hopes to see her business prosper through the help of the loan. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for selling.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Zuhura A. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children, between the ages of 4 and 10. Zuhura has been running a soft drinks business since 2006. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Zuhura currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more inventory. In the future, she plans to open another business. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Emina

texts.en: Emina Junuzović was born in 1963. She is married and has a six year old son. Her husband is employed and also, together with Emina, works hard in agriculture. Emina has been our client for a long time; this will be her fifth loan with WWI. Emina’s three loans were for producing vegetables and the fourth loan was to start a business with poultry. Emina decide to request another loan from WWI in amount of 3000 KM to build the poultry office.

loans.use: To build poultry office.

loans.name: Noly

texts.en:
Noly D. provides cargo transport services to local community members. He is 28 years old and single from the village of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Noly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Noly is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional business capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines, committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socioeconomic development and holistic transformation.

(Noly is wearing white sando)

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. has been working as a painter and car sprayer at Siwdo, near Cape Coast, since 2005. He is married with seven dependents. He received an education through junior high school. While John works as a painter, his wife is employed as a seamstress. He is responsible for paying bills and providing food for his family. His loan will be used to buy more paints for his shop and spraying materials for his work. He hopes to reinvest the profits in his business.

loans.use: To buy paints and spraying materials

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Разоков Гулом проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 31 год, женат и имеет троих детей. Работает водителем такси. Автомобиль его собственный  , нуждается в ремонте , поэтому для этого он решил получить кредит  и купить автозапчасти.Если он не произведет ремонт своевременно его семья останется без дохода. Кредит поможет ему обеспечить себя работой и доходом.
texts.en:
Gulom R. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. He works as a taxi driver. He uses own car and it is in need of repairs and this is why he has decided to apply for a loan to buy auto parts. If he does not make the repairs on time his family will be left without income. The loan will help provide him with work and income.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy auto parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fanie

texts.en:
Fanie F. sells personal home products to tourists and local community members. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from this business. She believes that "a person who has the strong determination will land on success but a coward once will remain stagnant." Fanie is 28 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya.

Fanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Fanie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the revenue to expand her business.

About ASKI:ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socioeconomic development and holistic transformation.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase personal home products to sell

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo A. est revendeuse de bouillie au borde de la route à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. cette activité est sa seule source de revenus. Adzo désire vivement avec ce crédit relancer son activité en achetant des sacs de maïs et de mil pour l’exécution de son activité.
texts.en:
Adzo A. sells porridge along the road in Wome, a village situated about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. At 33, she is married and the mother of 2 children. This business is her only source of revenue. Adzo yearns to use this loan to get her little business going strong again by buying some sacks of maize and millet to use for her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize and millet to use in making porridge to sell

loans.name: Tajudeen

texts.en: Tajudeen M. makes furniture like chairs, tables, cabinets, etc. He is 34 years old and married with two children. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 nairas to purchase more materials to make furniture. He says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Rukia M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single with two children aged 15 and 17. Rukia has been running a used-clothing business since 2006. She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week. Rukia currently earns about $200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional clothes. In the future, she plans to open another business. Rukia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA, a Kiva partner, has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 17 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The 5 members of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. That group has been subdivided in groups of 5 to facilitate management. The groups are created by the affinity of the women themselves.

They have various money-earning ventures and help their husbands support their respective families. The group finances itself through an internal dues system but with the loan from IMCEC, it finds greater financial input and a short term for the financing of their businesses. Most of the women have little stands in the central open-air market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local products in the rural weekly markets and fishing areas for resale in town

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi A. est un jeune homme de 38 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Il exerce cette activité de puis qu’il a quitté les bancs de l’école. Koffi souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto et de bailler la première à une tiers personne qui est tenue de lui verser des mensualités. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses recettes et par conséquent honorer ses engagements et dégager des profits pour la survie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi A. is a young man of 38, married and the father of 2 children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Wome. He has been working at this job ever since he left school.

Koffi hopes to use this loan to buy a new motorbike and rent out his present one to a third party who would pay him by the month. This would allow him to increase his earnings and thus pay what he owes and have profit left over for the survival of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
“Achieving success is hard, but if we commit ourselves and everything to God, it will not be hard to achieve,” says Loida G.. Loida helps her husband with their farm and also manages a hog raising business at home. They also maintain a fish pond where they are able to produce some of their daily food. It also serves as an alternative source of income. 

Loida is 54 years old and happily married to Benedicto G.. They have been blessed with six wonderful children. Their children are Lobella - 31 years old college graduate, Khristine - 30 years old, Julix - 28 years old college graduate, Micah - 26 years old Criminology graduate, Aulix Ronald - 24 years old college graduate, and the youngest is Shusmitha, who is 13 years old and a high school student. 

Loida is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional feed and agricultural supplies needed to maintain their hog raising and farming businesses. She is hoping that her loan request will be approved. Through membership in the ASKI microfinance program, she has learned how to manage her money wisely and how to save for the future. She is thankful for the many benefits that ASKI has provided for the welfare of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socioeconomic development and holistic transformation.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael O. sells spare parts like bolts, nuts and chains at Siwdo near Cape Coast. He is married with three children and has received an education through junior high school. While Michael works as a trader, his wife is employed as a seamstress. He is responsible for paying for school fees, utilities and food. His loan will be used to buy more spare parts for selling. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to add to his capital which will help him expand his trade.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for selling

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Agé de 34 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. il souhaite avec ce crédit payer une nouvelle moto étant donner que celle qu’il utilise est complètement amortie. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou A. is a motorbike taxi driver in Wome. At 34 years of age, he is married and the father of one child. He hopes to use this loan to buy a new motorbike since the one he is using is completely written off. He is counting on this chance to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Mahadia

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Mahadia H. A. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 9 and 19. Mahadia has been running a poultry business since 2007. She works at the business for three to five hours per day, seven days per week. Mahadia currently earns about $200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to open another business. Mahadia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Bolaji

texts.en: Bolaji O. is 34 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions like noodles, toothpaste, brushes, detergent, etc. She is requesting a loan for the amount of N40,000 to purchase more to provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta A. has been selling cooked beans and fried plantain at Siwdo, near Cape Coast, since 2001. She is married and has three children. Her husband is employed as a mechanic. She has received an education through senior high school. Benedicta uses her income to pay for utilities and food for her family. She will use this loan to purchase more ripe plantain, beans and other ingredients to increase her food production. With the profits from her expanded business, Benedicta plans to help her husband complete their family house.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food production

loans.name: Tima

texts.en: Tima is 28 years old and comes from Klokotnica, a big village near the town of Doboj. Unfortunately, she became a widow very young and raises her son and daughter alone. She works in a bakery in shifts. In the time that she isn't at her job she works in agriculture. We followed the progress of Tima's business for the last four years because she is our long-time client. She plants cucumbers in season but her basic business is poultry. Tima has worked a lot in the past years to develop this business and she has decided to build a poulterer. She requested loan from WWI, a Kiva partner, in amount of 3000 KM to invest in her business.

loans.use: To build a poulterer

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Since 2003, Felix A. has made car seats in Siwdo near Cape Coast. He is single with no children and has received an education through junior high school.  He is responsible for paying for utilities and food. His loan will be used to buy more cushions and other materials to enhance his work. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into his enterprise and improve the quality of his work.

loans.use: To buy more cushions and other materials to enhance his work

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi A. est une jeune femme de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. elle est revendeuse de sacs au marché de Wome. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 3 ans. Afi est à son deuxième crédit et souhaite avec ce dernier acheter des marchandises pour la relance de son activité. Son secteur est prospère à cause de la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Afi A. is a young woman of 25, married and the mother of one child. She sells carry-alls and bags in the market in Wome. She has been in this line of business for 3 years.

Afi is on her second loan and wishes to use this one to buy merchandise to get her business going strong again. Her sector is remunerative because of ever-growing demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags for resale

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables, fish, costume jewelry, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Amina A

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Amina A. A. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is 8 years old. Amina has been running a secretarial-service business since 2006. She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week. Amina currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a computer for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Amina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her business

loans.name: Rozelyn

texts.en:
Rozelyn has been engaged in selling glutinous rice snacks and refreshments for almost two years. She is able to generate an average net income of 800 PHP per week. Her income is used to meet her family’s basic daily needs. She has also been able to save a small amount for her children’s education. She plans to build a village store in the future; thus, she strives hard in her current business.

Rozelyn has a partner who is working in Manila. They are not yet married because of financial problems. They have a son named Isaiah Joery, who is 10 months old. According to Rozelyn, they are planning to get married as soon as they can earn enough money for their wedding ceremony.

Rozelyn is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI to use for additional working capital for her snack vending business. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more ingredients. By making more items to sell, she will be able to satisfy more customers and increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. A. has been a mechanic, specializing in the working of metal parts for both machines and vehicles, since 1989. He is married with four dependants. He works in Siwdo, near Cape Coast, and has received an education through junior high school. His wife works as a trader in the same area.
Emmanuel uses his income to pay for utilities and food for his family. He will use this loan to purchase welding materials to improve his metal works. With the profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to complete the house which he is putting up for his family.

loans.use: To purchase welding materials

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie R. is from the town of Cauayan, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Emelie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emelie owns and operates a business selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members.

Emelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is a pioneer micro-finance institution in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old and a married mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and members of the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Erlinda joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines, committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel E. L. is married with three children and has received an education to senior high school level. Since 1995 he has worked as an auto electrician, selling electrical parts at Siwdo, near Cape Coast. His wife works as a trader in the same area. Samuel is responsible for paying for utilities and food. His loan will be used to buy more auto electrical parts for resale and he hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest into his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more auto electrical parts for resale

loans.name: Olaide

texts.en: Olaide is 45 years old and married with four children. He sells bags of cassava flour, and is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of cassava flour to sell. He sends his thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est propriétaire d’un magasin d’alimentation générale à Wome. Agé de 26 ans, Kokou est marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il est à son deuxième crédit et les remboursements du précédent crédit ont été bien exécutés. Kokou désire avec accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Kokou A. owns a grocery store in Wome. At 26, Kokou is married and the father of a little boy. He is on his second loan and the repayments on the first loan were made in a timely manner. Kokou wants to expand his business by buying more merchandise for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying inventory for his general store

loans.name: Issa's Group

texts.en:
The photo shows teachers of one of Makeni’s primary schools, built in 1991 by missionaries to help educate orphans in and around the city. The school has a total of 18 staff and 255 pupils.

Issa K. (first row right), 48, is the headmaster of the facility. Born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone, he is the married father of six children – four in secondary schools and two in primary schools. Mr. K. has been a teacher for over 20 years now. He is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

Teachers are amongst the lowest paid groups in Sierra Leone. Consequently, many find additional means of earning a living, some engaging in businesses, agriculture, or organized extra classes for the pupils (the latter of which the government is trying to abolish). Teachers therefore seek loans to embark on meaningful projects and then gradually repay the loans out of their monthly salaries.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 20 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou A. est conducteur de taxi à Wome. Agé de 48 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il désire avec ce crédit faire la révision générale de sa voiture et payer un nouveau moteur. Il avait déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à la FECECAV et avait promptement honoré son engagement. Ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Kokou A. is a taxi driver in Wome. At 48 years of age, he is married and the father of 3 children. He wants to use this loan to have his car overhauled and pay for a new motor. He has already had a loan from FECECAV and promptly repaid it. This loan will allow him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: have his taxi overhauled and pay for a new motor

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en:
Bukola is 33 years old and married with two children. She sells planks.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Rose B. est une jeune femme de 25 ans mariée sans enfants. elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome. Dans son magasin, rose installe divers articles. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, elle souhaite réapprovisionner sa boutique. Les remboursements de son premier crédit ont été promptement effectués. Rose compte sur cette aubaine afin de réaliser ses ambitions.
texts.en:
Rose B. is a young woman of 25, married with no children yet. She owns a grocery store in Wome. In her store, Rose sells various items. With this second loan from FECECAV, she hopes to replenish her inventory. She made her repayments on the first loan in a timely manner. Rose is counting on this chance to realize her dreams.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: replenish her inventory

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 13 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou D. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Agé de 32 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. il exerce cette activité depuis 2 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit payer une nouvelle moto étant donner que celle qu’il utilise est désuète. Il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokou D. is a motor-taxi driver in Wome. Aged 32, he is married and the father of one child. He has been in this line of work for 2 years. He hopes to use this loan to buy a new motorbike since the one he has been using is worn out. He is counting on this chance to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Jemilat

texts.en:
Jemilat is 42 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions and drinks.

She is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Greetings from U. Clarisse, a 33-year-old woman married to one husband. They live together in Gasabo district, Remera sector, in Kigali city capital of Rwanda. Clarisse has four children: 11, 10, 7 and 2 years old. Her husband doesn’t produce an income.

Clarisse operates her business of selling clothes. She is now seeking a loan of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. She does not have an employee in her business and she has been running the same business for five years.

Every day, Clarisse starts work at 8:00 a.m. and finishes at  8:00 p.m.. Before she obtained a loan, she used to get a monthly profit of $180. With this loan, she intends to expand her business and, from the extra profits, she will have enough savings to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista K., 50, is a friendly and hard-working lady who has been selling produce from Kabweza Kako Trading Centre since 1974. Purchasing her produce from local farmers and selling from her stall, she is happy with her business but at times faces challenges such as the change in seasons and increased transportation costs which ultimately force her to increase the price of her produce. She is grateful that her customers stand by her throughout these difficulties, an indication of the good relationship she has with them.

Teopista is the married mother of six children, two in secondary school and the rest at the University, each also working part-time. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more produce to increase her earnings. Receiving loans has improved her life and business since she is now able to earn monthly profits ranging from 100,000 – 150,000 shillings. She has dreams of educating all her children to the University level and completing her family house.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale.

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 12 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women in this group have been connected trough neighborly relations for a long time. They belong to a federation of all women in the city of Thiès. This group has been subdivided in groups of five to facilitate management. Groups are created based on affinity, by the women themselves. They run various money-making businesses, and help their husbands support their respective family. The group used to financed itself through an internal tontine (a traditional community revolving savings and loan group), but with the loan from Kiva's partner, IMCEC, it gains access to a larger funding in a shorter amount of time to finance its activities. Most women have stalls at the central market in Thiès, where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, fabrics, ...

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables, fish, jewelry, fabrics, ...

loans.name: Dumitru

texts.en:
P. Dumitru, together with his family of four, makes a living raising pigs and growing vegetables. Starting in spring, he makes the trip into the city before sunrise every day to offer his peppers, cucumbers, watermelons, potatoes and pumpkins to the farmers’ market’s first wave of shoppers. It has enabled him to bring his spring crops to market earlier at considerably higher prices.

In April of this year he received a third loan in the amount of 25,000 MDL for a term of 12 months. It is financing construction of another animal shelter and the purchase of a tractor that will serve as the new means of transportation to the produce market. He thanks Microinvest for giving him the opportunity to grow.

loans.use: To construct another animal shelter and purchase a tractor

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 60-year-old Mariam M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 42 and 46. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Mariam has been running an Irish potatoes business since 1999, purchasing and selling Irish potatoes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $50 a month. Mariam is requesting a loan in order to cultivate Irish potatoes. In the future, she plans to farm potatoes in larger quantities. She thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To cultivate Irish potatoes

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla D. est un homme de 53 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. la bonne gestion de son magasin lui fait croitre son chiffre d’affaire au cours de ces derniers temps. Pour mieux répondre aux attentes de la population, Komla désire avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, réalimenter sa boutique.
texts.en:
Komla D. is a 53 year old man, married with 5 children. He is the owner of a general food store in Wome, a village located about 130 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. The good management of his store has allowed him to increase his sales over the course of the past few months. To better respond to the expectations of the population, Komla would like to resupply his store with this third loan through FECECAV.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his store

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi D. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome depuis 3 ans. Cette activité est sa principale source de revenus.  Sa bonne gestion lui a permis de rembourser rapidement son crédit. Bien que sa moto n’est pas encore usée, elle désire contracter un nouveau prêt afin d’acquérir une nouvelle moto. il souhaite passer la première à son petit frère. Cette chance leur permettra de changer les conditions de vie de leur famille.
texts.en:
Koffi D. is a young man aged 35, married with 2 children. He has been driving a motorcycle taxi in Wome for 3 years. This activity is his principal source of income. His good management has allowed him to repay his loans rapidly. Although his motorcycle is not yet worn out, he would like to take out a new loan in order to acquire a new motorcycle. He hopes to hand down his first motorcycle to his younger brother. This opportunity will allow them to change their family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 11 Group
