texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women who are members of this group have been linked by ties of neighbourhood for a long time. They are in a federal group made up of all the women in the town of Thiès. This group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to make administration easier. These sub-groups are created by the women themselves, based on affinity. They run various revenue-generating activities and support their husbands in taking care of their respective family expenses. The group finances itself through an internal tontine, but a loan through IMCEC allows for more significant financial means and a shorter delay in financing their businesses. The majority of them of have small displays at the central market in the town of Thiès, where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, fabric, etc.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local products at the weekly rural markets and fishing areas for resale in town

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en:
Kayode O. is 45 years old and married with four children. He sank a bore hole locally to sell water. He has two rubber water tanks which he uses to store the water. However, recently one of the rubber tanks got broken into pieces. This has reduced his sale of water. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 nairas to purchase another rubber water tank to enable him sell water to his customers.
He says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase one rubber water tank

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en: Waheed O. is 48 years old and married with four children. He sells medicines and provisions. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Rafiatou D. est une jeune femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. elle est  propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome. Elle désire avec ce second crédit de FECECAV alimenter son magasin afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Rafiatou compte sur cette opportunité pour donner une vie meilleure à sa famille.
texts.en:
Rafiatou D. is a young woman aged 29, married with one child. She is the owner of a general food store in Wome. With this second loan through FECECAV, she would like to supply her shop in order to better respond to the demands of her clientele. Rafiatou is counting on this opportunity to give her family a better life.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 36 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Iberica Karel

texts.es:
La señora Iberica Karel P. Q. tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta el 3ro de Secundaria, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Iberica se dedica a la venta de verduras y carne en un puesto ubicado cerca a su casa, también tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio. Su negocio lo inició con la venta de verduras, esto por las mañanas; luego puso su tienda de abarrotes para generarse más ingresos.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de carne (pollo) para su venta.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y compra de bebidas gaseosas.
Iberica tiene como sueño surtir su bodega y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Iberica Karel P. Q. is 33 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, province of Ascope, in La Libertad, Perú.  She studied until the 3rd year of Secondary school, and has 1 daughter that depends on her financially. Iberica dedicates herself to the sale of vegetables and meat from a stand located near her house. She also runs a small general store out of her home. Her business started with the sale of vegetables during the morning; later, she installed her grocery store in order to generate additional income. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her cooperative bank, Fighting Romans II, she invested in the purchase of meat (poultry) to sell. She plans to invest this loan of 1500 Peruvian soles into the purchase of ingredients to make food as well as into soft drinks. Iberica’s dreams are to stock her store with merchandise and to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food and soft drinks.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos E. F. tiene 43 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Santos  se dedica a la venta de cerveza y en los fines de semana vente comida rápida, al inicio se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza, encontrando mas adelante un negocio más rentables en la venta de cerveza, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos (yuca, arroz, cebolla, limones).
Con este crédito de 1700 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza al por mayor.
Santos tiene como sueño terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Santos E. F. is 43 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, province of Ascope, in La Libertad, Perú.  She completed her Secondary school education, and has 1 daughter that depends on her financially. Santos dedicates herself to selling beer, and on weekends she sells fast food. She started out selling beauty products, but later found the sale of beer to be more profitable. She runs her business out of her home. With the first loan she received from her cooperative bank Fighting Romans II, she invested in the purchase of ingredients for making food (yucca, rice, onion, lemons). With this loan of 1700 soles, she will invest in the purchase of beer at wholesale. Santos’ dream is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer.

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo is 47 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuffs like elubo. Elubo is made from yam or plantain peel and it is used in the preparation of amala. Amala is a staple food in Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr:
N. V. Lucienne est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Lucienne est mariée à DAGA Richard. Lucienne est mère de trois (3) enfants. Lucienne n'a jamais été à l'école, ni appris un métier. Lucienne a été élevée par ses parents et aidait sa mère dans la vente de maïs et de l'huile végétale. Après son mariage, Lucienne s'était lancée dans la vente de bouillie de maïs. Actuellement, Lucienne vend la même chose que sa mère, mais pour son propre compte. Lucienne a déjà eu deux prêts de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Lucienne sollicite un troisième crédit présentement pour s'approvisionner en une importante quantité de maïs et d'huile de noix de palme afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Lucienne N. V. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Lucienne is married to Richard Daga. Lucienne is the mother of three children. Lucienne never went to school, nor did she learn a professional trade. Lucienne was raised by her parents and helped her mother sell maize and vegetable oil. After getting married, Lucienne began selling maize bouillie (a thick cornmeal porridge). Currently, Lucienne sells the same things as her mother, but for herself. Lucienne has already obtained two loans through Alidé to develop her business. Lucienne is currently seeking a third loan to supply herself with a sizable quantity of corn and oil from palm nuts in order to better respond to the needs of her clientele. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its per capita income is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of maize and 2 50-litre cans of palm nut oil

loans.name: Teodora Justina

texts.es:
La señora Teodora  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada sin hijos, vive en el Jr. Vilca Apaza  285, ella posee  estudios hasta 5to de primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace ½ año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de jugos de frutas, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles con el que compró mas fruta para atender su negocio.
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero comprará mas fruta e insumos, y así poder hacer crecer su negocio.  Además quiere seguir trabajando y aumentar su capital para empezar a vender golosinas.  Con esto obtendría más ingresos.

Le gustaría  comprarse una casa muy bonita para estar tranquila, y poner una jugueria grande.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta la puntualidad de las demás socias y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the “Aswancaris II” cooperative bank, in the province of Azangaro, Puno. She is 43 years old, and is married but has no children. She studied until the 5th grade. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for ½ year, and the activity she dedicates herself to is fruit juice sales. Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles, with which she bought more fruit for her business. Currently, she hopes for an additional loan of 600 soles with which she will buy more fruit and supplies to help her grow the business. In addition, she would like to keep working and augment her capital to start selling sweets/snacks. With this, she would increase her income. She would like to buy herself a lovely house in which to live serenely and start a large juice-making enterprise. Likewise, she notes that she likes how punctual the other members are and being able to save.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit:  oranges, bananas, papaya, pineapple.

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es: El señor Wilder R. C., tiene la edad de 40 años, casada, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, cursan la secundaria, su esposo vende productos lácteos. Su negocio es una pulpería pero vende también frutas y verduras, también cuenta con alquiler de video. Inicio con ahorros y vendía ambulantes verduras, con este préstamo es su segundo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de granos básicos y comida para cachorros que se vende bastante. Sus planes es poder hacer crecer su inventario cada día ofertando a sus clientes la variedad de productos. Sus metas como padre es poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Wilder R. C. is 40 years old, married and has two children aged 14 and 16 who attend secondary school. His wife sells dairy products.

He started up with his savings selling vegetables as a street vendor. Now his main business is a grocery store, but he also sells fruits and vegetables and offers videos for rent.

This will be his second loan cycle; he will use the money to purchase basic grains and puppy food, which sells well. His plans are to be able to increase his inventory every day so that he can offer his customers a variety of products.

His goal as a father is to be able to provide his children with a good education so that they grow up to be good people.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and puppy food

loans.name: Madeling Virginia

texts.es: Madeling trabaja como contadora de Banpro desde hace 3 años, vive en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea,  ella tiene un niño de 3 años y cuenta con el apoyo su esposo, quien trabaja en la finca y apoya con los gastos del hogar, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar y pintar la casa) y asi brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo. Madeling se caracteriza por ser una  joven, responsable, honesta, trabajadora con alto espiritu de superación personal y profesional, se encarga del cuido de sus padres y de los gastos familiares y a pesar que no vive con ellos siempre esta pendiente de los gastosque puedan tener, pues son personas de escasos recursos económicos. Sueña con estudiar una maestria y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Madeling has worked as an accountant for Banpro for the past three years. She lives in Zone 6 of Nueva Guinea and has a 3-year-old son. She counts on the support of her husband, who works off the land and helps with family expenses. She is requesting her second loan to invest in improving her home (replaster the walls, paint the house) and thus provide better living conditions for her son. Madeling is a young, responsible and hard-working women with a strong desire for personal and professional improvement. She is in charge of caring for her parents and family expenses despite not living with them. She always helps when she can because they have limited economic resources. She dreams of studying for a degree and having job stability so she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replaster the walls and repaint the house

loans.name: Maritza Agripina

texts.es:
La señora Maritza  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia D. Azangaro, departamento D. Puno, tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo, vive en Jr. Horacio zeballos con la Av. Circunvalación, ella posee estudios D. 5to grado D. primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 meses, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.
 
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero comprará diferentes productos como son fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, gaseosas,etc.  Desea que su negocio crezca mucho mas, y le gustaría mucho tener su propia distribuidora y un carro para distribuir sus productos.

Le gustaría  tener una tienda para venta al por mayor, pero necesitaría mas capita.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucho la modalidad D. los pagos y los ahorros en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the "Punta Sahuacasi" Community Bank in the province of Azangaro, Puno, Peru. She is a 40-year-old married mother of three and has a fifth-graD. education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past five months. Maritza makes a living buying and selling groceries. Her first loan was for 500 soles, and she is currently requesting an additional loan of 600 soles, which she plans to use to buy different grocery products like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, milk, soft drinks, etc. She wishes for her business to really grow and would like it very much to have her own distribution company and a car to deliver her products. She would like to have a store that sells wholesale, but needs more capital. She also says that she really likes the system of payments and savings with her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different grocery products like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
K. Jesca is a hardworking and devoted married lady with seven children. The oldest is in university and she also cares for two orphans. She has a retail shop in Rwomuhoro Trading Centre that she has been running for ten years. She started with a very small shop which has now grown substantially.

For years she has been getting loans; this is her 16th loan. She has been able to attract many customers because she treats them well and has enough stock that is in demand. She has a goal of expanding her shop further so that she can increase her profit which is at 260,000 shillings per month now. Jesca needs this loan to be able buy more sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.use: To restock sugar, salt, soap and other products

loans.name: Ion

texts.en:
Mr. F., 32, from Edinet region has a strong ambition to run his own family business in domestic animal growing as a primary source of income. This would be a way of putting into practice the knowledge he obtained from agro-business courses. Unfortunately the realization of his ambition had to be put off for some time because he lacked the capital needed to start his business. This situation led him to make a hard decision--a decision which thousands of Moldovans have had to make--to leave his family in search of a job and better earnings abroad. With the money thus earned, he started his poultry raising business in 2003, which has grown intensively ever since.

With a loan of 30,000 MDL for 12 months from MICROINVEST in April, he built a 360 m² coop to increase his productivity. This allowed him to raise over 18,000 broiler chickens, which were sold at local and regional shops and markets. The loan will be reimbursed ahead of the repayment schedule. The profit earned will let him build auxiliary facilities to better manage his growing business.

loans.use: To expand poultry raising business

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi is 47 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and also makes popcorn with a popcorn machine. She is requesting the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Baï

texts.fr:
A. Baï est née à Bohicon dans le Département du ZOU. Baï est veuve et mère de cinq (5) enfants, tous majeurs. Baï n’est jamais allée à l'école. Baï a été élevée par ses propres géniteurs. Baï vendait de savons traditionnels avec sa mère. Après son mariage, Baï s’est lancée dans la restauration populaire à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Baï vend en effet du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de maïs  et de causette d’igname; le tout accompagné de différentes sauces telles que les sauces d’arachide, de tomate, de sésame, de noix de palme et de gombo. Baï a eu de ALIDé  deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés  et avec lesquels elle a amené son activité à un stade supérieur. Aujourd’hui, Baï sollicite un troisième prêt pour faire ses provisions en gros à Tokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Baï A. was born in Bohicon in the Department of Zou. Baï is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom are grown up. Baï never went to school. Baï was raised by her own parents. Baï used to sell traditional soaps with her mother. After getting married, Baï began a catering business in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Baï sells rice, beans, maize paste, and yam chips; all of these are accompanied by various sauces such as peanut sauce, tomato sauce, sesame sauce, palm nut sauce, and okra sauce. Baï has obtained two loans through Alidé that she repaid properly, and with which she has taken her business to a higher level. Currently, Baï is seeking a third loan to obtain her supplies in bulk at Tokpa, the large international market of Benin. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its per capita GDP is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg bags of rice and two 25-litre cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.es: Don Ronaldo trabaja como guarda de seguridad desde hace 11 años, tiene 2 hijos los estudiando, el mayor de 16 años estudia su cuarto año de Educacion primaria y la niña de 14 años estudia su segundo año en el instuto Ruben Dario,su esposa trabaja como tecnica de MiFamilia la cual aporta y ayuda a su marido con los gastos familiares, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construir una  vivienda), a pesar que el salario que este devenga es poco ha  luchado para que a su familia no le falte lo básico en el  hogar, como tambien el en sus dias libres se dedica a sembrar diversos cultivos, y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el es un hombre trabajador, responsable y anhela un porvenir mejor,  ama su trabajo, se siente agradecido con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde  vive con su esposa, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Ronaldo has worked as a security guard for the past 11 years. He has two children in school; the eldest is 16 in his fourth year of high school and his daughter is 14 and is in her second year at the Ruben Dario Institute. His wife works as a technical expert at MiFamilia and supports him with family expenses. Ronaldo is requesting his seventh loan and plans to invest it in the improvement of his home (build a room). Despite his small salary, he has fought so that his family doesn't lack the basics in their home, and in his free time he also plants diverse crops and tries to improve the living conditions. He is a hard-working and responsible man who's goal is to make the future better. He loves his work and is grateful to Kiva partner AFODENIC whose previous loans have helped him buy household appliances and improve the bedroom he shares with his wife. His goal is to have a beautiful home and works hard so his children can make headway.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in his home

loans.name: Morgiane

texts.fr:
G. Morgiane est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Morgiane est mariée à DANKPENON André, soudeur de profession. Morgiane est mère de deux enfants. Morgiane a abandonné très tôt l’école pour apprendre la couture. La couture qu’elle n’a exercée que pour trois (3) ans seulement. En effet, c’est des produits vivriers que Morgiane  vend actuellement. Morgiane vend des sacs de  maïs et de farine de manioc ainsi que des fruits de saison. Morgiane a eu déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Morgiane veut acheter et stocker de maïs pendant que c’est moins cher, pour ensuite le revendre plus chers quand le prix va grimper. C’est pour cette raison que Morgiane sollicite de ALIDé un troisième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Morgiane G. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Morgiane is married to André Dankpenon, a welder by profession. Morgiane is the mother of two children. Morgiane abandoned her education very early on in order to learn to be a dressmaker. She was a dressmaker for only three years. Indeed, it is the sale of staple foods that Morgiane works in currently. Morgiane sells bags of maize and manioc flour as well as seasonal fruit. Morgiane has already obtained two loans through Alidé, which she repaid properly. Morgiane would like to buy and stock maize when it is cheaper, and then to sell it when the price climbs. It is for this reason that Morgiane is seeking a third loan through Alidé. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 24 bags of maize

loans.name: Bethy Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Bethy Consuelo G. R.  tiene 59 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Bethy se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, productos que los vende en su salón de belleza, al inicio tenia un salón de belleza pequeño, ahora su negocio ha ampliado, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza y exhibidores.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, invertirá en la compra de gel, líquidos y tintes para cabello.
Bethy tiene como sueño ampliar su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Señora Bethy Consuelo G. R. is 59 years of age and lives in the Florencia Mora District of Trujillo Province, Department of Libertad, Peru. She has a full secondary school education and has one son whom she supports financially. Bethy's business is selling beauty products which she sells in her beauty salon. Originally she had a small shop. Now her business, which she operates out of her home, has grown.

The first loan of 300 Sols which she received from Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II (United for a Better Future) Communal Bank was invested in the purchase of beauty products and display cases. This loan of 800 Sols will be used to buy gels, lotions and hair dyes. Bethy has the dream of expanding her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gels, lotions and hair dyes.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Señor. Miguel C. tiene 52 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, en la ciudad de Managua, casado tiene cinco hijos todos los tiene estudiando. Los planes que posee para su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y que sus hijos preparen profesionalmente. Don Miguel de profesión técnico industrial, pero se ha hecho difícil desempeñarse en su oficio por lo cual se dedico ha iniciar su pequeño negocio de reciclajes de chatarras y otros materiales. Iniciando con  poco recurso económico. Unas de la dificultares que se encontró en el negocio es falta de financiamientos. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic ha establecido su empresa de reciclajes. Con la solicitud de un nuevo préstamo lograra comprar materiales de: hierro, zinc, etc. logrando aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel C. is 52 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood in the city of Managua. He is married and has five children, all of whom are students. His plans include improving his family’s standard of living and seeing his children prepare themselves professionally. Mr. Miguel is an industrial technician but he had a hard time finding work in his field, so he decided to start a small recycling business for scrap metal and other materials. One of the difficulties that he has run into is the lack of financing. Thanks to the loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, he has established his recycling business. With this loan he will be able to buy materials such as iron, zinc, etc., which will allow him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron and zinc

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en: Qadir R. is a young farmer of 25. He has three years of experience in this field. He is married and has one daughter. Qadir raises and breeds calves in the small village of Agsu City. He fattens his calves and later sells to local traders. Qadir requested a $1,200 loan to purchase two baby calves.

loans.use: Purchase two baby calves to expand his business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Joven Juan Carlos es  habitante de la zona # 5 de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su tercer  crédito a la institución de AFODENICpara invertirlo en construccion de los servicios higienicos y de esta forma mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar, el no tiene hijos, vive con sus ancianos padres  de escasos recursos economicos pero si son  una familia muy unida, Juan Carlos se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesto, trabajador y ha demostrado buena conducta en la sociedad, el es muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo y maestros por ser  muy humilde, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y seguir estudiando para ser un excelente  profesional con mucha experiencia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a young man who lives in Zone #5 of the Nueva Guinea neighborhood and is requesting his third loan from Kiva partner AFODENIC so he can build a bathroom, and in this way improve the conditions of his nuclear family. He has no children and lives with his elderly parents who have few financial resources, although they are a very close family. Juan Carlos is a very responsible, honest, hard-working person and has demonstrated good social conduct. He is well-liked by his coworkers and teachers because he is so humble. His dream is to be healthy, have a stable job, and finish studying so he can be an excellent professional with a lot of experience.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Ngân Nguyễn Thị is a 37-year-old woman who lives in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three small children. To make a living, Ngân owns and operates a manufacturing business. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Ngân has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Ngân joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she could help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Ngân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used as an investment in expanding the business.

Ngân is now requesting a new loan of 17,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Ngân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to continue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 42 years old and married with four children. She earns an income by making bags and clothes. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30,000, which she wishes to use to purchase more materials in order to make more bags to sell.

She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for making bags to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Phương Nguyễn Thị, 55 years old, is a woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. Phương earns a living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from raising water buffalo for sale. Phương has been engaged in this business for over seven years, and she earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Phương joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Phương has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and, eventually, to sell.

Phương is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Phương plans to use the additional revenue that she expects her business to generate from this loan to improve and expand her business ventures.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Huệ Trần Thị is a 34 year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Huệ raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Huệ has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Huệ joined TYM Fund, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Huệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Huệ is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Used to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos B. B. tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 1ro de Secundaria, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella.
Santos se dedica a la venta de ceviche (plato típico del país), esta actividad la realiza todos los días por las mañanas, y los fines de semana prepara comida variada para ofrecer a los pobladores, estos alimentos los vende en su casa y en un kiosco ubicado cerca a la iglesia de su distrito.
Recién se ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de ceviche.
Santos tiene como sueño poner su cevichería en un local más grande y propio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos B. B. is 40 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, in the province of Ascope, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the first year of secondary school and has 5 children, 2 of whom still depend financially upon her. Santos works selling ceviche (a traditional Peruvian dish), which she does every day during the morning. On the weekends she makes a variety of foods to sell to local residents. She sells her food from her house and from a kiosk located close to a neighborhood church. She has recently become a member of Kiva partner Manuela Ramos and is a member of the Fighting Romans II Communal Bank. With this loan of 300 soles she will buy ingredients to make ceviche. Santos dreams of opening her own ceviche shop in a larger location.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make ceviche

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
Ái Đặng Thị is a 30 year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Ái owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from services. Ái has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Ái joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ái has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Ái is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Ái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Berna Luz

texts.es: La Señora. Berna F. tiene 36 años de edad, Sus dos hijos estudian, habita en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es de gran ayuda en la ferretería. Doña Berna tiene su pequeño negocio de ferretería desde hace veinte  años iniciándolo con capital propio en sociedad con su esposo, además compraban cantidades pequeñas de productos e reinvertían las utilidades y pocas variedades Gracias a los prestamos en Afodenic a logrado crecer su negocio y mejorando su nivel vida. Con el prestado comprar productos como: clavos, alambres, hierros, palas, cobas, para obtener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Berna F. is 36 years old. Her two children are in school, and she lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Married, her husband is a great deal of help in the hardware store. She started 20 years ago, in partnership with her husband, using her own capital. They also bought small quantities of products which generated income that the reinvested. Thanks to the loans through Afodenic, she has managed to grow her business and improve her standard of living. With the loan, she will buy products such as: nails, wire, iron, and planks to generate better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nails, wire, iron, among other items.

loans.name: Alirza

texts.en: Alirza R. is a 60-year-old man who is a  pensioner. He raises wheat on his land with the help of his six children and wife. He believes one day his children will continue his business. He started his business more than 20 years ago. Alirza then sells the wheat to the local bread makers and local private bread factories. Alirza needs 1500 USD as a loan  to increase his business. For the loan of 1500 USD, he is going to purchase more seeds to grow and fertilizer.

loans.use: purchase more seeds to grow and fertilizer

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
M. Đặng Thị (1002060042) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To making a living, M. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. M. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. M. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to expand shelter for her livestock. This will be the 8th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business

loans.use: used to expand shelter for her livestock

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Xuân Lê Thị, 55 years old, lives in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has five adult-aged children. Xuân owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising cattle for sale. Xuân has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2005, Xuân joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Xuân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Xuân is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Xuân plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her cattle-raising business

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
A. Julienne est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à DJOTCHOU Nounangnon un pêcheur de profession. Julienne est mère de six enfants mais seulement deux (2) sont encore à sa charge. Julienne n’est jamais allée à l’école. Julienne a été élevée par sa grand-mère paternelle pour qui elle vendait de la pâte de maïs et de poissons frits. La pâte de maïs localement appelée akassa, accompagnée de piment et de poissons frits est un repas consommé par beaucoup de béninois. Après son mariage, Julienne s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité que sa grand-mère. Julienne a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé pour le compte de son activité. Julienne demande un troisième prêt à ALIDé pour acheter et stocker de maïs pendant que c’est moins cher. Ainsi, Julienne pourra faire plus de bénéfices sur ses ventes. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Julienne A. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Julienne is married to Nounangnon Djotchou, a fisherman by profession. Julienne is the mother of six children, but only two of them are still in her care. Julienne never went to school. Julienne was raised by her paternal grandmother, for whom she sold maize paste and fried fish. Maize paste, locally known as "akassa", accompanied by spices and fried fish, is a meal consumed by many Beninese. After getting married, Julienne began working on her own in the same business as her grandmother. Julienne has already benefited from two loans through Alidé on behalf of her business. Julienne is seeking a third loan from Alidé to buy and stock maize while it is cheaper. This way, Julienne will be able to make a higher profit on her sales. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, where the GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of maize and one box of fresh fish

loans.name: Bach Thi

texts.en:
L. Bạch Thi makes a living from raising a variety of seafood for sale. She is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children. L. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her situation and enable her to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. L. is now requesting a loan of 13,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

No. 1602050079.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Enoe Mercedes

texts.es: El Señora. Enoe García tiene la edad de 25 años, del barrio Batahola Sur en la capital de Managua, tiene un hijo de tres años. Unos de sus planes para corto plazo es el seguimiento de la construcción de su vivienda.Doña Enoe de profesión estilista,   estableció su propio salón de belleza en su casa de habitación, también tiene las venta de CD y DVD con un ingreso económico mas, con tres años y medio de experiencia en el ramo de belleza , ofreciendo su servicio de excelente calidad. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograra remodelar su negocio y comprar nuevos productos de belleza como: tintes, shampoo, cremas, gel y otros, brindando un buen servicio y protección a sus clientes. Las metas es aumentar las cantidades de cliente, de ventas y poder atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Enoe García is 25 years old, and lives in the Batahola Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has one son who is three years old. One of her short-term goals is to continue the construction of her home. Enoe is a stylist, having established a beauty salon in her own house. She also sells CDs and DVDs in order to generate more income. She has three and a half years of experience in the beauty salon business, offering services of excellent quality. Thanks to the loans through Afodenic, she managed to remodel her business and buy new beauty products such as: hair dyes, shampoo, creams, gel, among other items, providing good service and protection for her customers. Her goals are to grow her customer base and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair dyes, shampoo, and creams, among other products.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị, 53 years old, lives in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. T. owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing repair services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, T. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 16,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide repair services. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide repair services

loans.name: Houédanou

texts.fr:
K. Houédanou est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Houédanou est mariée à KETE Elie, cuisinier de formation. Houédanou est mère de trois(3)enfants. Houédanou n’est jamais allée à l’école. Houédanou a été élevée par sa tante qu’elle aidait à vendre de produits congelés et de nourriture. Après son mariage, Houédanou s'est lancée dans la restauration populaire. Houédanou vend du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de maïs et de causette d’igname; le tout accompagné de différentes sauces telles que les sauces d’arachide, de tomate, de sésame, de noix de palme et de gombo. Houédanou a bénéficié déjà de deux prêts à ALIDé. Avec ces deux prêts Houédanou a pu élever le niveau de son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie. Houédanou sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé pour pouvoir faire ses provisions en gros au grand marché international du Bénin. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Houédanou K. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Houédanou is married to Elie Kete, a cook by profession. Houédanou is the mother of three children. Houédanou never went to school. Houédanou was raised by her aunt, whom she helped sell frozen products and food. After getting married, Houédanou began a catering business. Houédanou sells rice, beans, maize paste, and yam chips; all of these are accompanied by different sauces, such as those made from peanuts, tomatoes, sesame, palm nuts, and okra. Houédanou has already benefited from two loans through Alidé. With these two loans, Houédanou was able to raise the level of her business and improve her living conditions. Houédanou is seeking a third loan through Alidé to be able to buy her supplies in bulk at the grand international market of Benin. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg bags of maize and two 50-kg bags of rice

loans.name: Agaqadir

texts.en:
Agaqadir M. is a 48-year-old man who sells honey in the small village of Agsu. He started his business when he was 20, continuing his family business. It is very hard and dangerous work but Agaqadir adores his bees and his job in general.

As it is the only one source of income for his family, Agaqadir makes the best honey in his village. He is married and has three sons and dreams to provide his all sons with higher education. Agaqadir has a good income from honey sales because this product is very popular among Azerbaijani people.

Agaqadir applied for a $1500 loan in order to improve his bee keeping conditions and purchase new beehives.

loans.use: To purchase new beehives

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. Tthe main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. V. has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. V. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by V. from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es: El Señor. Denis N. tiene 67 años de edad, vive en el barrio Hialeah. En la ciudad de Managua, Inicio su pequeño negocio de venta de vidrios y  aluminio. Teniendo en su mente la iniciación de un mejor y con mayor inversión la comercialización de ropas nuevas, zapatos y otros artículos de uso. Los planes para el futuro son que su negocio crezca cada día más y que mejores su nivel de vida. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic  sus proyectos de segmentarse en el mercado con su variedad de producto serán posibles. El préstamo que solicita lo requiere para la compra de: ropas para dama, ropa para caballero y niñas, articulo en las temporadas de las madres, del padre y otros días festivos en nuestro país que son días propicios para las vender, ya que las personas tienden a complacer a sus seres queridos y siempre comprar para estas fechas.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis N. is a 67-year-old man who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the city of Managua. He started his small business (glass and aluminum sales), planning on starting a better one—selling new clothing, shoes, and other products. His future plans are to make his business grow day by day, and to improve his standard of life. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, his plan of branching out into the market will be possible. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase: apparel for men, women and children, and seasonal items for mother’s and father’s day, as well as for any other festivities in this country because these are optimum days for sales as people tend to please their loved ones by buying them gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.en:
Bình Hồ Thị (1033060953) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three infant children. She owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling pork products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Bình joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Bình is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito D. Desaguadero, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; D.  52 años D. edad, estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios D. secundaria completa, vive en Barrio Misuyo.
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles. Su negocio D. venta D. golosinas.
Ahora desea sacar S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, ahora se dedica al negocio D. la repostería con lo cual comprara harina, huevos, leche, azúcar, mantequilla, polvo D. hornear, otros, para elaborar las tortas ya que trabaja a pedidos semanales. Más adelante ella quiere poner su pastelería con la apoyo D. toda la familia, así mismo desea darles una profesión a sus hijos.
A ella le gusta la forma D. ahorro, porque aprendió ahorrar  y las charlas que también les imparte Manuela Ramos
texts.en:
Ms. Julia C. is a member of the “Las Fronterizas” Microfinance Institute, located in the Dasaguadero district of the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno. She is a 52-year-old married mother with 6 children. She finished her secondary studies and lives in the Misuyo neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used for her candy business. She now wishes to borrow 500.00 PEN so that she can purchase flour, eggs, milk, sugar, butter, and baking powder so that she can bake cakes for her pastry business since she receives weekly orders. In the future, she wants to set up a cake shop with her entire family’s support, thus teaching her children a traD..

She likes to save because she learned to do so from the lectures that she received from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, eggs, milk, sugar, butter, and baking powder

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
Sơn Đặng Thị is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is widowed and has a baby. Sơn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. She sells a variety of food products in the local community. Sơn has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Sơn joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Sơn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Sơn is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Sơn plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rianath

texts.fr:
A. Rianath est née à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Rianath est célibataire avec un enfant. Rianath a abandonné très tôt l’école pour apprendre la coiffure. La coiffure qu’elle n’a exercée que pour peu de temps. En effet, c’est le charbon et l'huile végétale que Rianath vend maintenant. Rianath a eu déjà de ALIDé deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé et qui l’ont aidés à augmenter le volume de son activité. Dans l’optique de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle Rianath demande un troisième prêt à ALIDé pour continuer de développer son activité.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Rianath A. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rianath is unmarried and has one child. Rianath abandoned her studies very early on to train as a hairstylist. She worked as a hairstylist only for a little while. Indeed, it is the sale of coal and vegetable oil that Rianath is involved in currently. Rianath has already obtained two loans through Alidé, which she repaid well and which helped her increase the volume of her business. With the aim of better responding to the demands of her clientele, Rianath is seeking a third loan through Alidé to continue developing her business. The meaning of Alidé in Fon, the local language of Benin, is "there is always a way for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten bags of coal and five 25-litre cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
Xuân Đặng Thị (1025060747) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily ducks, for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, Xuân joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

Xuân is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 7th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es una mujer muy emprendedora, pues los frutos en su negocio y en su familia son la prueba de la dedicación que pone en cada cosa que realiza con la finalidad de progresar junto a su pareja e hijo, con quienes vive. El esfuerzo de hace 12 años en su bodega han tenido grandes beneficios, pues su empeño y constancia lograron de su negocio el más concurrido de su localidad por la buena atención que brinda y porque siempre está a la disposición de sus clientes. Desde las seis de la mañana abre las puertas de su tienda para atender las necesidades de sus vecinos hasta la media noche, este ritmo de trabajo lo ha estado llevando todos estos años sola, más ahora cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes ya son jóvenes y desean apoyarla para hacer más liviano su trabajo. Sin embargo, Ana tiene muchos proyectos por concretar y el más ansiado es la ampliación de su local, pues tiene gran variedad de mercadería que no puede vender porque el espacio le impide que los exhiba, y por ello está dispuesta a remodelar su casa, es el riesgo que está segura de asumir. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, Ana es parte de la junta directiva de su banco comunal y su responsabilidad como líder es incentivar a sus compañeras a realizar un buen trabajo. Los 3000 soles que requiere son para la compra de un mueble exhibidor/congelador, el cual es muy costoso, pero necesario para la venta de bebidas.
texts.en:
Ana is an enterprising woman whose fruits of her business and her family are proof of the hard work and determination that she puts into whatever she sets out to do with the aim of getting ahead alongside her husband and son, with whom she lives. Her efforts in her general store these past 12 years have brought great benefits because her determination has helped her business become the most frequented one in the locality because of her good customer service and because she is always at her customers’ disposal. She opens her doors from six in the morning until midnight to meet customer demand. She has fulfilled this shift on her own for years, but she now has the support of her children, who are now older and wish to support their mother in order to lighten her workload. Nevertheless, Ana still has many projects to accomplish, the most desirable of which is expanding her business space because there is a great variety of merchandise that she cannot sell because of the limited display space. For this reason, she is determined to remodel her house—a risk that she is willing to take. This is her 13th loan with MFP. Ana is a part of the board of directors in her microfinance institute, and her responsibility as a leader is to provide an incentive to her group members to do a good job. The 3,000.00 PEN that she is requesting will be used to purchase a convenience store cooler, which is very costly but necessary for beverage sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase convenience store cooler

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
Hằng Đặng Thị is 55 years old and lives in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has four adult-aged children. Hằng earns a living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Hằng has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Hằng joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she could help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Hằng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and, eventually, to sell.

Hằng is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Hằng plans to use the additional revenue she expects to be generated from the business to improve and expand her business ventures.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia D. Azangaro, departamento D. Puno, tiene 56 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos, todos ya independientes, vive en el Comunidad Punta Sahuancasi-central.  Ella no tienes estudios. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tan solo unos días (socia nueva), la señora Maria se dedica a la compra y venta D. ovinos.  
Coneste préstamo D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles comprará mas ovejas y siendo mejoradas (engorD.) poder venderlas.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. iniciar como empresaria.

Lo que mas le gusta son las reuniones y puntualidad D. las demás socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” cooperative bank, located in the Azangaro province in the department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and has 6 children who are all now living independently. She lives in the central Punta Sahuancasi community. She has no education. She has been working with Manuela Ramos only for a few days (new member). Maria dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of sheep. With this loan of 300 soles, she will buy more sheep that, once grown and fattened, she will be able to sell. She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to start as a businesswoman. What she enjoys the most are the group meetings, the punctuality of the other members, and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Eduarda tiene 53 años, desde que enviudó ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos, quienes viven con ella en la casa que pudo construir con su trabajo. Su habilidad está en sus manos y la creatividad que también posee le abrió las puertas para dedicarse a la decoración, y con el tiempo la incentivaron a especializarse en la elaboración de manualidades y decoraciones para diversos eventos y compromisos. Desde hace 16 años no deja de trabajar, ya que las personas solicitan sus servicios para eventos sociales. Por las tardes exhibe sus preciosas decoraciones en su casa, tratando siempre de estar preparada para el momento que tenga que decorar los salones de recepción, pues a veces son impredecibles algunos eventos. Asimismo, está pendiente de la moda y de los últimos cambios en decoración, y trata de especializarse estudiando algunos cursos al respecto. Todo este sacrificio tiene como fin instalar una tienda junto a dos amigas, quienes tienen los mismos deseos de exponer diversas decoraciones para el hogar, y que para el futuro formen una gran empresa. Este es su catorceavo crédito con MFP y desde que formó parte de su grupo ha tratado de participar con sus compañeras, quienes son personas comprometidas por el desarrollo del banco comunal. Los 1000 soles que solicita le servirán para adquirir algunos materiales para seguir elaborando  diversas decoraciones e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 53 years old and, since becoming a widow, has supported her 4 children who live with her in a house she managed to build through her work. Her ability lies in her hands and creativity, which opened doors to dedicate herself to decorating. Over time, this gave her incentive to specialize in making handicrafts and decorations for various events and milestones. She has not stopped working for 16 years now, as people solicit her services for special occasions. In the afternoons, she exhibits her precious decorations in her house, trying always to be ready if called to decorate a reception hall since sometimes events are unpredictable. Likewise, she is always aware of current trends and latest changes in design, and she tries to specialize in her craft by taking classes in this area. All of this sacrifice is aimed to help her open a store with two friends, who have the same desire to provide a diverse range of decorations for the home and they hope to create a large enterprise in the future. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP and, since she became part of this group, she has tried to participate with her colleagues who are very dedicated to the development of the cooperative bank. The 1000 soles that she requests will serve to acquire some materials so she can continue making her decorations and grow her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make her decorations.

loans.name: Olufunke

texts.en:
Olufunke O., 58 years old, is married with four children. She earns her living by selling wooden planks.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of N40,000, with which she plans to purchase more planks for sale.

She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana Q., 43 years old, sells food products in her small store. She has ten years of experience in this field. She serves as the only breadwinner supporting her elderly parents.

Parvana is single and has dedicated her life to improving and expanding her business. Several years ago, her success provided her with enough resources to build her own store, which allows her to save more money toward expanding her business ventures.

She has applied for a loan in the amount of $1,500 in order to purchase more food products for sale in her shop. She hopes to increase her income in this way.

loans.use: To purchase more food goods for sale in her shop

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora. Janeth Gutiérrez tiene 39 años de edad,  casada con dos hijos, se desempeña como conserje en una empresa gubernamental desde hace seis años. Unos de sus proyectos es la construcción de su vivienda, alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida para el bienestar de sus hijos. Requiere de la construcción de un cuarto para brindarle seguridad y protección. Las dificultares que tiene es la falta de financiamientos. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra iniciar con su proyecto comprando materiales como: cemento, arena, piedrines, zinc, reglones de madera, perlines. Con esto espera estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Janeth Gutiérrez is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She has worked as a caretaker at a government enterprise for the past six years. One of her projects is the building of her house, in order to reach a better standard of living and provide well-being for her children. She requires the construction of a room to provide security and protection. The difficulty she is encountering is lack of financing. Thanks to the loan with Afodenic, she will manage to start her project by buying materials such as: cement, sand, stones, zinc, lumber, beams. With this project, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make improvements to her dwelling.

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi is 32 years old and married with two children. He earns his living by selling wooden planks.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of N70,000, which he plans to use to purchase more planks to sell.

He sends his thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es una mujer que sufrió el abandono de su pareja; pero su hija, con quien vive, la motiva a seguir adelante cada día. Desde muy joven aprendió algunas técnicas de cosmetología, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que tenía que prepararse para ejercer esta labor de forma profesional, por ello, es que desde hace 20 años está involucrada en el arreglo personal de las damas, y gracias al tiempo de experiencia y ahorro logró abrir su propio salón de belleza, el cual atiende todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. El tiempo que le dedica a su negocio lo disfruta mucho, ya que trata de que sus clientas salgan muy lindas y satisfechas del resultado obtenido en la sesión de belleza. Sus ambiciones son de lograr tener un spa en lugares residenciales de la ciudad donde vive, ya que la mayoría de sus clientas vienen de estos lugares solo para ser atendidas por sus manos, pues su trabajo es muy reconocido. Felipa está solicitando un crédito por primera vez y espera que su permanencia sea muy favorable para ganarse la confiabilidad de su grupo y de la institución. Los 1000 soles estarán destinados en la compra de productos de belleza y herramientas necesarias para su labor.
texts.en:
Felipa is a woman who has suffered the abandonment of her husband. However, her daughter, with whom she lives, motivates her to keep going every day. Felipa had acquired the techniques of cosmetology since she was very young, but over time she realized that she needed to prepare herself to do the job like a professional. So, for the past 20 years she has been providing personal beauty services to women. Thanks to time, experience, and savings, she has succeeded in opening her own beauty solon, in which she works every day from 9 in the morning until 8 at night. She really enjoys the time she spends in her business because her clients always walk away beautiful and happy with the results of their visit. Felipa's ambitions include having a spa in her city's residential area, since most of her clients come from there just to have her attend to them with her very own hands; her work is quite well-known. She is seeking a loan for the first time and hopes that her presence will help her win the confidence of her group and the organization. She plans to use the loan of 1000 soles to buy beauty products and the necessary tools of her trade.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy implements and products for her solon

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
El Señor. Donald T. tiene 37 años de edad,, habitantes del barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa se dedica al comercio, tiene tres hijos. Los planes es terminar la construcción de su vivienda.  Se desempeña como guardia de seguridad desde hace 17 años lo mejor es que su meta es ofrecerle a sus hijos mayor seguridad mediante prestamos ya que los costos de construcción son muy alto.
Con el préstamo que solicita comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, cerámica a la sala de su casa, pintura y repellar las paredes permitiendo que su proyecto de ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda a si como tener un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Donald T., 37, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. His wife is in commerce. They have three children. The plan is to finish construction on his house. He has worked as a security guard for seventeen years. The best thing about his goal is to give his children better security. He needs to do this through loans because construction costs are very high. With the loan he will buy construction materials like cement, ceramic tiles for the living room floor, paint, and plaster for the walls. This will allow him to continue with his project of improving the infrastructure of his home and having a better patrimony for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to plaster the walls and put down ceramic tile flooring in the living room

loans.name: Juli

texts.es: Juli es muy reconocida por su trabajo, pues se dedica con mucho esmero, ya que sus padres y hermanos, con quienes vive, le inculcaron el amor al trabajo. Hace 2 años se inició en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que la obligó a salir a las calles y a visitar a diversas personas para ofrecer sus productos a través de los catálogos. Ser soltera le facilita su trabajo, pues cuanta con el tiempo necesario para salir a trabajar y gracias al apoyo de sus hermanos ha podido relacionarse con varias personas, quienes ahora son sus clientes fieles. Pero a pesar de contar con los catálogos de venta, requiere de gran cantidad de productos que estén a disposición inmediata para sus clientes y así atender sus pedidos de manera rápida, Para el futuro quiere instalar en su domicilio un bazar para la exposición de sus productos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está agradecida con el grupo que la acogió y le dio la posibilidad que conformar este banco comunal, donde las mujeres tratan de progresar en base a sus capacidades. Los 500 soles que solicita están destinados en la compra de productos de belleza, pues las temporadas festivas, como el día del padre se encuentran muy próximas.
texts.en:
Juli is very well-known for her work, and she does it with a great deal of care, since her parents and siblings, with whom she lives, instill in her the love for work. Two years ago she began selling cosmetics, which required her to travel around visiting different people to sell her products through catalogs. Being single makes her job easier, because she has the time she needs to go out and work. Thanks to the help from her siblings she has been able to meet numerous people, who are now her very loyal clients. However, while she does have sales catalogs, Juli still has to keep a lot of products on hand to fill her clients' orders quickly. In the future she would like to open a shop in her house where she can display her products. This will be Juli's first loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to the group because she has taken the opportunity they have given her to be part of this village bank, where women can try to progress based on their abilities. She plans to use the loan of 500 soles to buy beauty products since holidays like Father's Day are coming soon.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Margarita P. V. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de Secundaria, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de verduras y de comida rápida, cuando inició tenia un pequeño puesto donde vendía verduras, al darse cuenta que aumentaban sus clientes empezó con la venta de comida rápida (esto desarrollado desde su puesto y en su casa).
Recién ha iniciado como socia, y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida.
María tiene como sueño poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
María Margarita P. V. is 28. She lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Perú. She completed her second year of high school. She has three children who are economically dependent upon her. María sells vegetables and fast food. She started with a small stand where she sold vegetables. When she realized that she was getting more customers, she started selling fast food (she does this from her stand and in her house). She has recently become a partner, and she is a member of the Romanas Luchadoras II community bank. With this loan for 300 PEN she will buy supplies for food preparation. María’s dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: July

texts.es: July se caracteriza por su valor para iniciar actividades de mucha responsabilidad, ya que su labor como esposa y madre de 3 hijos le enseñaron a arriesgar para ganar, y gracias a esto terminó de construir su casa. Los años que tiene como comerciante la ayudaron a instalar unas cabinas de Internet dentro de su casa, las cuales atiende todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta muy tarde por la noche, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. Este servicio lo brinda desde hace dos años y espera seguir atendiendo mientras exista la oportunidad, pues está consiente que la tecnología  van cambiando rápidamente, pero July está dispuesta a cambiar de negocio si así se requiere.
