Pues no desea dedicarse sólo a un tipo de negocio, ya que sus proyectos junto a su esposo son de adquirir autos para alquilarlos para trasporte público. Hace algunos años compró un carro, que su pareja viene trabajando, y con ambos negocios pueden solventar las necesidades de su hogar. July es parte de un banco comunal en MFP desde hace 7 años, este es su treceavo crédito y junto al grupo que lo conforma, se esfuerzan en administrar correctamente para evitar problemas financieros. Los 2000 soles que solicita son destinados al mantenimiento de su carro y de las computadoras de sus cabinas de Internet, pues los programas tienen que ser actualizados.
texts.en:
July is characterized by her courage to tackle new activities requiring a lot of responsibility. Her work as a wife and mother of three children has taught her that you need to risk to win. Thanks to these attributes she finished building her house. Her years of experience in business helped her install Internet cubicles in her house. She tends them every day from eight in the morning until very late a night, hours that meet her customers’ requirements. She has been doing this for two years, and she hopes to continue tending the Internet cubicles while the opportunity still exists. She is aware of the fact that the technology is changing rapidly. But, July is prepared to change the business as necessary. She does not want to limit herself to one type of business. Her project, along with her husband, is to get cars to rent out for public transportation. A few years ago she bought a car that her husband uses for work. With both businesses they are able to pay the household expenses. July has been part of a community bank in MFP for seven years. This is her thirteenth loan. Together with her group they put forth much effort to correctly manage the funds to avoid financial problems. The 2,000 PEN are for maintenance on the car and the computers. The programs need to be upgraded.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on her computers and her husband's car

loans.name: Badiratu

texts.en:
Badiratu U. is 58 years old and and married with five children. Badiratu earns her living by selling goats.

She hopes to obtain a loan amount of N75,000, which she will use to purchase more goats to sell.

She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to sell

loans.name: Malakhat

texts.en:
Malakhat G. is a 40-year-old married woman with two sons. She sells home furniture in her own furniture store. She has 15 years of experience.

She decided to open her business when it becamse clear that her husband's income wasn’t enough to satisfy their basic family needs. Malakaht borrowed money from her friends and started selling furniture. Two years ago, she was able to build her own store with the savings she had.

Now Malakhat is concerned about the higher education of her two sons and wants to do everything possible in order to save money for their university careers so that they may attain university degrees. With this goal in mind, she has applied for a $1,500 USD loan in order to increase number of items she sells in her store.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Soraida Sánchez tiene 37 años, habitante del Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, casada tiene cinco hijos, su esposo le ayuda se desempeña como camionero, su hijo mayor le ayuda también. Los planes es terminar de construir su vivienda. Tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende granos básicos y otros productos. Inicio vendiendo leñas, frutas y verduras. El fin del préstamo en Afodenic es para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación para esto comprara  los siguientes materiales: cemento, hierro, bloques, perlines y otros materiales que va  utilizar ante que venga la lluvia ya que se necesita para brindar mejor comodidad y protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Soraida Sanchez is 37 years old and lives in Sandino Memorial in the city of Managua. She is married with five children. She helps her husband who works as a lorry driver; her eldest son also helps. The plan is to finish building their house. She has a small shop where she sells basic grains and other products. She has begun selling firewood, fruit and vegetables. The aim of the loan from Afodenic is to build a room in the house, for which the following materials will be bought: cement, iron, blocks, rafters and other materials that will be used before the rains come as she needs to provide better comfort and protection for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Mareli

texts.es: Mareli es una mujer con mucha simpatía, característica que la acompaña desde que formó su hogar junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos, cuyo bienestar es su prioridad. Está dedicada a la confección y costura de ropa, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 12 años, pues aprendió cursos básicos y empezó a realizar diversos pedidos para sus vecinos, con el tiempo, su eficiencia y experiencia fue muy valorada por sus clientes, quienes acudían continuamente a ella. Gracias a esta eficiencia, no sólo logró captar clientela en su barrio, sino también que los fabricantes de prendas la contratan para campañas de temporada, y frente a los grandes pedidos por entregar tiene la ayuda de sus hijos mayores. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y sus ganas de trabajar incentivan a que todas sus compañeras tengan los mismos ánimos por el compromiso del progreso de su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que solicita serán para la compra de otra máquina de coser, ya que sus hijos han aprendido a utilizarla, y con una adicional, Mareli podrá aumentar su producción, gracias al apoyo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mareli is a very kind woman, a characteristic that has meant she has created a home together with her husband and their 4 children in which wellbeing is their priority. She has been a tailor and seamstress for 12 years. She learnt from basic courses and started to do various orders for her neighbours. Over time, her efficiency and experience have been greatly valued by her customers who kept on coming to her. Thanks to this efficiency, she not only managed to attract customers from her area but she also has contracts with factories that have seasonal campaigns. In advance of these large delivery orders, she is helped by her eldest children. This is her thirteenth loan from MFP, and her income from her work motivates all of her friends to feel the same sense of commitment to the progress of their community bank. The 3,000 soles that she is asking for will be used to buy another sewing machine, now that her children have learnt how to use it. In addition, Mareli will be able to increase her production, thanks to her children’s help.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
La señora Hermenegilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” ubicado en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (1ro de secundaria).  Vive en la Av. Panamericana s/n.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles. La señora Hermenegilda se dedica a la venta de golosinas.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará galletas, dulces, enlatados, gaseosas, caramelos y otras golosinas,  para aumentar su negocio.
Desea que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.  Mas adelante ella piensa poner una distribuidora de golosinas al por mayor y bien surtida, pero necesita mas capital.
A la señora Hermenegilda le gusta las facilidades que brinda Manuela Ramos y los ahorros.  También le gusta las charlas que les imparten a manera de capacitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hermenegilda is a member of the Community Bank “Las Fronterizas” located in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito Province, in the Department of Puno. She is 36 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children. She did not complete her secondary studies (just the first part of secondary school). She lives on Panamericana Avenue. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organisation for three years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles. Mrs. Hermenegilda sells sweets for a living. With this loan of 1,000 soles she will buy biscuits, sweets, canned items, fizzy drinks, caramels and other sweets that will increase her business. She would like both of her children to be successful professionals. In the future she is planning to be a well-stocked, wholesale sweet distributer, but she needs more capital. Mrs. Hermenegilda likes the facilities and savings offered by Manuela Ramos. She also likes the training lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy biscuits, sweets, fizzy drinks, canned items, caramels, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Doña Marcelina de 65 años de edad, es soltera, trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 20 años, esta solicitando su 8vo credito el que utilizara para la construccion de una cocina, ya que con el invierno se le llena de agua el local donde esta ubicada informalmente, con sus creditos anteriores logro la construccion de su casita con las condiciones basicas para vivir, ha sido una clienta ejemplar pagando sus creditos en timpo y forma, siendo el ejemplo de sus compañeros de trabajo de ese centro asistencial, no tiene ayuda sus hijos, pues cada quien se las ingeniedo para sobrevivir, ella ayuda a un hijo de 50 años que es liciado de guerra y manifiesta que en sus seguros siempre lo pone como su beneficiario, pues al morir ella no quiere dejarlo desamparado, ya que son minimos los trabajos que el puede realizar.  Manifiesta que esta muy agradecida con la atencion que AFODENIC le ha brindado, por tal razon no ha tenido necesidad de visitar otra financiera.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 65 and single. For the last twenty years she has worked at the Asunción Hospital. She is asking for her eighth loan. She would like to build a kitchen because the place where hers is informally situated now fills with water during the rainy season. With her previous loan she was able to build a small house with basic living conditions. She has been an exemplary client, repaying her loans on time and as agreed upon. She is an example to her work colleagues in this assistance center. She does not have help from her children. Each one is managing to survive. She helps one 50 year old son who is a disabled veteran. She always lists him as her beneficiary on her insurance. When she dies she does not want to leave him destitute as there is little work he can do. She is grateful for the attention AFODENIC has offered her. Because of that she has not needed to go to another finance company.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo B. is 64 years old and married with five children. She has a farm where she raises pigs to sell. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to purchase more pigs. She says thanks to Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more pigs

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad y está casada; tiene 5 hijos.  
Tiene estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años.  Ella tiene una panadería (elaboración y comercialización de panes), a la vez vende frutas de la región. Se inició con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. 
A fin de generar mayores ingresos, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, con lo cual adquirirá insumos y materia prima (harina, manteca, levadura, sal, leña, etc) para mejorar la elaboración de panes en volumen y calidad; de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias y ampliar su negocio con venta de frutas y verduras; los ingresos generados servirán para ayudar a los estudios de sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Basilia belongs to the Las Fronterizas community bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 39, married, and has five children. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. She has a bakery (she makes and sells bread), and at the same time she sells regional fruit. She started with a loan for 300 PEN. With a goal of generating more income, she needs a loan for 2,000 PEN. She will get supplies and basic ingredients (flour, butter, yeast, salt, wood, etc.) to improve the quantity and quality of the bread she makes. This way she will have better earnings and expand her business selling fruit and vegetables. The generated income will help with her children’s studies and increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, yeast, salt, wood

loans.name: Arlen Guadalupe

texts.es: La Señora. Arlen Jirón tiene 26 años de edad, habitante del barrio San Juda en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 4 hijos. Los planes para su familia es que sus hijos tengan mayores posibilidades de mejor nivel de vida.Ha sido muy duro mantener a sus cuatros hijos. Lo cual inicio su propio negocio de venta de ropas, zapatos y otros productos, desde hace cinco años tiene la experiencia de venta. Con su préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar nuevos productos como: cosméticos, perfumes, ropas de dama y caballero.  Que será de benéfico para el desarrollo de su negocio y el porvenir de su familia,
texts.en:
Mrs. Arlen Jirón is 26 and lives in the San Juda neighborhood in Managua. She has four children and wants them to have more opportunities to improve their standard of living. It has been very difficult to support her four children, which is why she started her own business selling clothes, shoes and other products. She began her sales experience five years ago. With your loan through Afrodenic she will be able to buy new products like: cosmetics, perfumes, ladies and men's clothes which will benefit her business and her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, perfumes and clothes

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 28 años, junto a su pareja tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles los cuidados necesarios a sus dos pequeñas hijas, quienes requieren un lugar donde vivir, ya que  por el momento están alojados en la casa de sus suegros. La necesidad de incrementar sus ingresos económicos la llevaron a aprender repostería, cuando terminó sus estudios tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir un pequeño horno donde ahora prepara bocaditos que distribuye a diversas tiendas. Este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace un año y en el poco tiempo que tiene, ha logrado conseguir gran cantidad de clientes, quienes le hacen pedidos quincenalmente. Además, María brinda sus servicios para fiestas y otros eventos sociales, donde lleva sus deliciosos bocaditos para consumo de los asistentes; a pesar de ser esporádicas estas reuniones, gana lo suficiente como para seguir trabajando y cumpliendo sus pedidos menores. Para el futuro, anhela tener una pastelería en el centro de su localidad, con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y obtener pronto una casa para la comodidad de su familia. María llegó a MFP hace un año, está en su segundo crédito y junto a sus compañeras ha podido generar grandes ingresos en beneficio a su grupo, pues las actividades que realizan las ayudaron a crecer económicamente. Con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará los productos e ingredientes para el preparado de sus pasteles, y así incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and, together with her partner, has the responsibility of providing the necessary care for her two small daughters who require a place to live. For now, they are living in her in-laws’ house. The need to increase her income led her to learn to bake and, when she finished her studies, she had the opportunity of buying a small oven that she now uses to prepare her goods to distribute to various stores. She has been in the business for one year and, in this small amount of time, she has managed to build a large customer base that places orders with her every two weeks. In addition, María provides her services for parties and other social events where she takes her delicious treats for consumption by attendees. Despite the fact that these events are sporadic, she earns enough to continue working and complete her other small orders. For the future, she wishes to have her own bakery in the center of her locality with the aim of generating greater income for her home and to obtain a house so her family can live in more comfortable conditions. María arrived at MFP a year ago, is in her second credit and, together with her colleagues, has been able to generate a large amount of income to benefit her group as her activities help them grow economically. With the 2000 soles she requests, she will buy products and ingredients to make her cakes so she can increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cakes.

loans.name: Govana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Govana Elizabeth A. M. tiene 33 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Govana inició su negocio con la venta de galletas y bebidas gaseosas en un kiosco ubicado en su casa, ahora ha surtido su negocio con cerveza y golosinas.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de golosinas y galletas.
Con este crédito de 2000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza y vinos.
Govana tiene como sueño poner una bodega surtida con abarrotes.
texts.en:
Govana Elizabeth A. M. is 33 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú.  She completed her Secondary school education, and has 2 sons that depend on her financially. Govana started her business selling cookies and soft drinks from a kiosk located in her house. She has now also supplied her enterprise with beer and snacks. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her cooperative bank, United for a Better Future II, she invested in the purchase of snacks and cookies. She will invest this loan of 2000 soles into the purchase of beer and wine. Govana’s dream is to have a store supplied with groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and wine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una próspera comerciante y además, una ejemplar madre y esposa, pues vive muy feliz junto a su pareja en la casa que construyeron juntos hace varios años, lugar donde compartieron bellos momentos junto a sus hijos, quienes ya formaron sus propios hogares lejos de sus padres, dejando en ellos un gran vacío. A pesar de la tristeza que tenía por la partida de sus hijos, María no dejó de trabajar y dedicarse a su negocio, pues los 6 años de funcionamiento que tiene su tienda la ayudaron a ganarse gran cantidad de clientes, a quienes atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, aprovechando que es la única tienda que abre sus puertas a tempranas horas del día, pensando en la necesidad de las madres de familia. Ahora tiene pensado ampliar su negocio, pues acaban de abrir un colegio cerca de su casa y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para ofrecer artículos de librería y todo tipo de materiales educativos, y así convertir su bodega en un bazar, donde venda diversidad de productos para satisfacer las múltiples necesidades de sus clientes y vecinos. Ella es fundadora de su grupo y desde sus inicios en MFP ha trabajo junto a sus compañeras con mucha responsabilidad y de manera organizada, pues las líderes del grupo han incentivado un trabajo ordenado y organizado. Los 2500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de mercadería y útiles escolares para instalar su espacio de librería.
texts.en:
María is a prosperous merchant, as well as an exemplary mother and wife. She lives very happily with her partner in the house they built together several years ago. It is a home where they shared many beautiful moments with their children, who have now formed their own homes far away from their parents leaving a large emptiness in them. Despite her sadness at her children moving away, María did not stop working or dedicating herself to her business. Over the 6 years she’s been running her enterprise, she has grown a large customer base that she tends to from 6 in the morning until 8 at night. She takes advantage of the fact that she is the only store open during the early hours of the day, thinking about the needs of the local homemakers. She is now thinking about expanding her business, as they have recently opened a new school near her house and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to offer books and other types of school supplies. In this way, she would convert her store into a bazaar where a variety of products are sold in order to satisfy the multiple needs of her customers and neighbors. She is a founder of her group and, since starting with MFP, has worked with her colleagues in a very responsible and organized manner. The leaders of the group have given an incentive to work in an orderly and organized manner. The 2500 soles she requests would be invested into the purchase of school supplies to put in the bookstore section of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Lucrecia, casada, de 54 años de edad, trabajadora del MINSA desde hace 14 años, esta solicitando su 9no credito el que sera utilizado para la construccion de un dormitorio, ya que no tiene las condiciones suficientes, su casa es de un proyecto aleman que ejecuto la iglesia catolica, pero esta era de madera, con sus creditos anteriores logro hacerla de concreto y construir cocina y letrina, ahora quiere ampliar con un cuarto para tener mas comodidad.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en un complejo lechero, sus hijos esta fuera del pais de quienes tambien recibe ayuda, de ellos dependo un nieto de 2 años quien ha estado al cuidado de ambos.  Se ha caracterizado por su responsabilidad y moral de pago, pues en sus creditos anteriores no ha presentado mora, y esta consciente que los creditos sirven de mucho, sobre todo a los asalariados que es su unica fuente economica, siempre ha preferido a AFODENIC por su buena atencion y calor humano.
texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia, married and 54 years old, has been working in MINSA for 14 years. She is requesting her 9th loan, which will be used to build a room since she doesn’t have enough space. Her house was originally from a German project implemented by the Catholic Church. It was, however, made of wood but with previous loans she managed to convert it to concrete as well as build a kitchen and bathroom. She now needs to expand by adding one room to live more comfortably. She counts on the support of her husband, who works at a dairy complex. Her children are outside of the country and also send assistance to her. She also supports a 2-year old grandson, who is in their care. She has characterized herself by being punctual and principled in her previous loan repayments, and she is conscious that the credits are a great deal of help to her. She has always preferred AFODENIC for its attentive service and kindness to people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of a room.

loans.name: Marlena

texts.es:
La señora Marlena es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 33 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios superiores incompleto (educación primaria). Vive en el Barrio Vizcachani.
Trabaja desde hace 4 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos (descanso un año por motivos de viaje), Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, mazamorras, gelatinas. 
Ella desea construir su casa.  Manifiesta que le gusta la forma en que trabaja Manuela Ramos, sobre todo los ahorros y las charlas que imparte.
texts.en:
Marlena is a member of the “Las Fronterizas” Communal Bank in the Desaguadero District of Chucuito Province, in the Puno Region of Peru. She is 33 years old, married with one child and has some secondary school education. She lives in the Vizcachani neighbourhood.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 years (she took one year off to travel). Her first loan totaled 300 nuevos soles. She runs a small grocery store and, with this loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mazamorra and jelly.

She wishes to build her own house. She says that she likes the way Manuela Ramos works and especially appreciates the savings advice and training lectures the organisation gives.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, mazamorra and jelly

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera con 01 hijo a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Simón Bolívar  Nº 328 Barrio Lizandro luna, es profesora de segundaria, ciencias sociales. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 meses, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de chalona, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, para comprar mas chalona.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que piensa pagar en 06 cuotas; el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas chalona, y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su deseo seguir trabajando para poder en el futuro vender al por mayor su producto, y aumentar con la venta de carne  o cualquier otro producto de la zona.

A ella le gusta mucho las reuniones y las charlas que a veces se da.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Aswancaris II community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 24 and a single mother raising one son. She lives at Jr. Simón Bolívar Nº 328 in the Lizandro Luna neighborhood. She is a high school social sciences teacher. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two months. She buys and sells chalona (cured meat made from lamb). Her first loan for 500 PEN was used to buy more chalona. She would now like a loan for 500 PEN, which she will repay in six payments. The loan will allow her to buy more chalona. This way her business will keep growing. She wants to keep working to be able to sell her product wholesale in the future. She would like to increase her business by adding the sale of meat or another product from her zone. She really likes the meetings and talks that are sometimes given.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chalona (cured meat made from lamb)

loans.name: Femmes Commeràantes 8 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and get financing for their businesses rapidly. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer muy comprometida con el progreso de su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad, con quienes vive hace 15 años en la casa que junto a su esposo lograron adquirir. Al poco tiempo de casada abrió una tienda en su casa, la cual va progresando con el paso de los años, ya que en sus inicios sólo vendía productos de primera necesidad, más ahora tiene instalada una librería en un espacio de su tienda, donde exhibe algunos cuadernos y útiles escolares. Su progreso fue a causa del trabajo que realiza todos los días a partir de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, tiempo que está a disposición de sus clientes y de su familia. Sin embargo, el espacio que tiene es muy reducido y requiere de algunos arreglos, pues posteriormente desea instalar un bazar para incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer a sus vecinas productos, que en su mayoría, son difíciles de obtener por la lejanía de los mercados y centros comerciales. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, los años que lleva en su grupo, aproximadamente 7, la han ayudado a mejorar sus habilidades sociales y de negocio. Los 2000 soles que solicita los requiere para mejorar su pequeña librería, pues le hacen falta algunos muebles y útiles de escritorio, que son altamente demandados.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is very committed to the progress of her family, which includes her husband and her 2 young sons. Together with her family, she has lived for the past 15 years in the house that she and her husband were able to acquire together. Shortly after their wedding, she opened a store in their house, which has grown more successful over the years. Beginning only by selling basic staple products, today she has installed a book store section in a part of her store, in which she displays folders and other school items. Her success is the result of the work that she carries out every day from 6 in the morning to 7 at night, time during which she must attend to both her customers and her family. None the less, the space that she has is very small and is in need of some repairs, so she wishes in the future to install a proper storefront. Doing so would enable her to increase her sales and offer products to her neighborhood that, for the most part, are difficult to obtain on account of the far distance of the markets and malls. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She has been with the group for approximately 7 years, during which time they have helped her to improve her position both socially and with regard to her business. The 2000 soles that she requests is what she requires to improve her small book store, which is in need of various pieces of school furniture and school supplies, all of which are highly demanded by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: El Señor José R. tiene 37 años, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casado su esposa se desempeña en los labores de la casa. Unos de sus proyectos es terminar la construcción de su vivienda. Don José tiene su negocio de venta de leche agria de forma ambulante por las mañana y en las tarde acarrea en su vehiculo, obteniendo otros ingresos para su hogar esta forma de vida lo tiene desde hace cuatro años. Iniciándolo con fondo de las pocos trabajo de construcción que realizaba. En el transcurso ha tenido dificultades que su vehiculo se le daño el motor y no tenia suficiente fondo para repararlo, hasta que pudo cambiar motor. Con el préstamo en Afodenic lograra legalizar su vehiculo por el cambio del motor y que siga generando mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
José R., 37, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married, and his wife is a housewife. One of his projects is to finish the construction on his house. In the mornings José is a street vendor of sour milk. In the afternoons he uses his vehicle to transport things and get other income for his home. He has been doing these things for four years. He started with funds from the small amount of construction work he had. With the passage of time, he has had difficulties with the vehicle. The engine is damaged, and he did not have enough money to repair it until he could change the engine. With the loan from Afodenic, he will be able to legalize the vehicle by changing the engine. He will then continue to generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legalize his vehicle by changing the engine and be able to make his work easier

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una esposa y madre ejemplar, pues y asume su rol dentro de su hogar eficientemente,  muestra de ello, es la casa que adquirió a base de esfuerzo y trabajo junto a su pareja. Ser comerciante no es una labor fácil, pues se levanta de madrugada para salir al mercado central de su ciudad y comprar grandes cantidades de productos comestibles que venderá en el mercado de su localidad. Maria aprovecha los precios de oferta al por mayor, pues es eso lo que hace rentable su actividad, a pesar de ser muy sacrificado, trabaja desde las 4 de  la madrugada hasta el medio día, tomándose el resto de la tarde para atender su hogar y ayudar a sus hijos con sus tareas escolares, y así está pendiente de sus actividades sin descuidar su casa. Pero las necesidades van cambiando, y ella desea estar preparada para estos cambios, es por ello que desea invertir en la compra de un puesto dentro del mercado para dedicarse a la venta de otros productos e iniciar así otra etapa en su vida. Maria es una de las fundadoras de su grupo en MFP, y el motivo por el que sigue integrando su grupo es por la manera de organización y de interrelacionarse con sus compañeras, creando un espacio de compromiso e identificación como equipo. Comprar mayor cantidad de productos tiene un costo elevado, con los 2000 soles que solicita incrementará sus inversiones y adquirirá varios productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Maria is a wife and exemplary mother, given she carries out these roles within her home efficiently. Evidence of this is her house, which she acquired thanks to great effort and work alongside her partner. Being a merchant is no easy task, as she rises at dawn to go to the central market of her city to buy large quantities of food products to then sell at her local market. Maria takes advantage of wholesale bargain prices, since this is what helps make her activities profitable. She works from 4 in the morning until midday, after which she spends the rest of the day caring for her house and helping her children with their homework. This way, she can manage her business without neglecting her household’s needs. However, requirements continue to change and she wants to be ready. For this reason, she wants to invest in buying a location at the market so she can sell other products and start a new phase of her life. Maria is one of the founding members of her group in MFP, and the reason why her group continues to integrate is because of their organized manner and the relationships between the members. They create a space focused on commitment and identify themselves as a team. Buying more products is more costly and, with the 2000 soles she is requesting, she will increase her investments and acquire more goods at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 9 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and and obtain financing for their businesses quickly. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es:
La señora Dulia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida  Jr. Zepita S/n,  ella posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de fruta, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 2200.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de frutas, (plátanos, naranjas, peras, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas) y venderlos en el Mercado 15 de Agosto. Su sueño es poner su tienda de abarrotes o una jugueria propia.
 
Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucho los ahorros  y la facilidad de pago que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Dulia is a member of the communal bank “ Yunga Uyo,” which is in the Puno area of the province of Chucuito. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She lives in the barrio Alto Florida Jr. Zepita S/n and has completed her high school studies. Dulia buys and sells fruit and has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her firs loan was for 300.00 soles. Currently she would like an additional loan of 2,200.00 soles, to purchase various fruits like: plantains, oranges, pears, mandarins, apples, and grapes. She will sells them at the 15th of August market. Her dream is to have her own grocery or juice store. At the same time, she tells us that she loves to save and Manuela Ramos’ terms of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para comprar, plátanos, naranjas, peras, mandarinas, manzanas, uvas

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 34 años, es una persona muy alegre, junto a sus tres hijos y su pareja tratan de progresar y conseguir pronto una casa propia, mientras tanto, seguirán en la casa de sus padres con quienes vive. Desde hace más de 3 años se desempeña como contadora para una empresa, pero su horario de trabajo le está quitando la oportunidad de compartir momentos con sus seres queridos, y a pesar del beneficio de su remuneración, Martha trata de incrementar sus ahorros para invertirlos en la compra de un puesto donde pueda dedicarse a la venda ropa, por lo que está a la espera de realizarlo pronto, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Sin embargo, a pesar de no tener un local, ya está empezando a recibir algunos pedidos de prendas por parte de sus compañeras de trabajo, y Martha está segura que al iniciar de esta forma su negocio, podrá lograr poco a poco lograr su objetivo. Ella es una de las fundadoras de su grupo, y recuerda sus primeros créditos como la oportunidad de salir adelante, y a pesar de haber salido por gran tiempo del grupo, hoy sus compañeras le abren nuevamente las puertas de su banco comunal porque es una mujer responsable. Con el crédito de 2000 soles comprará los pedidos  que le han hecho, y así iniciar su negocio con el pie derecho.
texts.en:
Martha is a very happy 34-year-old woman. Alongside her partner and three children, she tries to progress and would like to have her own home very soon. In the meantime, they will continue to live in her parent’s house. She has been working as an accountant for a firm for more than 3 years, but her work schedule is taking her away from her loved ones. Even though she benefits from a salary, Martha will try to increase her savings by investing in the purchase of a stand where she can sell clothing. She is close to doing this because of her partner’s support. However, even though she doesn’t have a place to sell from, she’s already beginning to receive requests for items of clothing from her colleagues at work. Martha is certain that by starting her business in this way, she will be able to reach her goal bit by bit. She is one of the founders of this group and remembers how her first loans were an opportunity for her to get ahead. In spite of having left the group for some time, today her friends are opening the doors of their communal bank to her because she is a responsible woman. She will purchase the clothing that has been ordered with this loan of 2000 soles and in this way begin her business on the right foot.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Yawovi Mawulom

texts.fr: Monsieur  M. Yawovi Mawulom est un jeune homme âgé de 31 ans qui a pour activité la vente des produits pharmaceutiques dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2007 et son objectif est de venir en aide aux personnes qui habitent dans son quartier. En 2007 il avait obtenu le premier crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Actuellement son stock est à moitié vide et il sollicite ce second crédit pour faire l’achat d’un lot de médicament dans la ville d’Accra la capitale du GHANA.
texts.en:
Mr. M. Yawovi Mawulom is a young man of 31 whose business is the sale of pharmaceutical products in the Agoè neighborhood. He got into this business in 2007 and his goal is to come to the aid of the people who live in his neighborhood. In 2007, he got his first loan from WAGES and paid it back appropriately. Presently, his inventory is half gone and he is asking for a second loan to buy a shipment of medicines from the town of Accra, the capital of Ghana.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pharmaceutical products for resale

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La señora Rina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en la comunidad de Punta Saguacasi, Sector Acochupa.  Ella posee estudios  de  primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de galletas y golosinas.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró máss productos y obtener mas ganancias.

Con este préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevos soles, comprará mas golosinas, galletas y gaseosa, para ser vendidos en las ferias existentes en la zona.

Le gustaría  tener una tienda bien surtida para distribución al por mayor. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda muy grande.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha la puntualidad y el cumplimiento en el pago de las cuotas, así como las charlas que les dan y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the Punta Sahuascasi community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 34, married, and has three children. She lives in the Punta Saguacasi community, Sector Acochupa. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She sells cookies and sweets. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy more products and get more earnings. With this loan for 400 PEN she will buy more sweets, cookies, and soft drinks to sell in the fairs in her zone. She would like to have a well stocked store for wholesale distribution. Her dream is to be able to have a very large store. She likes the punctuality and the accomplishment of paying back the loans. She also likes the talks they give and the sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, sweets, and soft drinks

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 7 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tonT. interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and and get financing for their businesses quickly. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Cristina Primitiva

texts.es:
La señora Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas de Oro” en el Distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad y es madre soltera de 03 hijos. Vive en el Barrio Cesar Vallejo, ella no tiene estudios. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, es socia fundadora. La actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de chuño (papa procesada).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, comprará más chuño para luego venderlo en el mercado.
Su deseo es  comprar un puesto comercial de abarrotes y darle educación a sus hijos.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y la facilidad en los préstamos que da Manuela Ramos
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Palomas de Oro community bank in the Puno district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 38 and the single mother of three children. She lives in the Cesar Vallejo neighborhood. She does not have an education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. She is a founding member. She buys and sells chuño (freeze-dried potatoes). Her first loan was for 300 PEN. With this loan for 600 PEN she will buy more chuño to later sell in the market. Her wish is to buy a grocery stand and give her children a good education. She really likes her community bank meetings and the easy access to loans through Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chuño (freeze-dried potatoes)

loans.name: Yovo Yawo

texts.fr:
A. Yovo Yawo  célibataire âgé de 26 ans est un jeune très dynamique qui a pour activité la vente des friperies dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé, localité dans laquelle le commerce est développé. Depuis qu’il a quitté les bancs d’école, il a commencé le commerce de friperie pour femmes, pour enfant et pour homme. Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé chez un fournisseur qui lui livre les marchandises à crédit.
Actuellement vu l’évolution de son activité, il veut être autonome et souhaite acheter et payer au comptant. A cet effet, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 2 bales de pantalon et 2 bales de t-shirt.
texts.en:
A. Yovo Yawo, single, aged 26, is an energetic young man who sells used clothing in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood, a locality where commerce is highly developed. Ever since he left school, he began selling used clothing for women, children, and men. He buys his inventory at the big open-air market in Lomé from a supplier who lets him have merchandise on credit.

In view of his present situation, he wants to be independent and would like to pay cash. With this in mind, he is requesting this first loan to buy 2 bales of pants and 2 bales of T-shirts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Rose Abéni

texts.fr: Cette femme  est une résidente du quartier d’agoè, elle est divorcée de son mari et vit seule avec ses quatre enfants. L’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de peintures. Avant de débuter cette activité, elle a obtenu un crédit de WAGES qu'elle a déjà remboursé. Elle reçoit des commandes des entrepreneurs, des maçons et aussi des particuliers. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2004.  La demande de ses clients est de plus en plus élevée, pour y faire face, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter 35 boîtes de peintures « SCIL » de différentes qualités.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the neighborhood of Agoe, she is divorced from her husband and lives alone with her four children. Her business is the sale of paint. Before she started this activity, she obtained a loan from WAGES that she has already reimbursed. She receives orders from contractors, masons, and individuals. She started this business in 2004. Her customers' requests are getting higher and higher. In order to meet the demand, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to purchase 35 cans of paint "SCIL" of different quality.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cans of paint

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 1 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and get financing for their businesses without a long delay. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of produce at local weekly markets and in fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 2 Group

C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and get financing for their businesses without a long delay. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in the town

loans.name: Baseliza Mey

texts.es:
La señora Baseliza Mey C. R. tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Técnica, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Baseliza  tiene como negocio principal su salón de belleza  lugar en el cual también ofrece sus productos de belleza. Con el crédito otorgado la empresaria inicio con la venta de productos de belleza, luego con la venta de productos lácteos (queso, manjarblanco) logrando más adelante equipar su salón de belleza. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de lacas, tijeras, cepillos y líquidos (accesorios para el salón de belleza).
Baseliza tiene como sueño poner una peluquería y vender sus productos de belleza en un lugar más céntrico.
texts.en:
Baseliza Mey C. R., 37, lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Perú. She attended a technical college. She has two dependent children. Her main business is her beauty salon where she also sells beauty products. With a loan she started selling beauty products. Then, she started selling dairy products like cheese and manjar blanco (a dessert made from milk and sugar). She was able to move forward in equipping her beauty salon. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, she bought beauty products. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy hairspray, scissors, brushes, and solutions (supplies for the beauty salon). Baseliza’s dream is to establish a beauty salon and sell her beauty products in a more central location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hairspray, scissors, brushes, and solutions

loans.name: Adria Celmira

texts.es:
La señora Adria Celmira Q. D. C. tiene 56 años, vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudio Primaria Completa.
Adria se dedica a la venta D. sandalias D. vestir, inició su negocio con la venta D. utensilios D. cocina, por motivos D. comodidad y economía, empezó a dedicarse a la fabricación D. sandalias, lo distribuye por diversos mercados D. la provincia D. Trujillo, la fabricación del calzado lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra D. utensilios D. cocina.
Con el crédito D. 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales para la fabricación D. sandalias (plantas, badana, cintos D. colores).
Adria tiene como sueño mejorar la calidad del calzado que fabrica con diseños exclusivos.
texts.en:
Ms. Adria Celmira Q. D. C. is 56 years old and lives in the Florencia D. Mora area of the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Peru. Adria completed her high school studies. She sells sandals for a living. She began her business selling kitchen utensils, but for more convenience and because it’s cheaper, she began to make sandals in her home. She sells the sandals in various markets in Trujillo. She invested the first loan of 300 soles that she got from her communal bank “Unidas para Futuro Mejor II,” in the purchase of kitchen utensils. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy materials to make sandals with like: soles, skin (similar to leather), and colorful ties. Adria dreams of improving the footwear she makes with exclusive designs.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MATERIALES PARA FABRICACION DE SANDALIAS

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Née en 1964 dans le village de Zafi, localité située  à  47 Km de Lomé, dame A. Yawa est une veuve avec trois enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente de poissons fumés. Ce type de poisson est apprécié par la plupart des populations de Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana et est une revendeuse ambulante c’est-à-dire qu'elle vend de maison en maison. Voulant augmenter son stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 paniers de poissons fumés et payer les frais de transport. Avec le revenu de son activité, elle pourra prendre en charge les frais scolaire de ses enfants et assumer les autres dépenses domestiques.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in the village of Zafi, situated 47 km from Lomé, Yawa is a widow with three children. Her business is selling smoked fish. This type of fish is appreciated by most of the inhabitants of Lomé. She buys her merchandise in Ghana and, as an ambulant saleswoman, she sells it door-to-door. Wishing to expand her stock, she is requesting this first loan to buy 10 baskets of fish and pay the transport costs. With the revenue from her business, she will be able to pay school fees for her children and cover other household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 3 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and get financing for their businesses with only a brief delay. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in the town

loans.name: Marlin Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Marlin es soltera, de 47 años de edad, trabajadora del MINSA, con 25 años de servicio, 2 hijos: uno trabaja y estudia el 5to año de secundaria, habita en casa de su papá pero estan haciendo los tramites para ponerla a su nombre, esta solicitando su 8vo credito el que utilizara para cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en pesimas condiciones, no recibe apoyo de nadie, pero con su salario el que ha sabido administrar ha podido salir adelande y ha cumplido en tiempo y forma con el pago de las cuotas de sus creditos, pues nunca ha presntado ningun atraso.  Esta satisfecha con la atencion que brinda AFODENIC y no cambiara por otra, pues ya es muy conocida y con tranquilidad plantea sus inquietudes.
texts.en:
Marlin, 47, is single. She has worked for MINSA (Nicaragua Ministry of Health) for 25 years. She has two children. One works and is in the fifth year of secondary studies. She lives in her father’s house, but they are working on the paper work to put it in her name. She is asking for her eighth loan, which will be used to change the roof of her house. The roof is currently in very bad shape. She does not receive help from anyone. But, with her salary, which she has known how to manage, she has been able to get ahead. She has made all of her payments for her loans on time and as agreed upon. She has never been late with any of the loan payments. She is pleased with the attention AFODENIC offers, and she would not change for another. She is well known, and she very calmly raises her concerns.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof

loans.name: Lucila Konturnina

texts.es:
La señora Lucila  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente con 03 hijos a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado  Nº 465 Barrio Vilca Apaza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. casi 03 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que pagara en 06 cuotas; el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas productos y aumentar su negocio, y le gustaría poner una tienda grande bien surtida.

A ella le gusta mucho el cumplimiento de las socias y los ahorros y las charlas que les da Manuela R..
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the “Aswancaris II” Communal Bank in Azangaro province, department of Puno. She is 39 years old, and lives at Nº 465 Leoncio Prado St. in the Vilca Apaza neighborhood with her 3 children. Lucila has worked with the Manuela R. organization for almost 3 years. She makes a living buying and selling groceries. Her first loan from Manuela R. was for 500.00 soles. Lucila is currently seeking a loan of 2500.00 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments. She will use the loan to purchase more products and increase her business. She would like to have a large, well-stocked store. Lucila really likes the Manuela R. organization because of the financial success of its members, the savings, and the lectures that it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, canned foods, soft drinks, eggs, and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of local produce in the weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in the town

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La señora Mary Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos; Posee estudios superiores incompletos (educación).  Vive en la Av. De la Cultura pasaje Buena Vista.
Trabaja desde hace 1 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Con su primer préstamo de S/ 500.00 inició su negocio de preparación y elaboración de comidas al paso.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles podrá ampliar su negocio de venta de comidas al paso, comprará insumos para elaborar sandwich de pollo, de chorizo y otros; de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos;  así mismo quiere terminar la construcción de su casa.
Le gustan mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, el compañerismo entre las socias y la puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is a member of the Las Fronterizas community bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 36, married, and has two children. She went to high school, but she did not finish. She lives on Av. De la Cultura, Pasaje Buena Vista. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. With her first loan for 500 PEN she started her business of making and selling takeout food. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will be able to expand her takeout food business. She will buy supplies for making chicken sandwiches, sausage sandwiches, and others. By doing this she will contribute to improving the quality of her children’s education. For herself, she would like to finish the construction of her house. She really likes the community bank’s meetings, the camaraderie between members, and the punctuality of their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, potatoes, eggs, vegetables, bread, noodles

loans.name: Patricia Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Maribel R. R. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Patricia se dedica a la venta de joyas de oro y plata, este negocio lo desarrolla conjuntamente con su esposo quien se encarga de la fabricación, anteriormente fabricaban en pocas cantidades, ahora lo distribuye en diversas joyerías de la ciudad de Trujillo.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II, lo invirtió en la compra de material para la elaboración de joyas como el oro y la plata
Con el crédito de 2000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como cremas y ceras en barra, gasolina, bencina, oro y plata.
Patricia tiene como sueño poner una tienda exclusiva para la venta de joyas.
texts.en:
Patricia Maribel R. R., 35, lives in the Florencia de Mora district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She has a high school education. She has two dependent children. Patricia sells gold and silver jewelry. She and her husband run the business. He makes the jewelry. Previously, he made small amounts. Now, they distribute to various jewelry stores in the city of Trujillo. With the first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, Unidadas para un Futoro Mejor II, she bought materials like gold and silver for making jewelry. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy materials like creams, bars of wax, gasoline, benzene, gold and silver. Patricia’s dream is to set up an exclusive jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy creams, bars of wax, gasoline, benzene, gold and silver

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi A. est revendeuse de divers articles à Wome. Elle étale ses marchandises sur une étagère au bord de la route. Amavi souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des marchandises pour la revente. Cette chance lui permettra d’augmenter ses gains et par conséquent l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille
texts.en:
Amavi A. is a retailer of various goods in Wome. She displays her merchandise on a rack on the roadside. She wishes to use this loan to expand her business by buying merchandise for resale. This chance will enable her to increase her profits and consequently to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Cliffor Sebastian

texts.es: Cliffor es casado, de 26 años de edad, tiene un niño de 4 años de edad estudiando el pre-escolar, trabaja para el MINSA desde hace 6 años, esta solicitando su 5to credito, el que utilizara para pagar la mano de obra de su vivienda, la que ya esta en construccion, con los creditos anteriores compro materiales, pues es urgente para el tener su vivienda para su familia, ya que actualmente estan habitando en casa de la mamà de su esposa y esto les trae muchas complicaciones.  Cliffor es un excelente cliente y trabajador, sus deseo es pagar en el menor tiempo posible su credito para solicitar otro y finalizar la construccion de su vivienda que ha sido un sueño para el.
texts.en:
Cliffor is a 26-year-old married father of a 4-year-old son who is in preschool. He has been working for MINSA for 6 years. He is requesting his 5th loan, which he wants to use so that he can pay for laborers for his home construction. With the previous loans, he purchased materials. For him, he urgently needs to have his own family home because they are currently living at his mother-in-law’s house, which is causing them many problems. Cliffor is an excellent client and worker. He hopes to pay off his loan in the least amount of time as possible so that he can request another one and finalize construction of his house, which has been his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 6 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women members of the group have been united by neighborly ties for a long time. They are in a federal group of all the women of the community of Thiès. This association is subdivided into groups of five to facilitate the managing of it. The groups are created by affinity among the women themselves. The group members do a diversity of income-generating work and support their husbands in providing for their respective families. The group used to finance itself through an internal tontine, but with IMCEC credit, greater financing in a short time can be gotten for businesses. Most of the women have displays of goods at the central market of Thiès, where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy local products in weekly rural marketplaces and fishing areas for resale in town

loans.name: Vilma Elida

texts.es:
La señora Elida es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 03 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de preparación de alimentos (polleria) con S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará mas víveres, así como insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio, de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos ya que quiere darles una profesión.
A la señora Elida le gusta mucho las reuniones y orientaciones que se les da Manuela Ramos, dice que les da aliento para seguir adelante
texts.en:
Ms. R. is a member of the “Las Fronterizas” microfinance institute in the district of Desaguadero of the Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is a 33-year-old married mother with three children. She also completed high school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years. She started her food sales (chicken) business with a 300.00 PEN loan. With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more provisions and supplies necessary to restock her business, thus she can contribute to improving the quality of her children’s education because she wants them to become professionals.

Ms. R. really likes the meetings and orientations that Manuela Ramos gives them. She says that they give her the encouragement she needs to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, chicken, vegetables, potatoes, natural gas, and spices

loans.name: Brigida Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Brigida.  Es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad,  vive en el Jr. Rinconada s/n Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la  venta de comida, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar mas víveres para la preparación de comida para la venta

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas víveres, y de esta manera seguir haciendo crecer su negocio.  Le gustaría poner un restaurante bien grande.

A ella le gusta mucho las reuniones y los encuentros deportivos ya que es una forma de compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Brigida is a member of the “Aswancaris II” Microfinance Institute in the Azangaro province, department of Puno. She is 42 years old and lives in the Ezequiel Urbiola neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years. She has her own food sales business. Her first loan, which was in the amount of 300.00 PEN, was used to purchase more provisions for food preparation and sales.

She currently wishes to obtain a 500.00 PEN loan, which will help her to purchase more provisions, thus continuing to make her business grow. She would like to set up a big restaurant one day.

She really likes the institute’s meetings and sports events because they provide a way of spending time with her fellow group members.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, rice, noodles, condiments, and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Áreas tiene 35 años de edad, casada, habita en Laureles Sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos que los tiene estudiando. Tiene por meta en la vida que sus hijos se preparen para que tengan un mejor futuro, también construir su casa como el patrimonio que posee.
Doña Rosa al ver que  la búsqueda de trabajo estaba difícil surgió la idea de crear su propio negocio en la venta de  ropa y cosméticos y que la misma vez pueda encargarse de sus hijos y los quehaceres del hogar. Iniciándolo con fondo de préstamos y algunos ahorros que en su momento tenia, las cualidades de su negocio, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en comprar, ropa, perfume, cosméticos, cremas entre otros que pueda generarle buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Áreas is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. She has two children who are in school. Her goal in life is to help prepare her children so that they can have a better future. She would also like to build her own house as her patrimony.

Upon realizing that seeking employment was difficult, Ms. Áreas decided to create her own clothing and cosmetics business so that she could work, while at the same time look after her children and complete her household chores. She started her own business with loans and some money that she had saved up at the time. This is her fifth loan cycle with Afodenic, and she will invest the loan in purchasing apparel, perfume, cosmetics, lotions, and other products that will generate good profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel, cosmetics, and perfume

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth  es soltera, de 41 años de edad, es trabajadora del Hospital Asuncion desde hace 19 años,  tiene 2 hijos, uno estudia en la universidad y el otro en nivel pre-escolar, no tgiene apoyo de nadie, pero con su salario y los creditos realizados ha podido salir adelante, pues ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y costearse su carrera universitaria, ya que el credito anterior lo utilizo para los gastos de su titulo, esta solicitando su 6to credito para finalizar la construccion de 2 cuartos, faltandole comprar el techo, puertas y ventanas, y ademas subir un poco las paredes.  Cuenta con buen record crediticio y responsabilidad en su trabajo, lo que permitira estabilidad laboral y asi cancelar en tiempo y forma sus compromisos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 41-year-old single woman who has been working at the Asuncion Hospital for 19 years. She has two children, one of whom is in college while the other is in preschool. She does not get support from anyone, however, she has been able to get ahead with her salary and the loans that she has obtained. She has managed to improve her home and pay for her university studies with her previous loans, which she used to pay for the costs related to her degree. She is requesting her 6th loan so that she can finish building two rooms. She still needs to pay for the roof, doors, windows, and raise the walls a little more. She has good credit history and is very responsible at work, which will allow her job stability so that she can pay back her loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building two bedrooms

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 8 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza y cuenta con estudios de 1er grado de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para la venta de frutas y gaseosas.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de frutas, gaseosas, mana (cereal) y así poder agrandar su negocio.
