Su mayor deseo es tener su triciclo donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank located in the Mazocruz district found in the Callao province in the state of Puno. She is 57 years old, married and has eight children. She lives in Barrio Villa Esperanza and has a first grade education. Elena has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 11 years and her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and allowed her to increase her capital in order to sell fruits and soft drinks. Now she requires a loan for 1,500 soles that will allow her to buy a larger quantity of fruits, soft drinks and cereal and in that way grow her business. Her biggest desire is to have a tricycle she can use to show her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa N. est une jeune fille de 25 ans, célibataire sans enfants. elle réside à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. L’activité de Yawa consiste à acheter des noix de palme et prépare de l’huile rouge à partir de ces derniers. Cette activité est très prometteuse à cause de la forte demande de la population en huile de palme. Yawa compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Yawa N. is a girl, 25 years old, unmarried, and without children. She resides in Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Her work involves buying palm nuts and making red oil from them. This business is very promising because of the population’s strong demand for palm oil. Yawa is counting on this opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Hector Francisco

texts.es: Don Hector es soltero, de 51 años de edad, trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 30 años, esta solicitando su 6to credito para comprar zinc y cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y con el invierno se moja; sus creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para invertirlos en su vivienda, como levantar paredes, pintura, etc, no tiene apoyo de nadie, sus 2 hijos son estudiantes universitarios. Don Hector es tecnico en refrigeracion y los fines de semana realiza trabajos a domicilio como son reparacion de equipos dentales y refrigeracion, con lo que obtiene un ingreso aproximado de cinco mil cordobas con los que hace frente a la educacion de sus hijos.  Durante sus 5 creditos ha demostrado moral de pago y un excelente record crediticio.
texts.en:
Hector is 51 years old and single. He has worked for the Asuncion Hospital for the past 30 years. He is requesting his sixth loan from AFODENIC to buy zinc to put a new roof onto his house, since his current roof is in bad shape and leaks in the winter. He has also invested his previous loans in his home (for example, to build walls and to paint). He doesn't receive financial help from anyone else, since his two children are college students. Hector is a cooling system technician, and on weekends he repairs dental equipment and refrigerators, which earns him about 5000 cordobas (US$340) per month to help pay for his children's education. With his previous five loans, Hector has shown himself to be reponsable with repayments; he has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc for new roof

loans.name: Koessi

texts.fr: Koessi T. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Agé de 26 ans, Koessi est célibataire sans enfants. Il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter sa propre moto étant donné que celle qu’il utilise n’est pas de sa propriété. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Koessi T. is a moto-taxi driver in Wome. At the age of 26, Koessi is single and has no children. He wants to use this loan to buy his own motorbike since the one he is using is not his. He is counting on this chance to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora. Mercedes Sánchez, tiene 54 años, habita en el barrio campo bruce en la capital de Managua, madre soltera con tres hijos todos independientes, el mejoramiento de su vivienda y nivel de vida son los planes a corto y largo plazo. Doña Mercedes al ser una madre soltera tiene que asumir todos los gastos de la casa y los personales. Desde muy joven inicio a trabajar lavando y planchando, cuidando niños, vendiendo ambulantemente. Ahora tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de tortilla, es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora. Que gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic ha obtenido la oportunidad de adquirir fondos económicos para seguir creciendo, el préstamo será invertido en capital de trabajo, los productos que comprar son: maíz, leña, frijoles, queso y cremas para vender mayores cantidades y obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mercedes Sánchez is 54 years old and lives in the Campo Bruce neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is the single mother of three children, all of whom are now independent. Mercedes' short- and long-term goals are to improve her home and improve her quality of life. Since Mercedes is a single mother, she is responsible for all personal and household spending. When she was quite young she started washing and ironing clothes, caring for children, and selling on the street. She now has her own small tortilla-selling business and is a very enterprising, hard-working woman. Thanks to Afodenic loans, she has been able to acquire funds to continue expanding her business. She will use this loan as working capital, and will buy corn, firewood, beans, cheese and cream so that she can produce and sell more tortillas and thus earn more in profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, beans, firewood, cheese, cream

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi G. est un acheteur de produits café-cacao. Il opère dans ce secteur depuis 7 ans et connaît tous les rouages du métier. Son activité consiste à acheter des ces produits auprès des agriculteurs et les revend aux exportateurs internationaux. Pour redonner de l’espoir à son activité, Koffi souhaite avec ce nouveau acheter des marchandises pour la revente. Cette aubaine lui permettra de donner mieux entretenir sa famille. Il faut noter que la photo est prise dans son salon.
texts.en:
Koffi G. is a coffee and cocoa buyer. He has been working in this sector for 7 years and knows all the tricks of the trade. His business consists in buying these products from the farmers and selling them to international exporters. To put some hope back into his business, Koffi hopes to use this new loan to buy these products for resale. This chance will allow him to do better by his family. Please note that his photo was taken in his living-room.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cocoa and coffee for resale

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: La Señora Ana Zeledón tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur en la ciudad de Managua, casada su esposo trabaja como fiscal de proyectos, tiene dos hijos y sus planes es terminar de construir su casa. Doña Ana trabaja como domestica, es un trabajo muy duro, pero es un ingreso que  beneficia a su familia. El préstamo que solicitad en Afodenic es para comprar materiales como: cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, arena. Para realizar unas divisiones internas y cambio de techo y una pared, este es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic el cual se ha beneficiado para ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda que es una necesidad.
texts.en:
Ana Zeledón is 51 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of the city of Managua. She is married, and her husband works as a district attorney. The couple has two children, and their plan is to finish building their house. Ana works as a housekeeper. The job is very demanding, but her income benefits her family. The loan she is requesting from Afodenic will be used to buy materials like cement, iron, zinc, c-bars and sand so that she can construct interior walls and put a new roof on her house. This is her ninth loan from Afodenic; these loans have allowed her to make the necessary improvements to her house, bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build interior walls

loans.name: Ameyo's Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VOVOLE est composé de 5 femmes. Elles sont spécialisées dans la production de l’huile de palme à base des noix de palme. Avec ce crédit le groupement souhaite s’approvisionner en noix de palme et aussi acheter des matériels nécessaires pour la production de l’huile rouge. Elles ont fois a leur association et espèrent que cette chance changera beaucoup de chose dans leur vie
texts.en:
The group VOVOLE is made up of 5 women. They are specialized in producing palm oil from palm nuts. With this loan, the group wants to buy palm nuts and also to buy other necessary materials for producing "red oil" (palm oil). They have faith in their association and hope that this opportunity will change a lot of things in their lives.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing palm nuts for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: El Señor  Félix Obando, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua. Casado su esposa trabajo como tortillera para adquirir otros ingresos, tiene cuatros hijos pero tres son independientes y el menor que esta a su dominio. Iniciaron un proyecto de construcción en su vivienda pero por falta de recursos económicos no lo han culminado. Don Félix se desempeña como maestro de obra por contratos desde hace 8 años. Lo cual se le hace más fácil para la construcción. Sus planes en lo laboral es montar su pequeña compañía. Este es su sexto ciclo, en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo lo cual lograra poner una solera en el patio de su casa comprando los materiales tales como: zinc, perlines, clavos de acero, entre otros materiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Obando is 43 years old and resides in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua. He is married and his wife works making tortillas for additional income. He has three children, three are independent and the youngest is still in his care.

They began a construction project on their house but they lack the economic resources to complete it. Mr. Félix has worked as a foreman on contracted projects for 8 years. His work plans are to better his small company. This is his sixth cycle with Afodenic and he is thankful for the support, which he will invest in the base construction on his patio and the purchase of materials such as: zinc, steel nails and other materials.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for the construction of a patio on the back of his house.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.fr: Dzifa H. est une femme de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle revend des poissons et des légumes à Womé, un village situé à 130 kilomètres  de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Dzifa manque de fonds de roulement pour relancer son activité. Avec ce crédit elle souhaite donner un élan à son commerce. Avec les recettes, elle compte rembourser son crédit et épargner une partie pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Dzifa H., 50, is married and the mother of 4 children. She resells fish and vegetables in Womé, a village located 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Dzifa doesn't have enough working capital to get her business up and running again. With this loan, she hopes to jump-start her business. With the earnings, she expects to make repayments on the loan and save a part to use for household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Vinaca

texts.es:
La señora Vinaca pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tien 60 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 02 hijos, no tiene estudios; vive en la Comunidad de Lupaza sector Patáni. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, tiene su negocio de compra y neta de ganado menor, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00  nuevos soles, que invirtió como capital adicional. 
Debido a la demanda de sus clientes, actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de más cabezas de ganado para incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia. 
A la señora Vinaca le gusta mucho los ahorros y las reuniones en las cuales, nos cuenta, que se distrae mucho con sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
Vinaca belongs to “Rio Desaguadero” communal bank in the district Desaguadero, province Chucuito, department Puno. She is 60 years old, widdowed, and has 02 children. She has not gone to school. She lives in the Lupaza community in the Patáni area. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She has her business purchasing and clearing small livestock. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 which she used for additional capital. Due to demand from her customers, she now needs a loan of S/. 3000.00 so that she can purchase more livestock and increase her income, and help her family. Vinaca really likes savings and the meetings, in which, she tells us, she enjoys herself with the other women.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing alpacas and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing garments

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, estado civil  conviviente 03 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara,  y estudio hasta 3ro de primaria. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de ropa, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 1700,00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar ropa por docenas, además aumentara capital para su negocio de venta de helados y yogurt.
Le gustaría formar una pequeña empresa distribuidora.

Adelaida, nos cuenta que le gustan mucho las reuniones y los ahorros y las charlas que Manuela Ramos imparte
texts.en:
Adelaida belongs to “Yunga Uyo” communal bank, in the district Yunguyo, province Chucuito, department Puno. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has 03 children. She lives in Barrio Santa Bárbara, and completed studies through 3rd grade. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. She buys and sells clothing. Her first loan was for S/ 300.00. Now she would like an additional loan of S/ 1700,00, which will allow her to buy clothing by the dozen, and also to increase capital for her business selling ice cream and yogurt. She would like to become a small wholesaler. Adelaida tells us that she really likes the meetings, savings, and the chats she has with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing and ingrediants for making ice cream and yogurt

loans.name: Norma Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente con 04 hijos a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Barrio Revolución. Tiene estudios de 3ro de segundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de carne, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que utilizó para comprar mas carne.
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero podrá adquirir mas carne para que su negocio crezca y tener mas ganancias.  Pinesa poner una boutique.

A ella le gusta mucho la forma de pago, los ahorros y los encuentros deportivos que realiza su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Aswancaris II Communal Bank in the province of Azangaro located in the state of Puno. She is 32 years old and a common-law wife with four children under her care. She lives in the Jr. Barrio Revolución neighborhood and has a third grade education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year. Her business is buying and selling meat. Her first loan was for 300 soles and was used to purchase more meat. Now she would like a loan for 1,500. With this money she will be able to purchase more meat so her business can grow and she can earn more. She is thinking of buying a boutique. She likes very much the form of payment, the savings and the sporting events that her communal bank organizes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Doña Enriqueta es soltera, tiene 40 años deedad y es trabajadora del Hospital Asuncion como secretaria desde hace 20 años, tiene una hija de 18 años, el proximo año iniciara una carrera universitaria, esta solicitando su 5to credito el que utilizara para levantar una pared al fondo de su casa para evitar que la corriente del invierno le deteriore su casa, en un futuro esta pared sera utilizada para la construccion de un dormitorio.  Doña Enriqueta no tiene apoyo de nadie, ademas de su trabajo de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana vende cosmeticos con lo que se ayuda para los gastos del hogar y algun otro compromiso, sus creditos anteriores los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, demostrando hasta la fecha un excelente record crediticio.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is single, 40 years old and has worked as a secretary at Aunción Hospital for 20 years. She has an 18 year old daughter who will start university next year. She is requesting her fifth loan that will be used to build a wall in the back of her home to keep the winter waters from damaging her house. In the future this wall will be used for the construction of a bedroom. Enriqueta doesn't have help from anyone and besides, her work is from Monday to Friday and on the weekends she sells cosmetics and that helps with household expenses and another commitment. Her previous loans were paid on time which proves up until now she has an excellent credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
La señora Laureana es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II”, de la provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos, ella posee estudios superiores incompletos. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes.  Con su primer préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, compró más abarrotes para ofrecerlose en su tiendita. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles, con este dinero ella comprará mas mercadería (fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite), y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su mayor deseo es darle su profesión a sus hijos.

La señora indica que le gustan mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y las facilidades de de pago que les brindan el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laureana is a member of the Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” (Aswancaris II Communal Bank) in the province of Azangaro, department of Puno. She is 32 years old, a single mother and has two children. She has an incomplete college education.

She has worked with El Movimiento Manuela Ramos (The Manuela Ramos Movement) for two years. She works buying and selling groceries. With her first loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles she bought more groceries in order to offer them in her small store.

Currently she hopes for an additional loan of S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles. With this money she will buy more merchandise (noodles, rice, sugar, oil), and in this way she will continue to grow her business. Her greatest desire is to give her profession to her children.

Mrs. Laureana indicates that she very much likes the meetings of her communal bank and the simplicity of payments that The Manuela Ramos Movement supports them with.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, sugar, milk, oil and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Marbelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Marbelly es casada, de 30 años de edad, trabajadora del Centro Social SOS Juigalpa como coordinadora administrativa desde hace 5 años, tiene una niña en nivel pre-escolar, su esposo tiene un negocio en Santo Tomas Chontales y es quien asume los gastos del hogar, ella con su salario paga la cuota mensual de su casa y este caso ahora pagara la cuota del credito. Esta solicitando su 1er credito, el cual utilizara para la ampliacion de su vivienda y construira un anexo que sera destinado para utilizarlo como cocina y comedor y darle mas privacidad a su familia, pues estan utilizando la sala como cocina y comedor.  Es conocida como una persona responsable y con alto espiritu de superacion, ya que despues de trabajar de lunes a viernes, los sabados ayuda al esposo en el negocio y los domingos estudia.
texts.en:
Marbelly is married, 30 years old, and has worked as an administrative coordinator in the Centro Social SOS Juigalpa for five years. She has a daughter who's in preschool. Her husband has a business in Santo Tomás Chontales and he's the one that takes care of household expenses. With her salary she pays the monthly house payment and now will also make the loan payment. She is requesting her first loan that will be used to increase the size of her home by constructing an annex that will be used as a kitchen an dining area and give her family more privacy because they are currently using the living room as the kitchen and dining room. She is known as a responsible person with a strong spirit and desire to get ahead because, after working Monday through Friday, on Saturdays she helps her husband with his business and on Sundays she studies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kitchen and dining area

loans.name: Elvira Alexandre

texts.pt:
Elvira Alexandre C. é natural de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre 26; 23 e 15 anos respectivamente. Alem dos filhos, sustenta um irmão que vive com ele.

Elvira estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, a mais de 10 anos que Elvira vive de negocio qual aprendeu através da sua mãe que é comerciante, o negocio consiste na compra e venda produtos da primeira necessidade com destaque a farinha de milho que compra uma embalagem de 10kg por 130,00mt e vende por 210,00mt. Deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal liquido 3000,00mt.

Elvira solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Futuramente Elvira pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para compra de congelador afim de ver mariscos.
texts.en:
Elvira Alexandre C. is from Maputo, she is 42 years old and is married y has 3 children who are between 26, 23 and 15 years old. Besides two sons, she also supports a brother who lives with them. Elvira didn't finished school because of the lack of financial support, for the last 10 years Elvira lives from her business which she learned from her mother who is a salesperson, she buys and sells first need products, her main product is corn flour for which she buys 10kg for 130,00mt and sells for 210,00mt. This business has a net profit of 3000,00mt. Elvira is requesting the loan for the first time with Hluvuku and Kiva in order to increase her stock. In the future Elvira wants to request another loan in order to buy a freezer to sell seafood.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise, buy and sell of diverse products

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La señora Maura. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 31 años  de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, tiene estudios de segundaria incompleta (3ro de segundaria) 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años tiene su negocio de compra y venta utensilios de cocina, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00  nuevos  soles, que invirtió como capital adicional. 
Debido a la demanda de sus clientes, actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de utensilios de cocina, cuchillos, cubiertos, ollas, tazas, termos, platos, para incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia.  Nos cuenta que trabaja con doble capital ya que su negocio no pagan al contado es pagadero en 15 días, mientras tanto ella vende huevos al menudeo. Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de utensilios la por mayor y además una cristalería.
A la Señora Maura le Gusta mucho los ahorros, y el cumplimiento por parte de sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the "Rio Desaguadero" community bank of the district of Desaguadero in the province of Chucuito, district of Puno. She is 31 years old, partnered and has one child. She did not complete high school (3rd year of high school). She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for 10 years. She owns her own business, buying and selling kitchen utensils. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she invested as additional capital. Due to customer demand, she now needs a loan of 3000 soles in order to invest in the purchase of kitchen utensils, knives, dishes, pots, cups, vacuum flasks, plates in order to increase her income and to help her family. She says that she is working with double the capital because she is not paid cash, instead she gets paid settled every 15 days. She also sells eggs. Her wish is to open a store to sell utensils and glassware wholesale. Maura is very happy to be saving money and of having her group's respect.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, knives, dishes, pots, cups, vacuum flasks, plates

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esmeralda Q. A. tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria tiene como negocio la venta de abarrotes y de jugo en una bodega, cuando inicio tenia una bodega con pocos productos, ahora administra una bodega surtida y lo ha complementado con la venta de jugos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Recién se ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II
Con el crédito de 300 soles, lo invirtirá en la compra prendas de vestir en diferentes modelos y tallas..
Maria tiene como objetivo ampliar su bodega y poner una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda Q. A. is 31 years old and lives in the district of Casa Grande in the province of Ascope, department of La Libertad, in Peru. She completed high school and has one son who depends on her financially. Maria has a grocery store and sells juice. When she started, she had a store with few products, now she manages a well-stocked store to which she has added juice sales. Her business is located in her home. She recently joined Manuela Ramos and is a member of the "Romanas Luchadoras II" community bank. She will use the 300 soles' loan to buy clothing in a variety of styles and sizes. Maria's goal is to expand her store and open a clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria perteneciente al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de estado civil conviviente; de 31 años de edad, con 2 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos 1/2 año.  Inicio su negocio con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 soles, monto que invirtió en la comercialización de “Salchipapas” (comida al paso), venta de abarrotes al menudeo y bebidas de consumo masivo (cerveza) puesto que según referencia de la señora, esta última actividad le brinda mejores ingresos. 
Actualmente ella pretende mantener su negocio de bebidas (Gaseosas descártales, agua mineral) para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con ello adquirirá mas mercadería para que lo comercialice en las ferias y eventos sociales para poder generar sus ingresos, ayudar a la economía familiar y pagar oportunamente sus cuotas programadas.  Finalmente agradece a la institución por el apoyo brindado a las mujeres hasta la fecha.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Rio Desaguadero" community bank of the district of Desaguadero in the province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is married common-law, is 31 years old and has two children. She graduated from high school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for half a year. She started her business with a 500 soles loan which she invested in the sale of "salchipapas" (street food), selling groceries retail and large-scale sales of drinks (beer) which according to Victoria is her most important source of income. Currently, she wants to maintain her drink-selling business (soft drinks, mineral water) for which she needs a loan of 800 soles in order to sell at the market and at social events in order to generate more income and help her family's finances and pay her loan instalments on schedule. Also, she is grateful to the institution for its support of women.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and mineral water

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
La señora Edita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada,  tiene 2 hijos, y estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 09 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sogas de nylon, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio.  
Ella desea solicitar un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles para poder adquirir mayor materia prima (nylon) y elaborar sogas en mayor volumen, los mismos que los comercializara en los diferentes mercados de la región; obteniendo ganancias que los destinará en la educación de sus hijos; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo
texts.en:
Edita belongs to the "Rio Desaguadero" Village Bank in Desaguadero District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. Edita is 37 years old and married with two children. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the part nine years. She makes and sells Nylon ropes for a living. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she invested the money in her business. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 soles to buy more raw material (Nylon) so that she can make more ropes. She sells her ropes in different regional markets, and will use her profits to pay for her children's education. She has pledged to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Nylon to make ropes

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora  Elvira  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 06 hijos, todos a su cargo; vive en la Avenida la Marina  S/n Barrio Ezequiel Urbícola,  tiene estudios de 3ro de segundaria. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace unos meses, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de verdura, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, para comprar mas verduras.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 1700.00 nuevos soles, para poder adquirir mas verduras, especerías y abarrotes, y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su deseo es seguir trabajando para poder, en el futuro, vender al por mayor su producto y por tener un negocio grande propio.

A ella le gustan los encuentros deportivos y las charlas.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Aswancaris II Village Bank in Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 45 years old and is married with six children, all of whom are dependent on her. She lives on La Marina Ave in an unnumbered house in the Ezequiel Urbícola neighborhood. She completed three years of high school. Elvira has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for several months now. She buys and sells vegetables. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to buy more vegetables. She is currently requesting a loan of 1700 soles to buy more vegetables, spices, and dry goods (i.e. rice, flour, sugar) to keep expanding her business. She wants to continue working so that she can have her own large business selling her products in bulk in the future. She enjoys sporting events and talks.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy carrots, onions, lettuces, oil, tomatoes and eggs

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Eulalia es viuda, tiene 75 años y 4 hijos, Eulalia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende coca, verduras, ropa de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, actividad que realiza una vez por semana.
Eulalia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas, verduras.
Los sueños de Eulalia son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Empecemos ("Let's get started") Village Bank. Eulalia is 75 years old, widowed, and has four children. Eulalia travels once a week to different regional markets to sell coca leaves, vegetables, and clothing, depending on what her customers order. Eulalia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy fruits and vegetables. Eulalia dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Isabel es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene una imprenta llamada SEGMI, en donde brinda servicios diversos como impresión, elaboración de tarjetas, su local es alquilado y esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de andamios y toner.
Los sueños de Isabel son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios en la universidad e implementar su imprenta con maquinas modernas.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the community bank “Empecemos” (“We begin”). Isabel is married. She is 56 years old and has 4 children. Isabel has a printing press called SEGMI, from which she provides various services like printing and card making. Her business location is rented, and is located in the center of the city Ayacucho. It is an activity that she does with the help of her children. Isabel needs a loan of 2600 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of framework and toner. Isabel’s dreams are that her children finish their studies in university and that she can implement modern machines in her printing press.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toner

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Pedro es conviviente, tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, Pedro junto a su esposa tienen una panadería llamada Sótano que esta ubicado en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de 1 personal, sus ventas los realizan en la tienda y también lo reparten a las tiendas.
Pedro necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Pedro son ampliar su negocio e implementar con todas las maquinas su panadería.
texts.en:
Pedro is a member of the community bank “Empecemos” (“We begin”). Pedro lives with his partner. He is 55 years old and has 3 children. Pedro and his wife have a bakery called Sótano (Basement) which is located in a rented spot. For this he has the help of 1 employee. Sales are done in his shop and also in other stores. Pedro needs a loan of 800 soles, money that he would invest in the purchase of flour. Pedro’s dreams are to grow his business and implement machines for use in his bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86588&_tpos=14&_tpg=2
Amelia es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas.
Amelia  es casada tiene 45 años, tres hijos de 24, 18 y 13 años, el ultimo está estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Amelia  trabaja en el cafetín de una empresa dando desayuno desde hace cinco años.
Amelia necesita un préstamo de  1800 soles,  para azúcar, cajas de leche, embutidos, para dar desayunos.
Desde que Amelia esta en Finca agradece por los prestamos, porque puede atender mejor a su clientes, y su economía ha mejorado.
 Es sueño de Amelia es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86588&_tpos=... Amelia is a member of the community bank Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). Amelia is married and is 45 years old. She has 3 children of 24, 18, and 13 years of age. The last is studying in a state school. Amelia works in the café of a business where she has served breakfast for the past 5 years. Amelia needs a loan of 1800 soles for sugar, boxes of milk, and cold cuts for the breakfasts. Since Amelia has been with FINCA, she has been grateful for the loans, because she is able to attend better to her clients and her personal finances have improved. Amelia’s dream is that her children would become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, boxes of milk, and cold cuts for the breakfast she sells

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86590&_tpos=15&_tpg=2
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas
Juana es separada, tiene 51 años su hijo está terminando la universidad.
Juana empezó llevando almuerzo a la universidad D. su hijo y sus amigos le  pidieron que también trajeran para ellos, ella empezó a ofrecer al personal administrativo, han pasado los años y ella lleva 80 menús a la universidad , tuvo que alquilar un cuarto cerca a la universidad, para cocinar, cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan. 
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. una parrilla para venta D. anticuchos. 
 DesD. que Juana esta en Finca pudo lograr muchos sueños y adquirir muchas cosas para su casa.
El sueño D. Juana es tener su tienda D. llantas y poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86590&_tpos=... Juana is a member of the community bank Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). Juana is separated. She is 51 years old. Her son has already finished university. Juana began taking lunch to her son and his friends, who asked her to bring it for them as well. She then began to offer it to the administrative personnel. The years have passed and she has 80 set menus at the university. She has to rent a room close to the university in order to cook, and she has two people who help her. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of a grill so she can sell kebabs. Since Juana has been with Finca she has been able to achieve her dreams and get many more things for her home. Juana’s dream is to have her store on wheels and to put a restaurant on it.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill to make kababs

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Ernestina es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Ernestina viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas en gran parte son al crédito.
Ernestina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos.
Ernestina sueña con tener un negocio estable y grande.
texts.en:
Ernestina is a member of the community bank Paraíso (Paradise). Ernestina lives with her partner, is 24 years old, and has 1 son. Ernestina travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she takes orders for clothing. Her products are gotten in the city of Lima, and her sales are for the most part on credit. Ernestina needs a loan of 900 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of pants and polo shirts. Ernestina's dream is to have a stable and large business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and polo shirts

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Marilu es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Marilu tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Marilu alquila carros a instituciones.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas.
Marilu sueña con abrir otra tienda.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Communal Bank. Marilu is 39 years old, married and has three children. She has a store in her house where she works every day selling groceries, vegetables and fruit. She also rents cars to institutions. Marilu needs a loan of 900 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of display cases. She dreams of opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display cases.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86600&_tpos=17&_tpg=2
María  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas
María es casada tiene 65 años, tres hijos, todos mayores y casados.
María  trabaja con su hermano  en la confección de set para los baños, ella es socia minorista, ella distribuye a las tiendas la mercadería. 
María  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de materiales, como telas afelpadas.
Desde que María esta en Finca, ha sido de gran ayuda ha podido lograr muchas cosas materiales, como construir parte de su casa, aprendió a  desarrollarse en los negocios.  
El sueño María es tener un taller en su casa de confecciones de set de baños.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Orquídeas (The Orchids) Communal Bank. María is 65 years of age and married with three children, all of them adults and married. She works with her brother making bath sets. She is a retail partner and distributes her merchandise to the stores. María needs a loan of 1,000 Sols to buy materials such as plush fabric. Since she has been working with FINCA Peru, it has been a great help and she has been able to achieve material success, such as building a portion of her house and learning how to develop her business. Maria dreams of having a workshop in her house for making bath sets.

Click HERE to see her first loan

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Martha es viuda, tiene 57 años y 7 hijos, Martha vende cebiches en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días por la mañana. Martha tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de abarrotes.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, pescado.
Los sueños de Martha son que sus últimos 3 hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa de material noble y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Paradise Communal Bank. Martha is a widow, is 57 years old and has 7 children. Martha sells ceviche in her home, an activity that she carries out every morning. Martha plans to start a grocery store. Martha needs a loan of 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks and fish. Martha's dreams are for her last 3 children to become professionals, to build a house made of noble material and to grow her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of soft drinks and fish.

loans.name: Julia Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Karina es soltera, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Karina vendía cebiche en la casa de su mama pero actualmente esta terminando de construir su casa para aperturar su Marisquería en un local propio.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una congeladora.
Los sueños de Karina son Terminar de construir su casa, construir un hotel y estudiar gastronomía.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Paraíso Communal Bank.
Karina is 30 years old, single and has 2 children. Karina used to sell ceviche from her mother’s home but now she is finishing construction on her own house, where she’ll open her own seafood restaurant.
Karina needs a loan in the amount of 900 nuevos soles to go towards the purchase of a freezer.
Karina dreams of completing construction on her house, building a hotel and going to culinary school.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Go towards the purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es una dulce mujer, que ama estar en compañía de sus seres queridos, pues vive en su casa rodeada de sus hijos y sus nietos. Siempre le agradó sentirse útil y eficiente, pues no deja de trabajar, se inició como vendedora de dulces, luego de licores y ahora está involucrada en la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años tratando de acercar diversas prendas de vestir a sus vecinas, que no tienen la posibilidad de visitar las tiendas del centro de la ciudad por falta de tiempo y dinero, entonces Antonia les ofrece ropa de buena calidad a precios módicos que tienen que pagar semanalmente. Sin embargo, Antonia no pretende dedicarse sólo a la venta de ropa, sino también tiene el anhelo de invertir sus ahorros en remodelar su casa para instalar una tienda que le de descanso a sus largas horas de caminata de todos estos años. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP y todo este tiempo que viene trabajando con su grupo puede manifestar que las cosas han ido mejorando gracias al involucramiento de cada una de las integrantes. Los 3500 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de mercadería, pues tiene que estar lista para la venta que se realizara por el día de la madre y el padre.
texts.en:
Antonia is a sweet lady who loves to be in the company of her dear ones. So she lives in her house surrounded by her children and grandchildren. She always like to feel useful and efficient, and she never stops working. She started out selling sweets and later sold liquors. Now she is involved with selling clothing. For the last five years she has been trying to bring various articles of clothing to her neighbors who aren't able to visit the stores in the city center due to lack of time or isolation. Antonia doesn't pretend to only sell clothing, but also yearns to remodel her house to create a store, to give her a break from her long hours spent traveling by foot after all these years. This is her thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and during all of the time that she has been working with her group she can say that things have been improving thanks to the involvement of every one of the participants. The 3,500 Sols which she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, so that she will be ready for sales she will make for Mother's Day and Father's Day.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Ivetti

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86603&_tpos=12&_tpg=2
Ivetti estudio corte y confección, y trabajo por años en un taller, hasta que decidió poner en su casa un taller de confección, ella hace ropa sobre medida y recibe  cose para algunas empresas.
Ivetti necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para invertirlos en la compra de  tela, para confección de prendas de vestir. 
Desde que Ivetti está en Finca  aprendió a ahorrar, a ser puntual con los préstamos y ser puntual con las clientas.
El sueño de Ivetti es tener una boutique de ropa, hecha por hecha.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86603&_tpos=12&_tpg=2 Ivetti has studied dressmaking; she worked many years for a workshop before deciding to open her own dress shop in her home. She makes custom-tailored clothing and works as a seamstress for some businesses.She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy cloth for making garments. Since Ivetti became a part of FINCA she has learned to save and to be punctual with both her loans and her clients. Her dream is to eventually own a clothing boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth in order to make garments

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha es una mujer muy entregada a sus labores como esposa, madre y comerciante, ya que son roles con los que brinda satisfacción a sus seres queridos, quienes están contentos por el apoyo que encuentran en ella. Cuando era soltera se dedicó a la venta de productos de belleza y después de casada tuvo que suspender sus actividades laborales por algún tiempo, pero desde hace 6 años retomó su actividad como consultora y promotora de belleza. Esta actividad le está brindando grandes satisfacciones económicas, sobre todo cuando aprovecha las ofertas que brinda la empresa, pues los precios son muy cómodos, sin embargo para obtener ganancias tiene que salir a visitar a sus clientes continuamente  y tratar de relacionarse con más personas quienes en con el tiempo se convertirán en sus clientas. Para seguir progresando desea tener un tienda de cosméticos y accesorios de belleza donde exhibir sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos. Los 5 años que viene trabajando con MFP le sirvieron para relacionarse y tener proyecciones para mejorar, tanto como grupo y personalmente, con la finalidad de que el banco comunal conformado sea una de los mejores en su funcionamiento y desempeño. Con los 1400 soles adquirirá algunos artículos que están en oferta para incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertha is a very involved in her life as a wife, mother, and businesswoman, roles that help her care for her loved ones, who are grateful for the support they find in her. As a single woman she sold beauty products and had to suspend her business after getting married, but for the past 6 years resumed her activities as a beauty consultant. This work has provided her with significant economic benefits, especially when she makes the most of the offers that her business brings. Prices are very favorable; nevertheless, to earn enough she has to go out constantly and visit her clients in order to meet potential future clients. In order to continue her progress she hopes to have her own cosmetics and beauty supply store to show her products and increase her income. The 5 years she has spent with MFP have helped her to network and hold demonstrations in order to improve (personally and as a group), with the purpose of making her loan group one of the best in its operation and management. With these 1400 soles, she will acquire more beauty supply accessories in order to increase the variety of products available to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her available merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es madre soltera, en su casa sólo vive con su pequeño de 3 años, quien es su mayor tesoro y por quien se esfuerza trabajando. Desde que tuvo su pequeño hijo, se dedicó a múltiples actividades, ya que su pareja la abandonó cuando quedó embarazada, pero a pesar de las circunstancias sigue trabajando para ofrecer a su hijo las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Frente a esta necesidad se inició en el negocio de la venta de productos medicinales, ya que obtiene buenos ingresos por su alto costo de venta y la gran demanda que hay de estos productos debido a su efectividad, lo cual la favorece. Sin embargo, Carmen tiene otros ingresos mediante su servicio como cocinera, los fines de semana se instala en la puerta de su casa para ofrecer deliciosos platillos a sus vecinos y visitantes, quienes la están motivando en instalar un restaurante en su casa, y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorros de sus dos actividades podrá realizarlo en algunos meses. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, junto a las personas que conforman su banco comunal, se ordenan para no tener inconvenientes en la administración del dinero. Los 1200 soles que solicita están destinados en la compra de estas medicinas al por mayor, ya que así tiene la posibilidad de tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a single mother and lives with her little 3-year-old, who is her greatest treasure and for whom she works very hard. Since having her young son, she has worked multiple jobs as her partner left her during her pregnancy. In spite of her circumstances she has continued working in order to provide her son with the necessary conditions he needs to grow. Out of necessity she began the business of selling medicine. Their prices and the high demand for them due to their effectiveness have helped her make solid earnings. Nonetheless, Carmen earns other income working as a cook; on the weekends she sets up shop in the doorway of her house to offer delicious meals to her neighbors and visitors, who have been encouraging her to establish a restaurant in her house. With much effort and savings from her two jobs she will be able to accomplish this in a few months. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP, along with the other members of her loan group who have ordered themselves to avoid inconveniences in distributing loan money. The 1200-sole loan will be used to buy medicines wholesale, so that Carmen can maximize her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicines in order to increase merchandise

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery es madre de 2 pequeños a quienes trata de brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida, lo cual es más fácil junto a su esposo, quien es la persona que más apoyo le brinda desde que se casaron. A pesar de vivir en una casa alquilada, no pierden las esperanzas de terminar la construcción de su casa para pronto mudarse. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, negocio que aprendió a realizar desde soltera gracias a amistades quienes la motivaron a ser parte de las consultoras de belleza, ya que las ganancias son muy buenas, y si se distribuyen adecuadamente los productos se pueden aprovechar las ofertas de compras para luego venderlas a precio normal. Trabajar y dedicarse a su hogar era una tarea, que en un inicio, no podía realizar, pero con el tiempo fue acostumbrándose a sus diversos roles y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, las obligaciones han disminuido, pues ambos se turnan en cumplir sus deberes en casa. Ahora ambos tienen pensado abrir un bazar en su vivienda con la finalidad de mejorar su estado económico y brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario para sus estudios superiores. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP para Mery, y junto a sus compañeras de grupo aprendió a  asumir muchos retos y responsabilidades, pues todas son muy cumplidas y ordenadas en sus  pagos a la institución. Con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará más productos de belleza al por mayor para luego venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Mery is the mother of two young ones who she aims to provide with the best living conditions. This has become easier alongside her husband, who has provided her with constant support since they were married. Despite living in a rented house, they have not given up their dream of finishing the construction of and moving into their own home. For 6 years Mery has sold cosmetics, a business that she learned in her single days thanks to friends who encouraged her to become a beauty consultant due to its good income. If they sold enough products properly they could take advantage of purchasing offers to later resell the goods at normal price. Working and homemaking at once was a task that Mery couldn't initially accomplish, but over time she became accustomed to her different roles. Thanks to her husband's support her obligations have lessened since they take turns in finishing household chores. Both are currently thinking of opening a bazaar in their home with the goal of improving their financial status and providing their children with the necessary money for their college studies. This is Mery's eighth loan with MFP; alongside her loan group colleagues she learned to assume many challenges and responsibilities and all of them are very timely and orderly with their loan payments. With this 2000-sole loan she will buy more wholesale beauty products to sell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise to increase sales

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una trabajadora madre de familia, el esfuerzo que realiza está basado en las ganas de progresar y educar a sus hijos, a quienes siempre  trata de cuidar y proteger. Hace 10 años que es comerciante, su principal actividad es la compra y venta de verduras en el mercado que está situado cerca de su casa, pero para conseguir sus productos tiene que salir de madrugada al mercado central de la ciudad donde los venden a costos más bajos y al por mayor. Nancy abre su puesto a partir de las 6 de la mañana hasta el medio día, horas de arduo trabajo, pues hay gran demanda y nota que le es necesario conseguir un ayudante para atender a sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y espera acoplarse rápidamente a su grupo, el cual viene trabajando hace más de 5 años en la institución. Los 1000 soles que solicita son para la compra de mercadería y la mejor ambientación de su puesto.
texts.en:
Nancy is a working mother; she works in order to progress personally and educate, care for and protect her children. Over 10 years as a businesswoman, her primary activity has been buying and selling vegetables in the market near her house. In order to buy her products she must leave the house at dawn for the city's central market, where they are sold wholesale and for the lowest prices. Nancy opens shop at 6:00 AM and works hard until noon. Due to high demand she has realized that it is necessary to hire a helper to attend to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to settle in quickly with her loan group, who have worked for 5 years with the institution. The 1000-sole loan will go toward purchasing merchandise and improving the setup of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to increase sales

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: El Señor Silverio Bermúdez tiene 55 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa es ama de casa y tiene 6 hijos ya todos independientes.  Don Silverio trabajador y responsable tiene su propio negocio de venta de granos y lácteos desde hace 17 años de experiencia en servicio al cliente. Trabajaba como agricultor lo cual le permitió adquirir conocimiento útil para la compra y venta de productos básicos. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra vender mayores cantidades de productos, la compra de granos básico como: frijoles, arroz, maíz y trigos. La realización de ventas a diferentes puntos del país ya que realiza viajes a la costa Atlántica.
texts.en:
Silverio B. is 55 years old, living in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He is married; his wife is a housewife and he has six children, all independent. Silverio is hardworking and responsible; he has had his own business selling grains and dairy products for 17 years, and he has experience in customer service. He used to work as a farmer, which gave him useful experience in buying and selling basic products. Thanks to the loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to sell larger quantities of products and purchase basic grains such as beans, rice, corn, and wheat. He will be able to make sales in different areas of the country and travel to the Atlantic coast.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene como meta cumplir los deseos de sus hijos, quienes se esfuerzan por ser profesionales, y junto a su esposo tratan de apoyarlos brindándoles una educación y una casa donde habitan con amor. Basada en sus deseos de superación y de apoyar a sus hijos Patricia trabaja arduamente en el mercado de su localidad, donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años, tiempo que aprendió a comprar adecuadamente sus productos, ya que antes, por su falta de experiencia tuvo grandes pérdidas, pero ahora es más hábil para las ventas y ha ido mejorando su negocio, el cual la lleva a proyectarse hacia un futuro con un puesto adicional para vender al por mayor. Patricia es una de las fundadoras de su grupo, pues es parte de MFP desde que la institución ingresó a su localidad, ella y sus compañeras tuvieron la oportunidad de agruparse y formar un grupo tan sólido y organizado que sobrevive 7 largos años, gracias a sus líderes que motivan y apoyan a todas las integrantes. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará la cantidad de sus productos y comprando a bajos precios, pero de buena calidad, para la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia's goal is to help her children realize their dreams; they are striving to be professionals, so along with her husband, Patricia is trying to support them by offering them an education and a home full of love. Because of her desire to grow (personally) as well as support her children, Patricia works very hard at her local market, where she sells vegetables, something she has been doing for eight years. During this time she learned the best way to purchase her supplies - before, for lack of experience, she had big losses, but now she's more skilled in sales and has been improving her business, which has propelled her into the future with a second location for selling her wares. Patricia is one of the founders of her (business) group, so she has been a member of Kiva partner MFP since the organization came to her area. She and her partners had the chance to come together and form a group that is so solid and well organized that it has survived seven long years, thanks to its leaders who motivate and support all the members. With this loan that she is asking for, Patricia will grow her inventory by purchasing items at low prices but good quality in order to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow her inventory

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: La Señora. Maria C. tiene 54 años de edad, habitante de barrio Walter Ferreti en la capital de Managua, su esposo se desempeña como supervisor de la Alcaldía, tiene tres hijos dos los tiene estudiando y la mayor es independiente. Como madre su objetivo es que sus hijos mejoren su nivel de vida y seguirle apoyándolos. Doña Maria C. tiene su propio negocio ella comercializa productos naturales y lotería ambulantemente  desde hace catorce años vende los trocito de lotería y 3 años vendiendo productos omnilife. Iniciándolo con fondos propios, siendo una mujer trabajadora  y capaz de cumplir sus metas y objetivos ha salido delante de toda dificultad que se le ha presentado. Gracias a los prestamos en Afodenic a logrado aumentar las cantidades de productos. Con este siguiente préstamo quiere seguir fomentando el desarrollo de su negocio con las comprar de: nutricionales de aloe, ego 10  y otros productos. Los cuales generan mayores utilidades y beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria C. is 54 years old and lives in the Walter Ferreti neighbourhood in Managua. Her husband works as a city supervisor. She has two children who attend school and one who is grown-up. As a mother, she strives to support her children and improve their quality of life.
Maria C. runs her own business selling natural products and lottery tickets as a street vendor. She has sold lottery tickets for 14 years and Omnilife products for 3. She set up the business with her own funds and has overcome all obstacles through hard work and her ability to accomplish her goals.
Thanks to the loans she received through Afodenic, she has increased her product quantities. She would like to continue to expand her business by purchasing aloe-based supplements, Ego 10 (an energy drink) and other products. These will generate better profits that will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
La familia esta compuesta por tres integrantes, Raúl, su concubina y su único hijo de seis años.
Raúl es empleado de una empresa de la localidad "MOLCRUZ" de donde recibe mensualmente un ingreso que le permite mantener a su familia, paralelamente cuenta con ingresos que le generan el alquiler de su motocicleta misma que funciona cmo mototaxi, por otra parte su esposa cuenta con una tienda de bariio donde ofrece todo tipo de abarrotes y que también cuenta con un punto de llamadas Viva. El nivel de la competencia es medio ya que existen otros negocios y con similares rubros. El crédito solicitado será destinado para capital de trabajo en su negocio de abarrotes. Esta es su cuarta operación con la institución y en todo el tiempo de trabajo con la misma demostró ser un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
This family is comprised of three members: Raul, his wife, and their only son, who is six years old. Raul works for a local business, Molcruz, where he is paid a monthly wage that allows him to support his family while also relying on income generated by renting out his own motorcycle, which functions as a "mototaxi." His wife also relies on (income from) a neighborhood market that sells all sorts of groceries as well as runs telephone booths. There is a little bit of competition because there are other businesses around that are similar. This requested loan will be used for operational expenses at the grocery store. This is the family's fourth loan through this Kiva partner, and in all their time working with the organization, the family have shown themselves to be excellent clients.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Dn. Genaro vive solo, su familia cuenta con dos hijos que son independientes, cada uno de ellos con actividad propia, uno de sus hijos vive cerca de su casa, los otros hijos viven en trinidad donde también colaboran al cliente cuando viajan llevando productos. Genaro se dedica a la venta de relojes, radios, dvd´s, y otros artículos electricos de precios económicos. Genaro cuenta con una competencia media ya que al ser ambulante busca diferentes mercados para sus productos. El destino del crédito solicitado fue para incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que estaba viajando a traer mercadería por mayor del interior. Genaro es cliente antiguo de la institución y siempre demostró ser responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Genaro lives alone. He has two adult children who live independently, each with their own work. One of his children lives close to him, while the others live in Trinidad, where they also help Genaro by bringing him merchandise when they travel. Genaro sells watches, radios, dvds and other inexpensive electric goods. He has some competition and as a mobile vendor seeks out different markets to sell his products. The loan he has requested is for the purpose of increasing his working capital, since he was traveling inland to bring back merchandise bought at wholesale. Genaro is a long-time client of the institution and has always shown himself to be responsible and punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 24 años, trabaja con la finalidad de ayudar a su madre con los gastos de su hogar y forjarse un futuro prometedor. Desde los 20 años se dedicó a estudiar todo lo concerniente a instalaciones eléctricas, ya que es uno de los oficios que desempeñan en su familia, y para ser parte de la empresa familiar se preparó y hace 3 años ha empezado a instalar alarmas, lo que le agrada realizar, pues no es muy complicado, y en la mayoría de negocios solicitan estas instalaciones para su seguridad, haciendo este negocio rentable. Pilar tiene el anhelo de tener una empresa propia para gozar de los beneficios de este oficio, bajo estas metas está tratando, poco a poco, de independizarse y realizar instalaciones de manera particular. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, el ingreso a su grupo fue muy acogedor, propiciando en ella una gran alegría y confianza de trabajar en equipo. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará materiales y herramientas adecuadas para desenvolverse en su oficio.
texts.en:
Pilar is 24 years old and works to help her mother with household expenses and to build her own future. Since she was 20 she has been studying all areas related to electrical installations, because she has family members who work in that area. To join the family business she learned how to install alarms, and started doing that work three years ago. She enjoys the work because it is not very complicated and most businesses want alarm installations for their protection, so it is a profitable business. Pilar would like to have her own business in this line of work, so she is working, little by little, to build up her independence and do installations on her own. This is her first loan with MFP. Her entry into the group was very pleasant, bringing her happiness and confidence to be working as a team. With the 1,000 PEN she is requesting she will buy materials and tools that she needs to do her work.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un joven de 18 años que trabaja para ayudar a su familia, pues los gastos dentro de su hogar son muy altos y tiene el deseo de apoyar mientras pueda. Tener un propio negocio fue una idea que su madre incentivo en él, pues lo apoyó con el capital necesario para abrir su locutorio (centro de llamadas telefónicas) hace un año inicio. Todo este tiempo ha logrado aprovechar sus ganancias para seguir comprando módulos, pues empezó  solo con uno, más ahora tiene instalado cinco módulos, tiene el deseo de seguir creciendo e instalar unas cabinas de Internet para complementar sus servicios y obtener mayores ganancias, pues quiere estudiar una carrera profesional. Pero para conseguir sus ansiados deseos tiene que esforzarse y levantarse temprano para atender su negocio, el cual abre a 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 10 de la noche, aprovechando de estudiar y leer mientras atiende su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ser nuevo en el grupo le está ayudando a ampliar sus relaciones con sociales y está seguro que también aprenderá nuevas cosas para administrar mejor su negocio y sus ahorros. Con los 1000 soles que solicita invertirá en la compra de aparatos telefónicos, así como para el mantenimiento de sus módulos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is an 18-year-old young man who works to help his family, because they have many expenses and he wants to help as much as he can. His mother encouraged him to have his own business and she supported him with the capital he needed to set up his own telephone call center a year ago. Since then he has been able to take advantage of his earnings, buying more modules for the phone center. He started with just one, and now has expanded to five modules. He wants to keep growing his business and to add some internet stations as a complement to the services he offers and to earn more, because he would like to be able to study for a professional career. To be able to reach his goals he needs to work hard and get up early to take care of his business, which he opens at 8 am and closes at 10 pm. He studies and reads at the same time that he takes care of the business. This is his first loan with MFP. As a new member of the group he is developing new relationships and he is sure that he will also learn new ideas about administering his business and his finances. With the 1,000 PEN that he is requesting he will invest in more telephone equipment and in maintenance for the equipment he already has.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of telephone equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es madre de dos pequeños niños, y junto con su pareja trata de brindarles lo necesario, quienes valoran el esfuerzo que su madre realiza, pues gracias a su trabajo y al de su pareja  terminaron de construir su casa. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de gas y tiene una socia en este negocio con quien comparte el trabajo y las ganancias. Pero ella es la responsable de administrar los ingresos y egresos del día, tratando en lo posible de generar ganancias que paguen los gastos operativos.  Este negocio es muy rentable debido a que las personas de su localidad no contaban con una distribuidora de este combustible, más ahora la tienda de Victoria les ofrece la mejor atención y entrega de sus pedidos a tiempo. Victoria le dedica 10 horas diarias a su negocio, pues desde las 7 de la mañana las puertas del local están abiertas para la atención al cliente, hasta las 8 de la noche. Con el tiempo, desea independizarse y tener un negocio propio. Viene trabajando con MFP hace  5 años, este es su octavo préstamo y se siente muy contenta por la forma de trabajo que realizan en su grupo, pues tratan de generar en todas las integrantes un espíritu emprendedor y comprometido con el banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de balones de gas y aprovechar algunas ofertas de las empresas que venden este combustible al por mayor.
texts.en:
Victoria is the mother of two small children, and together with her partner she tries to give them what they need. Her children appreciate the effort that she makes, since thanks to her work and that of her partner they finished building their house. For the last 6 years she has been selling gas and has a business partner with whom she shares the work and the profits. But she is the person responsible for managing the daily income and expenditures, trying as far as possible to generate profits that pay the operating expenses. This business is very profitable owing to the fact that the people in her town do not have a distributor of this fuel, but now Victoria's store offers them the best service and delivers their orders on time. Victoria dedicates 10 hours a day to her business, since the doors of her store are open from 7 in the morning to 8 in the evening to serve customers. With time, she wants to become independent and have her own business. She has been working with MFP for 5 years. This is her eighth loan ans she is very happy with the work that is carried out in her group, since they try to generate an enterprising spirit and commitment to the communal bank in every member. The 3000 soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a larger quantity of gas cylinders and to take advantage of some of the offers of the businesses who sell this fuel wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise increase

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 44 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 4 hijos, quienes la apoyan mucho. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en un espacio dentro de su vivienda. Ana se esfuerza mucho para dar una buena atención a sus clientes, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días de la semana que está abierta su tienda. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que hace muchas amistades, y sobre todo se gana la confianza de sus clientes, además, que poco a poco está creciendo gracias a las ganancias de sus productos. Para el futuro quisiera tener un minimarket. Con MFP ya tiene 6 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos son puntuales y dinámicos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes para implementar su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Ana is a 44-year-old single mother who lives with her 4 children, who give her a lot of support. Two years ago she started selling groceries and other basic goods from her home. Ana works hard to offer good service to her customers, keeping her store open from 6 am to 8 pm, 6 days a week. What she likes about her work is that she makes many friends, and most importantly earns the trust of her customers. Little by little her business is growing thanks to the earnings from sales of her products. In the future she would like to have a minimarket. She has already had 6 loans with MFP and she likes working with her group, because all of the members are punctual and dynamic. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more basic goods and groceries to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquisition of more merchandise

loans.name: Areli

texts.es: Arelí tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 2 añitos y su madre, en la casa de esta. Cuenta con una pequeña bodega en un espacio que le cedió su madre en su casa, donde vende abarrotes y otros artículos de primera necesidad. Con este negocio lleva un periodo de 8 años y atiende todos los días, de 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Lo que le gusta de su labor es que se siente útil y fuerte para sacar adelante a su hijo, sin la necesidad de una pareja irresponsable, nos menciona. Ella cree que su tienda es rentable porque cuenta con una clientela regular que consumen sus productos a diario. Para el futuro, Arelí quisiera tener un minimarket donde venda variedad de productos. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos son unidos, puntuales y responsables. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Arelí is 29 years old and a single mother. She lives with her 2-year-old son and her mother in her mother’s house. Arelí has a small grocery store that she operates in a room in her mother’s house, where she sells groceries and other essential items. She has had this business for 8 years now and works there every day from 7 in the morning until 9 in the evening. What she likes about her work is that it makes her feel useful and strong in raising her son, which she does without the need of an irresponsible partner, she tells us. Arelí believes her store is profitable because she has a regular clientele that consumes her products daily. In the future Arelí would like to have a mini-market where she can sell a variety of products. This is her 4th loan with Kiva partner MFP. She likes working with her communal bank because everyone is united, punctual, and responsible. Arelí will use the money to invest in the purchase of more products so she can re-supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer
