loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es: Bruno tiene 39 años, vive con su pareja con la que tiene una hija de 14 años. Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, a la fabricación de almidón, y además cuenta con una chacra donde siembra yuca. Estas actividades, las viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que lo mantiene ocupado, ya que es un hombre muy activo, y obtiene buenas ganancias porque sus productos (yucas) se venden muy rápido en el mercado, así como la madera. Para el futuro le gustaría ser exportador de almidón. Este es su 3er créditos con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque sus compañeros son coordinados y respetuosos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará madera aprovechando la época de verano en su región, que es la temporada donde tiene mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Bruno is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and 14-year-old daughter. He buys and sells lumber for a living. He also makes starch and has his own cassava farm. He has had these businesses for 4 years, and he has been prosperous. What he likes about his jobs is that they keep him busy—since he is a very active man—and that they generate good profits for him because his products (the cassava and the wood) sell quickly at the market. In the future, he would like to export starch. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He likes to work with his microfinance institute because his fellow members are respectful and work in harmony. With the loan that he is requesting, he will purchase wood, thus taking advantage of the summer season in his region, which is when lumber is in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 34 años, es padre de un hijo y vive junto a su pareja, quien está de acuerdo con sus propósitos y lo apoya al 100%. Desde hace 7 años atrás cuenta con una peluquería en un pequeño local alquilado, donde hace todo tipo de cortes de cabellos para caballeros y damas. Le gusta mucho esta labor porque conoce a muchas personas con quienes entabla buenas relaciones, además que le es rentable porque aparte de contar con su propio local, también brinda sus servicios a domicilio y cuenta con una fiel clientela. Para más adelante, Carlos quisiera tener un local propio y dejar de pagar alquiler. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque sus integrantes son muy responsables y comunicativos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará herramientas y productos para su peluquería, además la ambientará adecuadamente para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 34-year-old father who lives with his son and his wife, who agrees with all his goals and supports him 100%. He has owned a hair salon in a small, rented office space for 7 years, providing all sorts of haircuts for men and women. He really likes this field because he gets to meet a lot of people with whom he forms good relationships. Furthermore, this business is profitable because aside from having a business space, he also provides in-home haircut services, and he has loyal customers. In the future, Carlos would like to have his own business space so that he can stop paying rent. This is the first time that he requests a loan from MFP. He likes to work with his microfinance institute because its members are very responsible and communicative. With the money that he is requesting, he will purchase work tools and products for his hair salon. He will also give his salon some atmosphere in order to better welcome his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work tools and products for his hair salon

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 34 años de edad, vive solo con su pareja con la que también trabaja, y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo pudieron obtener su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la compra de madera para luego convertirla en carbón, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien elabora el carbón para que Delfina lo lleve a vender al mercado. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque aprende cada día más al respecto y conoce a más personas para ampliar su gama de clientes. La rentabilidad de su negocio es debido a que el carbón es un producto de gran demanda, en especial para las personas que no cuentan con cocinas a gas, quienes son sus principales clientes. Posteriormente, Delfina quiere poder vender sus productos a otros lugares fuera de su región. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que sus integrantes son personas responsables y tienen mucha comunicación para el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más madera para incrementar su producción de carbón.
texts.en:
Delfina is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her husband, with whom she also works. Because of their hard work, they have been able to obtain their own house. For 4 years, she has been purchasing wood to make it into charcoal. Delfina gets help from her husband, who makes the charcoal so that she can then sell it at the market. She really likes her job because she is learning about respect mre and more each day, and because she gets to know a lot of people, thus expanding her client-base. Her business is profitable due to the fact that charcoal is in high demand, especially for their main customers—people who do not have gas stoves. Delfina would like to later sell her products outside the region. This is her first loan with MFP. She likes to work with her microfinance institute because she has noticed that the other members are responsible people who communicate with each other and are team players. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more wood in order to increase charcoal production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es: Evaristo tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja, Miriam, quien se dedica a la venta de comida, y con sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de vacunos, y en algunos momentos libres trabaja como albañil en la construcción de viviendas, y otras veces en aserraderos. Con estas actividades obtiene las ganancias necesarias para sustentar los gastos de su hogar. Además le gusta mucho su trabajo porque lo mantienen ocupado. A Evaristo le gustaría construir un local para tener un restaurante propio y trabajar junto a su esposa en el negocio de la comida, que le parece mucho más rentable, ya que tiene la confianza que les irá muy bien, porque su conyugue tiene muy buena sazón. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos los integrantes son muy unidos y responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en el negocio de su esposa, quien requiere comprar bebidas, y la construcción de su kiosco.
texts.en:
Evaristo is a 38-year-old man who lives with his wife, Miriam, and their two children. His wife is in food sales, and he has been raising cattle for 4 years. In his spare time, he sometimes works building houses, while other times he works in the sawmills. With all these jobs, he earns the money needed to cover the household expenses. Furthermore, he likes his jobs because they keep him busy. Evaristo would like to build an office space so that he can establish his own restaurant and work alongside his wife in her food business, which he thinks is more profitable. He is certain that the business will be prosperous because his wife creates flavorful dishes. This is his 4th loan with MFP. He likes to work with his microfinance group because all of its members are united and responsible with their repayments. He will invest the money that he is requesting in his wife’s business because she needs to purchase drinks and build a kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk and purchase drinks

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 27 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y tienen dos hijos pequeños, la casa donde habitan es propia. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Gladis trabaja por horas, ya que sus hijos requieren de su presencia y cuidado, pero aun así, su negocio le da ganancias que ayudan a solventar las necesidades de su familia. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, en especial a niños, quienes se ganan su confianza y se vuelven sus fieles clientes. Gladis tiene el anhelo de tener local donde pueda establecer un disco bar. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos sus compañeros y compañeras son respetuosos y muy amigables. Con el dinero que solicita implementará su negocio con más bebidas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 27-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and two young children in a house that they own. She has been selling beverages and candy for 2 years in an area in her house that she set up specifically for this purpose. Gladis works intermittent hours because her children need her to look after them. Even so, her business generates profits that help her cover the family expenses. She really likes her job because she gets to know many people, especially children, whose trust she gains so that they can become her loyal customers. Gladis wishes to have her own business space in which she can set up a disco bar. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She likes to work with her microfinance group because all of her fellow group members are friendly and respectful. With the money that she is currently requesting, she will restock her business with more beverages and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Miliana

texts.es: Miliana tiene 28 años, vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como ganadero, y es madre de 2 hijos, un varón y una mujercita. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, tales como; leche, huevos, aceite, galletas, panes, entre otros. Acondicionó dentro de su casa una habitación adecuada para su negocio, donde atiende a sus clientes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Le gusta su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas y le es muy rentable porque obtiene ganancias regulares diariamente. Para más adelante, Miliana quisiera tener una tienda grande donde venda todo tipo de artículos. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus integrantes son puntuales y responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos para implementar su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Miliana is 28 years old, she lives together with her husband that raises cattle, and she is mother of 2 children, a boy and a little girl. Since a year ago she has been selling basic products, such as: milk, eggs, cooking oil, cookies, breads, among others. She remodelled a section of her home for her business where she tends to her clients from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. She loves to work because she knows so many people and it has been very profitable for her, earning her a regular income. In the future, Miliana would like to have a bigger store where she could sell all types of articles. This is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she enjoys working with a community bank because all of the members are timely and responsible with their payments. With the funds she is requestions she will purchase more products to stock up her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Bùi Thị

texts.en:
Quá Bùi Thị owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale.She is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quang Xuong. She is married and has two adult children. Quá has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Quá joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Quá has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Quá is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase new livestock to raise and sell. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. Quá plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. No. 1706060151.

loans.use: To purchase new livestock

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
N. Vũ Thị is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three school-aged children. N. earns a living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. N. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, N. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for the borrower's livestock.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.en:
K. Đỗ Thị, 57 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, K. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The primary source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. K. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, K. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

K. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Tuyết Nguyễn Thị, 50 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has six adult-aged children. Tuyết earns a living by owning and operating a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Tuyết has just started operating this business and earns approximately 700,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, Tuyết joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Tuyết has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Tuyết is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Tuyết plans to use the additional revenue she expects to be generated from the business to improve and expand her business ventures.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xuong. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, N. raises pigs for sale. N. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her situation and enable her to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. N. is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase new livestock to raise and sell. This will be her fourth loan from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. No. 1701060004.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Toàn Lê Thị (1702060029) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Toàn joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Toàn is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 4th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en:
Bùi Thị M. (1706060140), a 41-year-old married mother of two school-aged children living in the town of Quảng Xương, owns and operates a general store. Her main but not exclusive source of income from the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products to the local community. Mrs. M. just started operating this store and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from it.

In 2006, she joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund that was used to purchase breeding livestock. Mrs. M. is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 9000000 VND which will be used to invest in the store, and plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Toàn Trần Thị is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four school-aged children. Toàn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. She also sells both food and daily-use products in the local community. Toàn has been engaged in these activities for over two years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month this way.

In 2006, Toàn joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.

Toàn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for her livestock.

Toàn is now requesting a new loan of 8,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in her livestock and grocery store businesses. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Toàn plans to use the additional revenue this loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business ventures.

loans.use: To invest in her livestock and grocery store businesses

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Thành Lê Thị, 44 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Thành owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. Thành has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Thành joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so that she could help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Thành has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Thành is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Thành plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Bảo Nguyễn Thị, 47 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four school-aged children. Bảo owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Bảo has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 2008, Bảo joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she could help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Bảo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Bảo is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the second loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Bảo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her grocery store business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Luyện Lê Thị, 45 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult-aged children. Luyện owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising ducks for sale. Luyện is new to this business and earns approximately 700,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2006, Luyện joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Luyện has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Luyện is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the third loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Luyện plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Thực Lê Thị, 46 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult-aged children. Thực owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising ducks for sale. Thực has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Thực joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Thực has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Thực is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase ducklings to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the third loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Thực plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
G. Phạm Thị lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is 59 years old and married, and she has three adult-aged children. G. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. G. is new to this business and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2006, G. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. G. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

G. is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. G. plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru: Нематова Хурматой-женщина 37-ми лет,  замужем,  имеет  3-х  детей.  Занимается продажей электроприборов на центральном рынке Спитаменского рынка.  Хурматой имеет 5-ти летний стаж в сфере торговли.  Она начинала  продажу с  маленького стола,  потому  что  у  неё  не  было  финансов.  Постепенно,  расширив  свой  товарооборот  и  накопив  немного  денег.  она  арендовала  маленький  магазинчик.  В  настоящее  время  её  товары  среди  покупателей  пользуются  хорошим  спросом,  так  как  она  всегда  привозит  хороший  и  качественный  товар. Хурматой  нравится  с  нами  работать,  так  как  полученный  кредит  помог  ей  расширить  свой  ассортимент.
texts.en:
Hurmatoy N. is a 37-year-old woman, who is married and has three children. She sells electric appliances in the Spitamen central market. Hurmatoy has five years of experience in sales. She began selling from a small table because she had no financing. After gradually expanding her inventory and saving money, she rented a small shop. At the present time, her goods are in demand with customers because she always brings in good quality merchandise. Hurmatoy likes working with MicroInvest as the loan she received helped her to expand the variety of goods she carries.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory for a store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Hảo Nguyễn Thị resides in the town of Quảng Xương. She is 35 and is married with two school-aged children. Hảo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. Hảo is new to this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2006, Hảo joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Hảo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Hảo is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Hảo plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Баракаева  Мукаррам – женщина  53  лет,  замужем,  имеет  5-х  детей. Она  вместе  со  своим  мужем  Ортиковым  Абдугаффором  больше  двух  лет  занимается  продажей  сахара  и  макаронных  изделий  на  продовольственном  рынке  Спитаменского  района.  В  начале  своей  деятельности  она  брала  товар  под  реализацию  у  оптовиков.  Благодаря  нашему  кредиту  она  получила  возможность  ездить  в  город  Худжанд  и  покупать  товар  за  наличность  по  выгодным  ценам.  Два  её  старших  сына  помогают  ей  привозить  товар,  а  старшая  дочь  помогает  ей  по  хозяйству.  Мукаррам  очень  рада  сотрудничеству  с  нами  и  благодарна  нашим  кредиторам  за  помощь  в  осуществлении  её  планов.
texts.en:
Mukarram B. is a 53-year-old woman, who is married and has five children. For more than two years, Mukarram and her husband Abdugaffor Ortikov have sold sugar and pasta at the Spitamen regional food market. In the early days of her business, Mukarram purchased her products from the wholesalers. Thanks to a MicroInvest loan, she was able to travel to the town of Khujand, where she got a good price by paying cash for the products. Her two oldest sons assist her in keeping the shelves stocked, and her oldest daughter helps with the housework. Mukarram is pleased to collaborate with MicroInvest and grateful to the lenders for their assistance in bringing her plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.en:
Huế Lưu Thị (1430081634) is 24 years old and lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has a baby. Huế owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising cattle for sale. Huế has just started operating this business and earns approximately 20,00,000 VND a month from doing so.

In 2008, Huế joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Huế has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for her livestock.

Huế is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the second loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Huế plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Toàn Nguyễn Thị (1412030392) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a livestock business, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Toàn joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

Toàn is now requesting a new loan of 8,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 7th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

texts.en:

Huê is now requesting a new loan of 90,00,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Huê plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. H. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. H. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month from doing so.

In 2005, H. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to build shelter for her livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.en:
D. Viên Thị is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has a school-aged child. D. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. D. has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, D. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.

D. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000.000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. D. plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.ru: Сангинова  Угулжон - женщина 54-ми лет,  замужем,  имеет  4-х  детей.  Занимается продажей лекарственных  препаратов  и  медикаментов  на центральном рынке Спитаменского рынка.  Она имеет большой  опыт  в  этой  сфере.  Она  привозит  товар  из  города  Истаравшана,  где  расположен  оптовый  рынок.  Её  старший  сын  помогает  ей  привозить  и  продавать  товар. Угулжон  очень  любит  свою  работу.  Она  мечтает  о  том,  что  её  сын  Дильшод  выучившись  на  фармацевта  откроет  свою аптеку.  В  настоящее  время  она  копит  деньги  для  его  обучения.
texts.en:
Uguljon S. is a 54-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She sells medicine and medical supplies at the Spitamen regional central market, and has a great deal of experience in this line of work. Uguljon brings her goods in from the town of Istaravshan, where there is a wholesale market. Her oldest son helps out on the buying trips and selling the merchandise. Uguljon really loves her work. Her dream is that her son Dilshod would study to become a pharmacist and open his own pharmacy. At the present time, Uguljon is saving money for his education.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Thân Nguyễn Thị (1406030256) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily rice, for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

Thân is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be her 7th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

texts.en:

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.ru: Номуродова  Гулсанам – женщина  32  лет,  замужем,  имеет  одного  ребёнка. Вместе  со своим  мужем  Кобиловым  Хайдархуджа  она занимается  куплей  и  продажей  крупного  и  мелкорогатого  скота. Наряду  с  этим  она  занимается  переработкой  и  продажей  молока. Гулсанам  и  её  муж  имеют  достаточный  опыт в сфере животноводства и таким образом ведут своё хозяйство.  Недавно  от  своих  коллег  по  бизнесу  она  узнала  о  возможности  получения  кредита  в  нашей  организации.  Когда  она  пришла  получать  кредит  у  неё  было  малое  количество  скота.  Благодаря  нашим  кредиторам  она  увеличила  своё  стадо  и  очень  довольна  этим.
texts.en:
Gulsanam N. is a 32-year-old woman, who is married and has one child. She and her husband Haydarhuj Kobilov buy and sell large- and small-horned cattle. In addition, she processes and sells the milk. Gulsanam and her husband have enough experience raising cattle to keep the farm going. From others in the business, she recently learned about the possibility of taking out a loan with MicroInvest. When she first came to apply for a loan, Gulsanam had only a few head of cattle. Thanks to the lenders, she has increased the size of her herd, and is quite pleased with that fact.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru: Гадоева  Майрам – женщина  48  лет,  замужем,  имеет  3-х  детей. Она  больше двух лет занимается  продажей  хозяйственных  товаров  и  посуды  на  продовольственном  рынке  Спитаменского  района.  Когда  она  начинала  у  неё  было  маленькое  количество  товара.  Но  недавно  от  своих  соседей  по  бизнесу  она  узнала  о  кредитовании  в  нашей  организации.  Сейчас  Майрам  расширила  свой  ассортимент.  Её  муж  Абдулло  работает  таксистом  и  два  раза  в  неделю  помогает  Майрам  ездить  за  товаром  в  г. Истаравшан.  В другие  дни  он  подрабатывает перевозкой пассажиров  и  тем  самым  пополняет  семейный  бюджет.
texts.en:
Mayram G. is a 48-year-old woman, who is married and has three children. For more than two years, she has sold household products and dishes at the Spitamen regional food market. When she began, Mayram had only a small inventory of goods, but recently she learned about the MicroInvest loan program from her business colleagues. Now, Mayram has expanded the assortment of goods she carries. Her husband Abdullo works as a taxi driver and twice a month helps Mayram to transport merchandise from the town of Istaravshan. On other days, he takes fares to supplement the family income.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.ru: Шарипов Акбарали живет в районе Хуросон. Женат имеет шестерых детей. Возраст 40 лет. Акбарали занимается земледелием, выращивает пшеницу. Помимо этого он работает шофером.Сын клиента работает в России, он также помогает родителям. Акбарали хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы купить удобрение, т.е. собрать хороший посев пщеницы, а на полученные деньги от продажи хочет купить себе собственный трактор.
texts.en:
Akbarali S. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 40 years old, married and has six children. Akbarali is involved in agriculture and grows wheat. Besides this business, he also works as a driver. His son is a migrant worker in Russia and also helps his parents. Akbarali wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase fertilizer and to have a good wheat crop. He wants to then buy his own tractor with the profits from the crop sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Avliekul

texts.ru: Авлиекул Рахмонкулов в возрасте 39 лет, живет в районе Хурусон. Женат, имеет четверых детей. Авлиекул работал учителем 6 лет, т.к. заработная плата не хватало на содержании семьи, клиент решил заняться земледелием. этим видом деятельности он занимается более 8 лет. Клиент обратился к нам за кредитом, чтобы купить удобрение и собрать благоприятный посев пшеницы.
texts.en:
Avliekul R. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 39 years old, married and has four children. Avliekul worked as a teacher for 6 years, but, because his salary could not support his family, he decided to become involved in agriculture. He has been in this business over 8 years. Avliekul requested this loan in order to buy fertilizer and to harvest a good wheat crop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, she owns and operates a furniture-making business. Most of her income comes from making and selling general household furniture to community members. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over two years.

Marilou joined ASKI (one of Kiva's field partners) to gain access to financial services that would give her the ability to engage in business activities and thereby improve her living situation.  Marilou is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase materials needed for making additional furniture. She plans to use the revenue generated from this loan to further develop her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer micro-finance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 29 years old Mary W. from Tukuyu. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 2 and 8. Mary has been running a charcoal business since 2006.

Mkaa (Charcoal), is small, black pieces of dry earth that is used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots, in which they arrange the charcoal, and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them.

Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative. Mary works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She currently earns about US $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk for resale

texts.en:

The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. loans.name: Nathaniel Roy

texts.en:
Nathaniel Roy S. is from the city of Santiago. He is 43 years old. Nathaniel Roy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nathaniel Roy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Kurbonmahmad

texts.ru: Хазраткулов Курбонмахмад живет в районе Хуросон. Возраст 53 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Один сын работает в России и присылает оттуда деньги. Курбонмахмад 27 лет работал шофером. В данный момент у него имеется собственный, продуктовый магазин.Этим видом бизнеса клиент занимается более 5 лет. Курбонмахмад хочет получить от нас кредит, чтобы купить товары с города Душанбе и перепродать их в Хуросоне. На полученный доход он еще хочет увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:

Kurbonmahmad worked as a driver for 27 years and now owns a food market. He has been in this business over 5 years. Kurbonmahmad wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase products from Dushanbe and resell them in Khuroson. He wants to use the resulting profit to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Холниезов Бозоргул Живет в районе Хуросон. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Бозоргул занимается купля, продажей крупно рогатого скота. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода, для содержания семьи. Поэтому клиент хочет взять у нас кредит и купить несколько бычков.
texts.en:
H. Bozorgul lives in the Khuroson region. He is 35 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Bozorgul buys and sells livestock. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. This business is the main source of income for supporting his family. This is why the client would like to get credit from us and to purchase several bulls.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita V. is from the village of Salvador. She is 39 years old and married. She owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 11 years.

Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To purchase additional seed, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Roda C. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 16. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two orphans. Roda runs a kiosk (grocery) where you can buy the ingredients to make your daily meals and charcoal, a type of fuel that is very commonly used in Tanzania She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Roda currently earns about $130 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Roda thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Tumaini M. from Tukuyu. Tumaini runs a genge business. A genge (convenience store) is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, where items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish are sold. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. She works for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Tumaini currently earns about $90 US a month. She is married with two children: ages 2 and 5. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Tumaini thanks you for your support!

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is twenty-four-year-old Tusajigwe M. from Tukuyu. She is married  and has a two-year-old child. Tusajigwe has been running a used clothing business since 2006. She works at her business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, and currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Tusajigwe thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. currently sells plates and cups in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. She is a forty-two year old woman whose husband works with OXFAM in Southern Sudan as an assistant administrator.  They have four children, three girls and one boy, all of whom attend the primary level school. With the extra profits from her loan, Alice hopes to be able to build a bar for selling beer and other drinks.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more goods in her shop.

loans.name: Bendita Machaieie Pedro

texts.pt:
Bendita Machaieie Pedro M. é natural de Gaza uma das províncias do sul de Moçambique, tem 53 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idade o primeiro com 33 anos de idade e o ultimo com 18 anos respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustenta uma neta que mora com ela.

Bendita estudou até o segundo ciclo de liceu na época colonial e parou por falta de condições dado que ficou orfao dos pais aos nove anos de idade, aos 4 anos saiu da província de Gaza na companhia dos pais quando o pai conseguiu emprego na cidade de Lourenço marques (actualmente Maputo). 

Bendita solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela primeira vez no valor de 12000,00mt com qual pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio adquirindo mais produtos. Actividade que a desenvolve desde 1996, deste negocio tem rendimento mensal de 36000,00mt. Futuramente pretende introduzir outro tipo de negocio que consistira na prestação de serviços de aluguer de quartos e recorrera ao credito.
texts.en:
Bendita Machaieie Pedro M. is a native of Gaza Province in the south of Mozambique. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 6 grown children. The first is 33 years old, and the youngest is 18 years old. In addition to her children, she supporta a granddaughter who lives with her. Bendita studied through the second year of high school in the colonial era and stopped due to circumstances. She was orphaned at age nine, and at 4 had left the province of Gaza with her parents when her father got work in the city of Lourenço Marques (currently Maputo). Bendita is requesting a loan through Hluvuku for the first time in the amount of 20,000 meticais, with which she plans to increase the volume of her business by acquiring more products. She has been developing the business since 1996 and has a monthly revenue of 36,0000 meticais. In the future, she plans to introduce another type of business which will consist of providing room rental services, and she will use credit.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en:
Greetings from Tanzania! This is Tusajigwe S. from Tukuyu. She is twenty-five years old and married with a three-year-old child. She is also supporting two children who were orphaned. Tusajigwe has been running a business selling used clothing since 1998. She works at her business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, assisted by two employees. She currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. Tusajigwe thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Berta Maria

texts.pt:
Berta Maria D. é natural de Maputo, tem 53 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos onde o mais velho tem 35 anos e o mais novo 24 anos de idade respectivamente, todos já não estudam e os três primeiros estão a viver nas suas casas.

Berta estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras na família, a 5 anos que o marido foi na terra do rand e nunca voltou, a três anos decide iniciar negocio que consiste na compra e venda de capulanas, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 12000,00mt.

Berta solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez, com qual pretende aumentar o seu volumen de negocio, futuramente Berta pretende comprar outro talhão afim de construir casas para aluguer de quartos e conta com ajuda do credito.
texts.en:
Berta Maria D. is a native of Maptuo. She is 53 years old, divorced and the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 35 years old and the youngest is 24. All are past school and the first three are living in their own homes.

Berta studied through 6th grade and stopped due to her family's financial circumstances. Five years ago her husband went to the Rand region and never returned. Three years ago she decided to start a business which consisted of buying and selling capulanas [Note: fabric used as a sarong]. She has a monthly revenue of 12,000 meticais in this business.

Berta is requesting a loan from Hluvuku and Kiva for the first time, with which she plans to increase her business volume. In the future, Berta plans to purchase another piece of land in order to build houses to rent out rooms with the help of a loan.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell capulanas

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana K. sells groundnut paste and is asking for a loan to stock more groundnuts for making paste. She is twenty years old and married to a driver. Diana has no children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a rental house.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts for making paste.

Myuni has been running a soap production business since 2006. She both manufactures and sells her soaps. She works at her business for five to eight hours a day, six days a week, and is assisted by two employees. Myuni currently earns about $110 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to increase production. In the future, she plans to further develop her business. Myuni thanks you for your support!

loans.name: M/wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
Khadija has been been a juice and food spices (mango picle) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $200. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

Khadija is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes, mangoes and sugar for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, get more food for family and pay school fees for her children.

Khadija is 38 years old, married, and has eight children: ages 22, 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, 10 and 8.

Khadija will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zawadi, Fatma, Zakia and Mwaka. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, sugar and mangoes for her business

Irene has been running a grocery business since 2008. A grocery store is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to, to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Irene works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and currently earns about $120 a month. Irene is requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Irene thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk for her business

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
For five years, Matrida has owned a small shop in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. Every day she works at her business for 13 hours. She belongs to the Ngeleli group loan.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Matrida is 30 years old and she has a five-month-old baby and a seven-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more saleable items to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Sandina

texts.en:
Sandina has been a hairdresser, snack vendor, and pig keeper in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for many years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. She works daily at her business. She belongs to the Msikitini East group loan.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her hairdressing business. She hopes to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Sandina is 42 years old and married. She has six children, ages three, seven, 11, 16, 18, and 22. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Mpoki

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Mpoki N. from Mbeya. She is married and has a one-year-old child. Mpoki has been running an agricultural business since 1999. Specifically, her business is the purchasing and selling of crops.

She works at the business for nine to 12 hours per day, six days per week, and she is assisted by one family member. Mpoki currently earns about $90 a month from her business. She is requesting her loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business.

Mpoki thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets: thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for sale

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is 26 years old, single, and has two children, ages 7 and 3. For the past 6 years, she has been running a small shop in the Ruaha  neighborhood of Iringa. Happy belongs to the Ngeleli loan group (Group code 2015), and currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. She works for about 12 hours every day.

Happy is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to be able to increase her current stock of goods and thereby improve her business. She hopes that, through this loan, her profit will increase, and she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of items for sale at a store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M., 40, lives in Mbeya. She is married and has 3 children, all between the ages of 11 and 16. Mary has been running a crops sales business since 1999, working 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Mary currently earns about US$ 90 a month and is now requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for re-sale. In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening a new sales location. Mary thanks you for your support!

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of crops in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Ndekeleni

texts.en:
Ndekeleni is married and has two children, ages 6 and 2. She owns a small charcoal store and sells fish in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Hatuyumbi loan group (Group code 201979) and currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $330. Each day, she works at her business for 12 hours.  

Ndekeleni is now requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, so that she is able to buy more charcoal and fish for re-sale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase, and she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and fish for re-sale

loans.name: Alamoka

texts.en:
Alamoka S. from Mbeya is 50 years old. She is married and has 5 children, all between the ages of 13 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one other dependent, because the child is an orphan. 
Alamoka has been running her own shop since 2006, purchasing and re-selling a variety of commodities. She works 9-12 hours per day, and can earn about US$ 90 a month from her business. She is now requesting a loan in order to purchase commodities in bulk for re-sale. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Alamoka thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. loans.use: Purchase of commodities in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en: Allahverdi Q. is 46 years old, married, and has 2 sons. He earns income selling different kinds of food products, including candy, butter, and beverages. He has more than 15 years of experience in this business, and is currently the only bread winner in his family with his store as the only source of income. Allahverdi has applied for a loan of US$ 1,500 to purchase more food products for re-sale to be able to increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase of food products for re-sale

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda  owns a small beauty salon in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Kari group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Daily she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more salon items to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business .

Zubeda is married, and has given birth into five children, now aged 20, 18, 11, 3 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more salon items, to expand her business

loans.name: Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
Kulthum has been a juice and bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to Tushirikiane group loan (Group code 2087). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $70. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

Kulthum is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more juice, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Kulthum is 28 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hawa, Khadija, Fatma and Zaina, each woman also having her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more juice, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Lường Thị

texts.en:
H. Lường Thị makes a living primarily from raising cattle for sale. She is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xuong. She is married and has two school-aged children. H. just started this business and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2005, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. H. is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase new livestock to raise and sell. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

No. 1440051223.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha has been a soup, bites and clothes seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $25. She works at her business for 12 hours every day. Aisha is 32 years old, married, and has given birth to three children: ages 12, 9 and 2.

Aisha is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more meat and khangas (African garments) for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business. She belongs to Mkorofi si mwenzetu group loan (Group code 2032).

loans.use: To buy more meat and khangas

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
H. Lê Thị makes a living primarily from raising cattle for sale. She is a 21-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xuong. She is married and has one school-aged child. H. has just started this business and earns approximately 600,000 VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her situation and enable her to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. H. is now requesting a loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her third loan from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

No. 1433071555.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Olesta

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Olesta T. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 16. Olesta has been running a shop since 1994 selling common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and currently earns about $150 a month. Olesta is requesting a loan in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support! loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
H. Phạm Thị (1433040719) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is widowed and has two school-aged children.

H. raises cattle for sale and has just started operating this business, earning approximately 200,000 VND a month.

In 2004, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 3rd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
Thuỷ Hoàng Thị makes a living primarily from raising cattle for sale. She is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xuong. She is married and has three adult children. Thuỷ has just started this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, Thuỷ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her situation and enable her to engage in business activities. Thuỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Thuỷ is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. Thuỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

No. 1434050976.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Quế Hoàng THị (1432040715) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has five infant children.

TQuế owns and operates a business raising ducks for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Quế joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

Quế is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
T. Hoàng Thị (1422040494) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. T. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month.

In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (1435050996) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four adult children. N. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build a shelter for her livestock.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Le Thị

texts.en:
L. Lê Thị (1412030325) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult children. L. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en:
H. Bùi Thị (1210020219) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has two school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a grocery store. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month.

In 2002, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to improve her business. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her grocery store

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman A. is a 35-year-old trader who sells food products such as butter, beverages, candies, sugar and salt. He started his business five years ago when his profession as a schoolmaster did not bring him enough income to keep the family which consists of a wife and two children.

Telman would like to expand his business and purchase more items to sell. For this purpose he has applied for a $1200 loan.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir N. is 48-year-old farmer who has been breeding calves in the small village of Agsu for the last 20 years. He purchases calves, breeds them, fattens them and then sells them to the local meat traders. Nadir also works as a chief of the local post office but his salary is too small to cover the needs of his five children. Nadir's main income comes from cattle breeding and he is doing his best to expand his business and increase his income. For this purpose, he has applied for a $1500 US loan to purchase three calves.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
Zaman Q. is a 38-year-old farmer who sells milk and milk products as well as breeding calves for meat production. He has been engaged in this business since 1995. He is married and lives in a house with his parents. He is the only breadwinner in his family.

Zaman would like to expand his business and purchase two more calves in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase two more calves

loans.name: Meletia

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 55-year-old Meletia K. from Mbeya. She is married with eight children between the ages of 20 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Meletia has been running a fish business purchasing and selling fish since 1999. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week, currently earning about $120 a month. Meletia is requesting a loan in order to purchase fish in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for her business

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 47-year-old Emmy F. from Mbeya. Emmy has been running a general store, purchasing and selling different commodities, since 2006. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two family members. Emmy currently earns about $130 US a month. She is divorced with three children between the ages of 21 and 29.

Emmy is requesting a loan in order to purchase items in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to reopen the business in a new location. Emmy thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing.
