loans.use: To purchase items in bulk

loans.name: Ruqaiya M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is the wife of M. R. who lives in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan is famous for its shrines and for its sweetmeat. People come from different cities to Multan with a belief that their wishes will come true if they visit the shrines.

Ruqaiya baji operates an embroidery business. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband 

Her husband is a mechanic by profession. He learnt this skill by working in a workshop. He has been in this profession since he was 15 years old because his father was a poor man and couldn’t afford the rest of the family’s expenses. Ruqaiya baji feels proud to have a hardworking husband. She always stands by him in every circumstance.

Ruqaiya baji is applying for a loan to buy mechanical tools for her hsuband because he wants to start his own workshop. 

Ruqaiya baji is leading another lady in her group and her name is Bilquis. She is applying for a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy mechanical tools for her husband's motor workshop

loans.name: Naseem Raheem Baksh Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a citizen of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband's name is R. B.. He runs a boutique in the clothing market. Naseem baji helps him by preparing embroidered dresses that he can display in the boutique. Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy materials like cloth, colored thread and designs. Multan is famous for its shrines and for its sweetmeat. People come from different cities to Multan with the belief that their wishes will come true if they visit the shrines.

Naseem baji is the leader of a group with four other women from her locality. Sajida baji and Jamila baji both want a loan to buy similar embroidery materials for their boutique. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. Pathani baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Gulnaz Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz baji is a very hardworking and a very devoted lady. She has lived in a city named Multan in Pakistan for the past 10 years. She prepares embroidered dresses for her husband’s boutique so he is able to display them and earn income. Her husband is very happy with her support. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (colored thread, sketches and cloth) to increase the profit of her husband’s boutique.

She is the group leader of two other women from her area. Najma baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy materials (colored thread, sketches and cloth) to make embroidered dresses for her boutique.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Queen M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 20. Queen has been running a business purchasing and selling crops since 2001. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $120 a month. Queen is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Queen thanks you for your support! The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Nagina M.ashiq Group

texts.en:
Nagina baji is the wife of M. and has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is the mother of three chiildren: two daughters and one son. All of her chiildren are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

Her husband is a mechanic and wants to start a motor workshop. Nagina baji is applying for a loan to buy mechanical tools so that her husband is able to start his own workshop and earn a good income. 

Nagina baji is the group leader of five other women from her locality:

Shabana baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Kiran baji wants a loan to buy sanitation supplies (taps [faucets], pipes) to resell.

Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy mechanical tools for her motor workshop.

Munawar sultana baji and Tasneem baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy mechanical tools for her husband's motor workshop

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny Y. is forty-five years old. He is married and has two children, a son and a daughter, both of whom are currently in junior high school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Johny’s wife works to support him financially. She is a teacher by profession.

Johnny is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as wardrobes, beds, chairs, etc. for sale. He wants a loan to procure working materials such as plywood, foam, nails, etc. Johnny has been in business for ten years. He has a workshop in his community. Johnny is hoping to expand his business and give his children the best possible education.

loans.use: Materials for furniture production

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has three children, a son and two daughters. She says all are currently in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband works at the local hospital.

Joyce is a food vendor. She prepares and sells ‘gari’. Gari is a carbohydrate supplement, from cassava dough. The squeezed dough is fried in a hot metal pan over a strong fire. Gari is eaten with cooked beans. It is also eaten raw with roasted groundnut and sugar. She supplies to retailers and food vendors. Joyce has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure cassava in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To buy cassava in bulk

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi P. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: a son and three daughters. She says all are currently in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase which is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Naomi runs a grocery store in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in her community. Naomi says her shop is on one of the principal streets. Naomi has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure groceries in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure groceries in bulk for her grocery store

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: four sons and two daughters. She says all are currently in the junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase which is a farming/trading community near Dorma, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a maize farmer.

Akosua is a food vendor. She prepares and sells banku, a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells the food on the street in the mornings. Akosua procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns.

Akosua has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize to make banku

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna A. is a trader in all kinds of ladies' footwear (slippers, etc.) She hawks her wares in her community and also treks to other towns to sell. She is 27 years old, married and has three children--all daughters. She says all are currently in primary school. Her husband trades in maize. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase. It is a farming and trading community near Dorma, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Anna has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure a variety of footwear in bulk. Anna is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Qurbanali

texts.en: Qurbanali I. is a 58-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small village of Agsu City. He is married and has five children. Qurbanali is a veterinarian and knows how to properly keep animals. He is not alone in his business as his two sons help him in looking after the sheep. His dream is to provide all his children with a quality higher education and for this purpose he would like to expand his business. Qurbanali applied for a $2,000 loan to purchase 20 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: Purchase 20 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one son and two daughters. She says all are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a tailor by profession.

Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in all kinds of pomades for both the hair and the body. She hawks to sell in her community. Elizabeth also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for more than 15 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy pomade

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.en:
Lại Trịnh THị is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lại owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Lại has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5600000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Lại joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lại has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Lại is now requesting a new loan of 17000000 VND which will be used to expand the shelter for her livestock. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by L. from TYM Fund. Lại plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand shelter for the livestock

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia A. is 36 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says all are currently in the senior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a maize farmer. Patricia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells ‘banku’. Banku is a local dish from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells the food on the street in the mornings. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns. Patricia also trades in palm oil. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Tuyết Nguyễn Thị (1219030722) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Tuyết owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Tuyết has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from this activity.


In 2004, Tuyết joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuyết has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business.  Tuyết is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Tuyết plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says three are currently in the primary school. The last is yet to start. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband works at the local government’s hospital.

Afia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She cooks the food in the house and sells on the street in the mornings. She procures bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby towns. Afia has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (1205050388) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Mỵ owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising poultry.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  Mỵ has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2003, Mỵ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mỵ has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby chickens to raise & sell in the future.  Mỵ is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND, which will be used to build a shelter for her chickens.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Mỵ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her chickens

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (1215030634) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is widowed and has three adult children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale.  N. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from this activity.


In 2004, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional animals.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Huyền Nguyễn Thị (1221040703) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Huyền owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members.  Huyền has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Huyền joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huyền has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand her business.  Huyền is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Huyền plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir K. is a 52-year old farmer who sells milk and milk products such as cheese, yogurt and butter. Shakir looks after his cows and pastures them and his wife makes all the milk products. Shakir has five children. They are all adults and Shakir works to cover his and his wife's needs. His pension is too small to cover their basic needs. Now Shakir is applying for a 1500 USD loan to purchase three calves and raise three more cows in future.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
Bích Vũ Thị (1219060743) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two  school-aged children.  To make a living, Bích owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  Bích has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 4500000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Bích joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Bích has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand her business.  Bích is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Bích plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.en:
Thuận Phùng Thị (1219030729) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Thuận owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock and making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs and making tofu for sale.  Thuận has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Thuận joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thuận has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Thuận is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies and invest in her business.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Thuận plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.en:
N. Trịnh Thị (1211081276) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has an infant child. She owns and operates a business raising livestock and selling fish. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2008, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand her business.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to improve her business . The loan will be her 2nd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (1203020308) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has two infant children.

M. works in a family member's business primarily selling poultry products in the local community. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand her business.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alishah

texts.en: Alishah S. is a 50-year-old trader on a pension who has his own food store. He has 12 years of experience in this field. He is married and has two children. He would like to purchase more food products to increase his income. For this purpose, he applied for a 1500 USD loan.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
N. Vũ Thị (1219030732) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. N. has just started operating this business and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from this activity.


In 2003, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand her business.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 8000000 VND which will be used to raise additional  ducks.  The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To raise ducks

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman A. is a 45-year-old farmer who breeds calves for meat production. He started his business in 2001. He is a repair master but orders for repair are very random in his village. Calf breeding is the only source of income in Salman`s family. He is married and has two children. He would like to expand his business and purchase two more calves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both sons. According to her, one is in the senior high school while the other is in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Veronica is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital and sells in the local market on a tabletop. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Qaranfil

texts.en:
Qaranfil Q. is a 30-year-old woman who keeps cows for milk and calves for meat production. She has six years of experience in this field. She is a school teacher in the local school and is married with two children.

Qaranfil started her business when her and her husband’s salary wasn’t enough to cover their children’s basic needs. Now she would like to expand her business and for this purpose she applied for a $1,500 loan to purchase three more calves for breeding. As summer is a high season for wedding parties she counts on selling fattened calves for higher prices. Qaranfil and her family are  counting on you for help.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 53 years old and married with two children. His children are currently working.

To support his household, Emmanuel has been selling soft drinks in the neighborhood to his loyal customers on a retail and wholesale basis. He says selling soft drinks is very lucrative and therefore he wants to expand his inventory to enable him to make a good income for his family’s needs.

Emmanuel is a member of the group called “Blessing”. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 42 years old and a mother of two children. The children are currently in school. She lives with her family in the Central Region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who sells used clothes. Selling of used clothing, bed sheets, towels, and curtains have a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes, bed sheets, etc are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling used clothing has created business for many women like Stella. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing, bed sheets, towels, and curtains to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children future and to rent a store to trade. She is a member of the group called Blessing. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 25 years old. She is not married. She lives with her younger sister at Kasoa in Ghana. She has owned and operated a dressmaking shop for the past two years. She is a specialist in female clothing with various kinds of styles that suit the taste of her customers, like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She is a member of the community group called “Nyame be kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena is 44 years old. He is married with four kids. Kwabena has been a taxi driver for the past 12 years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He drives passengers from the local lorry station to the nearby towns at a transport fare of 55 pesewas per head. However, his car has been giving him some problems and he needs money to maintain it. He therefore requests a loan to enable him to maintain his taxi to earn an income to support his family and get his kids back to school. He belongs to the community group called “Nyame be kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To undertake maintenance on his car

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia B. is a 35-year-old mother of three children who are currently in school. She trades in sewing accessories and has been doing this for the past seven years. She sells items like lining materials, sewing thread and school uniforms.

She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her profit. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children in school.

She is a member of the community group called “Nyame be kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing accessories

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is twenty-six years old and married with one daughter who is currently in school. She has owned and operated a dressmaking shop for the past seven years. She sews all forms of women’s wear with various styles that suit the taste of her customers, like kaba and slit (a traditional women’s wear), funeral clothes, etc.

Linda wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Sewing is her major source of income and she hopes to raise good income to provide her daughter with a quality education.

Linda is a member of the community group called “Nyame Be kyere Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access their loans and to repay them.

loans.use: To purchase sewing accessories.

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara S. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and the mother of four children who are currently in school.

She is a retailer of charcoal in her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Ajara obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retails it to her customers.

She wants to use the loan to buy more supply of charcoal to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called “Nyame be Kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and supply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Martínez de 59 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Batahola Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposa trabaja de enfermera, la cual aporta a los gastos del hogar, sus hijos son independientes, el se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos y puros, desde hace cuatro años, que inicio con ahorros propios, con la elaboración y comercialización de puro pudo sacar buenos ahorros para invertir en repuestos de vehiculo. Con este crédito va a comprar repuestos de vehículos para ofertar a sus clientes y poder cumplir con la demanda. Sus planes es poder heredar un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel M. is 59 years old, is married, and lives in the neighbourhood of Batahola South in the capital city of Managua. His wife works as a nurse and she helps out with the household expenses. Their children are independent. He repairs vehicles and sells cigars, and since he started out four years ago with his own savings from the making and sales of his cigars, he managed to save enough to start investing in a mechanic shop. With this loan he will purchase spare parts for cars to supply his clients and to fill the demand. His dream is to be able to leave a good inheritance to his children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 35 and has been operating a grocery shop for the past six years. She is married with five children who are currently in school.

Millicent’s experience in trading has made her one of the most successful traders. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc.

She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Millicent belongs to the community group called “Blessing Trust Group”. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and supply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel Y. is 48 years old. He is married with four children. He is an auto electrician who services all kinds cars and vehicles with electrical and battery problems. At the moment, he trains two young men to impart his knowledge and skills to them to give them a future job opportunity. Samuel wants the loan to buy more tools and raw material like scrap batteries, wires and car parts to provide his clients with better services, to increase his income and to expand his workshop for his family.

He belongs to the community group called Nyame bekyere Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure tools and work materials

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty three years old. He is married with two children. He is an auto electrician and a taxi driver. John services all types of cars and vehicles that have electrical and battery faults. At the moment, he is training five young men, using his knowledge and skills to give them future job opportunities.

John wants the loan to buy more tools and work materia such as, scrap batteries, wires and car parts to provide his clients with better service and to increase his income. He wants to expand his workshop and provide for his family. The loan would also be used to maintain his taxi. He belongs to the community group called Prosper Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure tools and work materials.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 43-year-old trader. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She lives with her family at Kasoa in Ghana.

Cecilia has sold used clothes in the Dansoman market of Ghana for the past nine years. With this business, she has been able to support one of her children to complete senior high school.

With low capital, she is not able to buy larger-bale quantities of used clothes to sell. She would like to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes with variety to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children education.

She is a member of the group called ‘Prosper Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and provide support assistance in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bales

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Efia is 42 years old. She is widow and mother of one child who has just completed senior high school. She sells and supplies cooking utensils, cookers, microwaves and blenders to the staff of institutions. She makes it flexible for her loyal customers to take stock on credit and make regular payments, especially monthly workers. Efia says this strategy is good because it enables her to make increased sales over a short period. She hopes the loan will inject more capital into her business to enable her to take cash delivery from her suppliers to reduce the cost of operations. She also hopes to increase savings to further her child’s education to the university, She is a member of the group called "Prosper Trust Group."

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Lux Estela

texts.es: la Sra. Luz L. tiene 42 años de edad, es residente de la colonia fraternidad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijas, dos de ellas estan casadas y la menor esta estudiando en el colegio, ella ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijas, ahora su unica fuente de ingresos es su pequeña pulperia que tiene 6 años de antiguedad, antes ella vendia productos varios de forma ambulante pero este es un trabajo muy cansado ya que tenia que caminar mucho para poder vender poco, por eso ella decidio montar una pulperia en la cual le va bien, ella necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder tener mas surtida su pulperia. ella dice que este negocio sera su unica fuente de ingresos por muchos años y que su meta es lograr que sea un supermercadito completo.
texts.en:
Luz L. is 42 years old and is a resident of the Fraternidad Colony. She is a single mother of 3 girls, two of whom are already married but the youngest is still in school. She has had to work very hard to support her girls, and currently the only source of income is her small grocery store, running now for 6 years. Before then, she sold various products door to door but that was a very physically taxing work, having to work very long ways to sell only a few things. But this is why she decided to set up a small convenience store, and it has been doing well. She requires a loan to be able to purchase more merchandise and to be able to restock the shelves of her store. She says that this store has been the only source of income for the past many eyars and her goal is to expand her store into a general store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soap, rice, sugar, beans, shortening, chicken, canned goods, sardines, and soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leslie Yamileth

texts.es: La Sra. Leslie F. tiene 30 años de edad, ella vive en el barrio San Jose que esta ubicado a 3 minutos de la playa cedeño. ella vive en union libre con el Sr. Haylon Nuñez con han procreado 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta en edad escolar y el otro esta pequeño y ella tiene que cuidarlo, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, asi ella no descuida a sus hijos y esta trabajando todo el dia, el negocio que tiene es una sala con varias consolas de juegos (maquinas de entretenimiento) en estos momentos ella necesita comprar dos televisores y reparar dos consolas de juegos por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito, este negocio deja buenas ganancias ya que muchos niños y jovenes pasan jugando durante sus horas libres. casi siempre esta lleno de personas que estan jugando.
texts.en:
Leslie F. is 30 years old and she lives in the San Jose region, located 3 minutes from the Cedeño beach. She lives with her common law husband Haylon Nuñez, and they have 2 children together, one is old enough to attend school, but the other is still a baby and she needs to take care of him. Her business is run from her house. It is convenient because she can attend to her children and work all day. Her business is a living room set up with various games (entertainment systems). She is currently seeing a need to purchase two television sets and repair two gaming consoles, which is the reason why she is requesting this loan. Her business brings her a good income, especially because many children and youth spend their free time playing in her living room. Her business is almost always filled to capacity with people playing.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two television sets and to repair two gaming consoles.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Glenda Orestila

texts.es: la Sra. Glenda G. se dedica a la venta ropa nueva y cosmeticos, ella compra el producto en algunas tiendas de la ciudad y sale a vender a barrios, caserios, colonias y pueblos cercanos ala ciudad de Choluteca, pero ella quiere ir a la frontera con nicaragua a comprar mercaderia ya que ahi es mas barata y de buena calidad, asi ella compra su producto a mejor precio y tiene mejores ganancias. ella tiene una pequeña hija a quien saca adelante con la ayuda de su esposo, el se dedica a vender camarones, ellos son  muy trabjadores y tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante con su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Glenda G. is sells new clothing and cosmetics. She purchases her products in stores in the city and resells them in the local neighbourhoods, complexes, colonies, and towns nears the city of Choluteca. But she wants to go to the Nicaragua border to purchase merchandise because it is much more affordable there and of good quality. This way she can purchase her products at a better price and have better earnings. She has a little girl that she supports with the help of her husband who is a shrimp salesman. They both are very hard workers and they have so many dreams of pulling through with their little girl.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba A., 36, is married and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl, both pursuing education in primary school. She lives with her family in their own house at Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abiba’s husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables, while she works hard to support his efforts by selling beans and groundnuts in the community market, having done this now for 16 years. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages and is now requesting a loan to buy in bulk in order to reduce travelling costs and maximize profit.

Abiba is a member of the community group called Hope trust group, whose members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac B., 30 years old and single, lives with his younger brother in a rented apartment at Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Isaac has been a tailor for the past five years. He owns a shop where his clients bring their clothes and prescribe a style to be sewn, and through this business he takes care of his younger brother at school.

He is requesting a loan to procure clothing materials, gadgets, threads, thimbles etc. to expand his operations, leading to an increased income that will allow him to accomplish his dream of sponsoring his brother’s education to the tertiary level and settling down.

Isaac is a member of a community group called Tailors Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support and assistance in handling repayment of the loans.

loans.use: To procure tailoring materials that will allow him to expand his business.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin H., 27-year-old single farmer living with his parents, breeds cows for milk production. He is in charge of pasturing and looking after cows, while his mother makes milk products such as cheese and yoghurt. Milk products are very popular among local people and they bring good income to Elchin`s family. Now he would like to expand his business and purchase two milk cows and one calf.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows and one calf.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: la Sra. Guillermina M. tiene 45 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser ropa americana usada y carteras usadas, ella tambien vende golosinas, esta comida la vende a partir de las 4 de la tarde todos los dias y en la mañana se dedica a vender la ropa, este negocio es muy bueno ya que a mucha gente le gusta comprar este tipo de ropa ya que es de buena calidad y tiene un precio muy accesible, ella vive en la colonia pedregal de la ciudad capital, en la colonia la conocen como una persona amable y sociable, ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas, dos estan en la escuela y la mayor esta en la universidad, con este negocio ella le ayuda a su esposo a salir adelante con los gastos del hogar. ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guillermina M. is 45 years old. She sells merchandise such as second-hand American clothing and handbags. She also sells sweets every day from 4 o’clock in the afternoon; in the mornings she sells clothes. This business is very good because many people like to buy this type of clothing because it is of high quality and is at an affordable price. She lives in the Pedregal district of the capital city, where she is known as a kind and sociable person. She lives with her husband and has three children, two of whom are at school and the eldest is at university. With this business she helps her husband to cover the household expenses. She needs the loan to be able to buy more bundles of clothes and thereby earn a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothing and handbags

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia has been working to help her husband support their children. She bakes bread in large quantities and supplies retailers. She buys the necessary materials from the city of Kumasi. Some of the ingredients she uses are flour, sugar, oil, etc. 
Felicia is 38 years old. She is married and has two kids who are in primary school. She lives with her family in a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 
Felicia has been in business for eight years. She wants to use this loan to buy materials in bulk to cut down on transportation costs. She is a member of the trust bank group Felicia--named after her. The members guarantee for one another to access loans and support each other in handling repayments.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and oil in bulk

loans.name: Talata

texts.en:
Talata is 35 years old, married and has five kids. She says four kids are pursuing education in primary and junior high schools. She lives with her family in their own house in Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Talata S. sells foodstuffs. She sells plantain, cassava, yam, etc. on a tabletop in the community market. She buys her goods from farmers in the surrounding villages. She also distributes cassava and plantain to local chop bar (restaurant) operators. Talata works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. 


She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy foodstuff on a large scale so that she can cut down on the cost of frequent trips to procure goods. This will also maximize her profit to enable her support her kids education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 32 years old. She is single and has a son who is pursuing his education in primary school. She lives with her son in a family house in a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Ama is a petty trader who sells cereals. She sells rice, maize, and groundnuts in the community market. She buys her goods from farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. 

She wants a loan to buy her stock in bulk so that she can cut down on cost (such as the expense incurred by frequent trips to procure her goods) and to maximize profit.

She is a member of the community group called the Hope Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Nuvia

texts.es: La Sra. Nuvia B. tiene 46 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian, ella se dedica a la compra venta de camarones, los compra en cedeño, ella tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el producto lo va a comprar en su carro y luego lo distribuye en diferentes localidades y comunidades de esta zona, (mercaditos y supermercados) tambien los vende por encargo a personas que se lo pidan, ella necesita el credito para comprar 500 libras de camarones, 200 libras de pescado blanco y 200 libras de pescado rojo.
texts.en:
Nuvia B. is 46 years old and is a single mother. She has 4 children all of whom are studying. She buys and sells prawns for a living. She buys them in Cedeño and has been working in this business for 14 years. Once she has purchased the products by truck, she then delivers them to various areas and communities within the region (markets and supermarkets). She also sells some to individuals that have put in orders. She needs the loan in order to buy 500 pounds of prawns, 200 pounds of white fish and 200 pounds of red fish.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy prawns and fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en:
Sadaqat A. is a married man and the father of one son. Together with his wife, he has been raising cattle for more than 20 years. This is the business that produces the income which allows him to feed his child and his wife.

As well as caring for his livestock, he also works as a teacher in the local school, which helps with the family's basic needs and provides additional income.

Sadaqat has asked for this loan to buy three young calves in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his livestock.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena, 48 years old, is married and the mother of six children. The two eldest children are now living independently but the others are pursuing education in the senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Being a resourceful mother, Abena works assiduously to help her husband provide for the family, especially in provision of food and payment of bills. She works as a petty trader, dealing in all kinds of bottled and canned soft drinks, such as malt, Fanta, Coca-Cola, and Pepsi. She procures these drinks from the wholesale dealers in the national capital, Accra, and sells them in the community market.

She has been in this business for the past seven years and is requesting a loan to procure assorted drinks in bulk. She believes the loan assistance will enable her to make timely deliveries of stock to serve a larger market, hoping to eventually help improve her family finances.

loans.use: To procure soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
In addition to being an entrepreneur in the grocery store business, Doris, 28, takes care of her four kids: two boys and two girls. Currently, all of them are pursuing education at the primary school. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her children in a family house in a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Doris runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood to help her husband provide for the family. She sells products like evaporated milk, candies, toiletries, pomade, and bottled water. She has been in business for four years now. She also sells cosmetics to support her family with additional income.

Doris is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding vegetables and spices to sell on a tabletop to diversify her trading. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida A. has worked in the agricultural field since she was young. Her parents instilled in her the value of hard work, which she demonstrates today. She buys and sells cattle and, in this manner, earns income for her family. Valida owns farmland but does not have a lot of confidence in agricultural production, so she has now opted to devote her time to raising animals. She uses her land now only to produce food for herself and her animals.

Valida is married and has three children. She hopes to purchase three more calves and in this way improve her living situation. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of $1,500.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has two young daughters and a son who are all currently in basic school. She lives with her family at Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Linda’s husband is a food crop farmer. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for two years now.

Mary sells items such as gari (manioc grits), rice, groundnuts, tins of tomatos, milk, sugar, etc. Mary procures her goods from wholesalers in the big towns nearby such as Kumasi. She seeks a loan to expand the size of her shop and also buy goods in bulk.

Mary hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to support her family, especially for her kids' education. She belongs to a trust bank group called “Yesu do”, meaning Jesus’ Love.. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure groceries in bulk for resale

loans.name: Rukayatu

texts.en:
Rukayatu Issahaku is forty-three years old. She is married and mother of four kids who are in junior high and basic school. Her husband works with as a farmer. Rukayatu and her family live in a family house at Ejura in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either in farming or sell in farm products. Very few people run different types of businesses.

Rukayatu sells cooking utensils and plastics. She buys plastic materials such as bowls, buckets, and utensils from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells them in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell through door-to-door sales. She has been in this business for five years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Yesu do” (translated, Jesus’ love) Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and help each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en: Mushviq A. is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his two beloved children the best. He carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 10 years in the purchase and sale of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase three cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he is requesting US $1500. Mushviq thanks you very much for your help.

loans.use: purchase three more calves

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is thirty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are currently studying in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her family in their own house at Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Florence works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables.

Florence sells fresh eggs and clothing materials. She buys her stocks of eggs from the poultry farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes the eggs to coffee sellers, food vendors and canteen operators. She wants a loan to buy fresh eggs on large scale so that she can cut down on cost, as in frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

Florence is a member of the community group called “Yesu do” (translated Jesus’ love) trust group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fresh eggs in bulk

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en:
Faiq A. is a 33-year-old, very experienced and popular dentist. He started his business as soon as he finished the university and over the last 11 years, he has gained respect and very good reputation among local people. Faiq is married and has 4 children, and he really cares about their future education and has started to save money from his income. He believes one day, one of his children will become a dentist and continue his business.

Right now Faiq has applied for 2000 USD as a loan to improve his working conditions and purchase new dental equipment. Faiq is a trusted client of AqroInvest with a successful loan history.

loans.use: improve working conditions and purchase new dental equipment

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. is fifty-five years old. He is married and the father of a son, who is in school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment at Ejura, a town in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is a petty trader who trades in toothpaste, tooth brushes, radio sets, touch lights, and other items. He buys his supplies from wholesalers and retails them to his customers. He enjoys his trade very much. However, he is handicapped by low working capital and finds it difficult making enough in the face of general economic hardship. He therefore needs the loan to remain in business.

He wants to use the loan to buy new stock to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make a good income to expand his business. He is a member of the community group called Mawuli Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

Augustine is in the photo taken during his group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase toothpaste, tooth brushes, radio sets, touch lights, and other items bulk.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz M. is a married mother of five children. She has spent all her life in touch with the land, since her parents and grandmother taught her how to farm. Agriculture and livestock are her passions, and she is highly motivated as these are the source of livelihood for her family.

Her husband is also a farmer and helps her with the business. She raises young calves until they have grown enough to be sold. She nurtures her animals with such care that she has a name for every animal. She would like to expand her business and purchase more young cattle. To reach her aspirations, Solmaz calls out to your generous hearts to receive the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: To purchase three heads of cattle.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
With five children and the responsibility of providing food for his family, Vaqif E. has raised cattle and farmed from a very young age. He has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals.

Today, Vaqif finds himself in need of more calves to raise, to sell them when necessary, or when their sale will be most advantageous. Vaqif has applied for a loan of $1500 to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase three calves.

loans.name: Ingrid Johana

texts.es: La Sr. Ingrid E. tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene 3 años de tener su negocio que esta ubicado en la colonia Buena Vista Centro, ella tiene muy buena clientela, el prestamo lo solicita para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio ya que entre mas productos existan las personas compran mas y asi se tienen mejores ganancias, la meta de ella es poder graduar de la universidad a sus hijas que son lo mas importante que ella tiene en esta vida.
texts.en:
Ingrid E. is a 29 year-old single mother of 2 daughters. She sells popular consumer goods for a living. She has had her business, which can be found in the Buena Vista Centro area, for 3 years. She has many good customers. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more merchandise and thereby expand her business. When she has more products, people will buy more and so she will earn a better income. Her aim is for her daughters to be able to graduate from university. They are more important to her than anything else in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tinned goods, drinks, fritters, butter, rice, beans, coffee, bread, sugar, corn, tortillas, beef, chicken and pork

loans.name: Suraj

texts.en:
Suraj A. is 28 years old and married with two adorable daughters. From the time he was young, Suraj has been learning to work in a small business breeding cattle. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the it grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progress more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business in order to offer a better future for his children and see them as professional, ethical, and hardworking people. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $1500. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Suraj’s business.

loans.use: To purchase three calves.

loans.name: Alex Yobani

texts.es: El Sr. Alex O. tiene 37 años de edad, el es soltero  y tiene 2 hijos, el se dedica a la venta de leña y tambien fabrica mantarrayas para pescar, el vive en la colonia Buena Vista, el necesita el credito prar comprar 5,000 rajas de leña tambien necesita comprar hilo de seda para elaborar las mantarrayas. en estos dias la madera de consumo se esta escaseando y en necesita comprarla antes de que se ponga mas cara.
texts.en:
Alex O. is 37 years old, he is single and he has 2 children. He sells firewood and also fishing nets. He lives in the Colony of Buena Vista. He requires a loan to purchase 5000 pieces of firewood, and to purchase waxed twine to make his fishing nets. There is a shortage of firewood currently and he needs to purchase now before the prices go up.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en:
Qadir T. is 37 years old and married with three children. Qadir sells cosmetics, washing powders, shampoo, and other items in the market. He has been in this business for six years. This activity generates the main income for Qadir’s family, which consist of three children and his wife.

Even though his store is not very big, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Qadir requests a $1500 loan to purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Glafiro

texts.es:
El señor Glafiro I. vive con su esposa, son una familia unida y trabajadora que lucha día a día para salir adelante. El señor Glafiro tiene su propio negocio de pulga en venta de aparatos electrónicos, herramientas, etc. 
Pero requiere de la compra de más mercancía para su venta y seguir así atrayendo a más clientes, motivo por el cual  esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Glafiro I. lives with his wife. They are a solid, hardworking family who are struggling day by day to get ahead. Glafiro has his own flea market selling electronics, tools, etc. But he needs to buy more merchandise for sale in order to continue attracting more customers. And that is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei owns a butcher business. He uses his car to go out to villages and purchase meat from farmers in bulk. Then he sells the meat at the local market. He has been in this business for eight years.

Since Sergei always sells fresh meat, he has many regular clients. Sergei would like to borrow 6,000 UAH so as to buy more meat items for sale.

His goal in business is to build his own kiosk and develop his business further.

loans.use: To purchase meat items for sale

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge Alberto vive con su esposa la señora María Teresa, la señora se hace cargo del hogar y de la familia, el trabaja en una Institución Medica en el área de alimentación como manejador de alimentos, ellos por el momento tienen varios proyectos a realizar pero el primordial es construir la barda lateral posterior de su casa, para brindarle mas protección a su familia; es por lo que están solicitando este crédito
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto lives with his wife, María Teresa. She takes care of the home and the family. He works in a medical institution in the field of nutrition as a food driver. They currently have various projects, but the primary one is to construct a side wall in back of their house. They want this in order to provide more protection to their family. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a side wall in back of their house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan  F. es una persona de mediana edad, vive con su esposa la señora María de Jesús, ellos viven solos, ya que todos sus hijos se casaron, el es albañil independiente desde hace 6 años, su esposa la señora María es empleada de la florería de una Funeraria conocida de la ciudad. 
Ya tiene empezado un proyecto que es la realización de una ampliación del frente de su casa, solamente les estaba haciendo falta mas material; motivo por el cual tramitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Juan F. is middle aged. He lives with his wife, María de Jesús. They live alone since all of their children are married. He has been an independent bricklayer for six years. His wife, María, is an employee of the florist shop in a funeral parlor that is well known in the city. They have now started a project to enlarge the front of their house. The only thing they need is more material. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge the front of their house

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya B. is married with one child. She sells shoes and clothing at a market in the city of Nikopol. Lesya has been in this business for nine years. Her considerable experience allows her to choose good products that sell well.

Lesya is a hardworking and honest person. She desires to develop her business further and extend her sales to more places. Lesya would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase her assortment of items for sale.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of items for sale

loans.name: Sharifa Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is the group leader of Sharifa group. There are four members in this group and all of them would like receive money for their businesses.

Sharifa and Nazifa want to take a loan for their general stores. They each want to buy necessary materials for their business. Also Soria wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business and Bebe Arifa wants to take a loan for her bakery. She wants to buy firewood and flour for baking.

Together they requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Bebe Ausha Group

texts.en:
Bebe Ausha is the group leader of Bebe Ausha group. There are three members in this group, each of whom wants to take a loan for expanding their business.

Bebe Ausha wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Jaan Omrwaz wants to take a loan for her husband who has a water-tanker truck.

Salma wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable cart.

So they are all very thanking for AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) and Kiva lenders who can support all worlds.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Latifa Group

texts.en:
Latifa is a member of Latifa group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her own business progress.

Latifa wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring.

Tamana wants to take a loan for her bead-working business.

Wazhma wants to take a loan for making head-coverings.

Together they requested a group loan of 15,000 Afghani for the term of 9 months. They are happy that, through this process, they can progress.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Abdul Basher

texts.en:
Abdul Basher is the son of M. David. He lives in district 7th in Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives in a big family of six and he has a construction shop. He needs a small loan for his business to become strong and to help his family in a better way.

He requested an individual loan of 50000 afghani for the term of 12 months. He wants to increase and progress his business. He also wants to buy necessary materials and complete his stock for his shop and start working hard.


So he is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank everyone for this process, especially the Kiva lenders around the world

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a very ambitious self-made man. At 24 years old, he owns a shop selling mobile phones and accessories. He also provides repairs and services for his customers.

Adham is a very hardworking micro-entrepreneur. He needs a loan in the amount of $2,000 to procure more phones and accessories, hoping to attract more clients and make a better income to help his family.

loans.use: To procure more phones and accessories for sale

loans.name: Muzhgan Group

texts.en:
Muzhgan is the group leader of Muzhgan group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for her/his business to progress.

Ghally and Leeyna want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They want to buy new machines for their business. Sohila wants to take a loan for her brother’s general store. And Muzhgan wants to take a loan for her husband’s store. They have requested a group loan of 25000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. They are very happy with this loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her husband's store

loans.name: Shah Jan Group

texts.en: Shah Jan is the group leader of Shah Jan group. There are two members in this group. They want to take a loan of 20000 Afghani for the term of 6 months and each of them wants to expand her business. Shah Jan wants to take a loan for the business of bead working. Zuhal wants to take a loan for her brother who has a general store. Zuhal's brother wants to expand his business and buy more materials for his general store. They want to thank AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials for bead working

loans.name: Arfeh

texts.en:
Mr. Arfeh A. is dedicated to his business of selling chicken, and it has been the only source of income for supporting his family. He has a wife and three children.

He has now asked Ryada for credit so that he can buy chicken to sell at the market, thereby continuing to improve the economic conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for sale at market

loans.name: Nizamaddin

texts.en:
Nizamaddin M. is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was young, Nizamaddin has been around people raising animals and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Nizamaddin harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. In this way, he can create more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved three children, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work.

Nizamaddin is requesting a $1,500 loan to purchase two calves. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him continue to bring his family well-being and security.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Fikret A., a very hard-working man, is married with one son. Thirteen years ago, after having been rejected for various jobs, Fikret decided to start a business from his home providing turner services making plastic frames for windows and doors. His good service has earned him many clients and he now employs someone to help him meet his clients’ needs.

Fikret’s desire is to keep growing his micro-business, so he is asking for a loan of $1,500 to refurbish his shop and to buy some equipment in order to improve the quality of service he offers. Your help will be very useful to Fikret and he sincerely thanks you for your trust and support.

loans.use: Buy some equipment in order to improve the quality of service

loans.name: Mirabdulla

texts.en:
Mirabdulla A. is 48 years old and is married with three sons. From the time he was young, Mirabdulla has been learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children. He hopes to see them develop into professional, ethical, and hardworking people. For this reason, he is asking a loan of $1,200. He wants this loan in order to buy additional livestock. Be an important part of the growth of Mirabdulla’s business.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Milaz

texts.en:
Milaz S., 54, is married and has three children. He lives in the small village of Sabirabad City and works in the agricultural industry. More than 20 years ago, he decided to begin to cultivate land that he owned. He did so to generate more income that would enable him to support his family.

Milaz grows wheat, corn, and vegetables, which he must give the proper care so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. He will use the loan money to buy materials that will enable him to improve production yield. Milaz has discovered over the years that he enjoys doing this job, which is why he is grateful for this access to loans that allow to improve his farm and become a better farmer.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve production yield

loans.name: Khalid Group

texts.en:
Khalid is the group leader of Khalid group. There are five members in this group and each of the group members wants a loan to expand their business and buy the essential things for their business.

Manila wants to take a loan for her beauty salon.

Nazia and Sweeta want to take a loan for their businesses of bead-working and embroidery.

Nasrin wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Khalid wants to take a loan for her general store.

They are happy that, through a Kiva loan, they can improve their businesses.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: İlqar

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, İlqar A. has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle. He attends carefully to his animals' needs since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. İlqar is married and has two children.

For İlqar, it is very important to continue to work raising his animals. He is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that, in the future, he can earn more money. The additional income will help his family. We appreciate your support for İlqar’s projects.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami G. is a 29-year-old cattleman who is married with two adorable daughters. Owing to his father, who is a farmer, Nizami has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Nizami gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals - and all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Nizami says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education. Nizami would now like to expand his business by purchasing two cattle. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan in the amount of $1,200 and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Nizami’s business.

loans.use: To purchase two more calves

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan Q. is a farmer who knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Elshan is takes care of his four children, who are the meaning of his life. 

Elshan is requesting a loan in order to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.

loans.use: Purchase two calves, along with fodder

loans.name: İkhtiyar

texts.en: İkhtiyar M. is a 45-year-old farmer. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his three children. Currently, his children are high school students, and they always support and help their father with his business. İkhtiyar needs to purchase additional cattle. To fulfill this need, he is requesting a loan of $1200 US. İkhtiyar is grateful for everyone's support.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir A. is married with 5 children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.
