Tahir owns a grocery store. He began this enterprise 9 years ago with a starting capital of $300 US. Over time, he has expanded his business. Today, his whole family helps run it.

Tahir needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he offers. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1200. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of  becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Mirdamat

texts.en:
Mirdamat Z. is 58 years old. He is married with four children. He owns a grocery store where he sells a variety of products like macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and detergents. He started this business 12 years ago with a small inventory. Over time, he expanded his business and it has become very successful.

Today, Mirdamat is requesting a loan of $1200 US to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, which he does his best to provide for. We believe his perseverance and clear vision are key factors to the success of his small business.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his grocery store

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad N. is a hard-working man who sells a variety of fruits and vegetables in the central market of Saatli. He considers himself happy and humble. He started his business in 2003 with savings he had accumulated over a long period of time. He wants to provide an education for his 2 young children.

Fuad's biggest dream is to prepare his children for professional careers so they don't have to suffer through hard labor, like he did when he was young. To realize this goal, Fuad is requesting a loan of $1200 US to buy more goods so he can increase his earnings.

loans.use: purchase more goods to increase earnings

loans.name: Nak Bakat Group

texts.en:
Nak Bakat is the group leader of Nak Bakat group. There are three members in this group and they together want to take a loan of 42,000 Afghani for the term of 10 months for the progress of their businesses.

Nak Bakat wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

Amana wants to take a loan for her leather-working business.

Raza Gul wants to take a loan for her mobile-selling-cart business.

So they are very happy with this process of loans that can support all people.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lida Group

texts.en:
Lida is the group leader of Lida group. There are four members in this group and they each want to bring new changes in their business and expand it as well. They have requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani.

Lida and Rohina want to take a loan for their husbands' general stores.

Bebe Marzia wants to take a loan for her bakery business.

Shakila wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

They are very happy with this loan availablilty in Afghanistan that helps the poor people.

loans.use: To expand her husband's general store

loans.name: Jameila Group

texts.en: Jameila is the group leader of Jameila group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take out a loan for her/his business. Jameila wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. A. wants to take out a loan for his general store. Reshad Ahmad wants to take out a loan for his shop where he sells gas. They are requesting a group of loan 42,000 afghani for the term of 10 months. They are very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding group members' businesses

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is a resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Edwin B., who has been a construction worker in Roxas since 1994. He earns a salary of PHP 350.00 daily. They have been blessed with two children, who are both in school: Edilyn, the eldest, is 11 years old and in grade six, and Mark Andrew, age 7, is in grade two. Emilyn dreams that one day her children will finish college and have good jobs. She wants to earn additional income to support the growing needs of her children, especially in their studies.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to expand her poultry business and start a piggery. As soon as she receives her loan, she will immediately buy piglets to fill up her empty pigpen. The loan will also help her maintain her existing poultry business.

While it is not easy, she always tries her best to save her daily income for their children’s future. She is happy that they already have their own house and she hopes that they will be uplifted to a better life in the future. She believes that God will always be with them to guide and give them spiritual support.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is already 48 years old and married to Florante M., a construction worker in INC Construction Company in Tuguegarao City. The couple is blessed with four children. The eldest is Lacer, who is 29 years old, and operates a passenger tricycle in Cauayan City. Next is Roan who is 24 years old and finished a two-year computer course; she is now employed as a clerk in INC Company. Third is Nova, who is 20 years old and a graduate of BS Entrepreneur; she is currently looking for a job because she is just a fresh graduate. Harriet, the youngest, is 18 years old and just graduated from high school. Two of them are already married and have their own family. Annie hopes to see her youngest child finish a four year course someday. 

Annie has been selling frozen meat products and preserved foods since 1996. This has been one of their main sources of income since she bought her refrigerator. She wants to take a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to have additional working capital to buy more products like longganisa, hotdog, tocino, etc. She retails her meat products house to house in their village. Annie dreams of increasing her savings to be able to purchase a tricycle that will be used in selling her meat products and in roaming into other villages to make more income. She also hopes that her youngest child will be able to pursue his studies in college this coming enrollment. Annie believes that through her sacrifice and patience in working and with strong faith with God, all her goals will be attained someday.

loans.use: To buy more meat products

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: "I have work but my earnings are not enough to meet all the family (needs). I have been working my whole life. That is why my husband and I engaged in farming to supplement our income," says Helen D., a 39-year-old mother of two children. CEVI is reaching out to more poor Filipino families to help them have their own livelihoods. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and four sacks of ammonium

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is now 35 years old and already married to Ernesto Villoria Jr., 34 years old. They are blessed with two children: Erwin, 11 years old and the youngest is Jayvee, 10 years old. Both children are attending the primary level of education. Fely is very thankful for having a happy family and having a good bonding with each other.

Aside from the passenger tricycle that her husband manages, she is also engaged in a poultry raising business. With their income from their business activities, they can provide the basic needs for their family. But she plans to expand their business in order to earn more profit to save funds for the schooling of their children. For this, she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 for both the maintenance of their motorcycle transport and her livestock raising business. She also wants to start a rice vending business to earn extra income. However, Fely said that she cannot do all of these at the same time considering the availability of funds. Thus, she is praying that her loan will be approved to be able to make her business successful. She believes that all her business plans, if pursued, will be of big help to her family. She hopes to become successful in the business by being patient and by exerting more efforts in doing her work. According to her, she will only believe that she has already achieved her goals in life when she sees her children finish their studies in college and find a better job.

loans.use: Motorcycle Maintenance

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
"I started my farm using a small parcel of land that I inherited from my parents. As of now, we are still in the process of preparing the land before planting. The income that we get from farming rice is what we use to meet the needs of our family.”

Jose is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase 2 sacks of certified seeds and 20 liters of crude oil to run farm machinery. The loan will really help him grow his rice farm business as well as his harvest.

CEVI provides all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of certified seeds and 20 liters of crude oil to run farm machinery.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is already 30 years old. She is a business minded woman who is married to Tito Mellares, who works as a tricycle operator in their village. Her family is very religious that is why their four children are all named after the bible names. Their eldest is Apo Calypsis, 11 years old, second is Tessalonica, 6 years old, third is Acaya, 5 years old and the youngest is Macedonia, who is 7 months old. Their family peacefully lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Their children are all loving and obedient. They always help each other in their household chores and in their studies.

Daisy is engaged in a vending business that serves as her source of income. She sells vegetables, fish, rice, cooked snacks like “pancit” (a type of noodle dish) and other different food products. With her business, she is gaining an income of 300 pesos daily and it is really of big help to her husband to provide for their family’s needs. For almost two years she has been operating her vending business, Daisy is still not able to increase her income from her business. Thus she wanted to avail a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 for the productivity and improvement of her vending. The loan will be of big help to make her business profitable and will help to support the needs of her children, especially their educational needs.

loans.use: Business Improvement--food production.

loans.name: Rusuethe

texts.en:
"I experience working by a casual basis. I have work today but at the end of six months you will end my contract and have to find another job again", says Rusuethe A., 36-year old mother of two children. Now, she is managing a small parcel of rice farm. This is a better livelihood for her. From her harvest, she was able to feed and clothe her family as well as providing their other needs. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and crude oil to run farm tractors. She hopes that by doing so she will be able to improve her harvest.

CEVI gives not just loans. They also provide trainings and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and crude oil to run farm tractors.

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene is 37 years old and a resident of Barangay Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Magno B. who works as a laborer and, at the same time, a farmer in their village. They were blessed with three children: Jelyn, 11 years old, Khiel, 8 years old, and Magno B. Jr, 5 years old. Jene wants to save funds to be able to send her children to school and she hopes to support their studies until college.

She is currently selling fish, vegetables, cooked snacks, and other items in their village through house to house. She is gaining an income of one thousand pesos weekly and from this, she could be able to help her husband to provide for their needs and she tries to save a little for her children’s education. To make her business grow, Jene is planning and hoping to put up her business in the market where she could sell more items and she could obtain more customers. In order to help her in achieving this dream, she is requesting to avail a loan from the lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. She believes that having a business in the market will bring her more income. That’s why she is really hoping to have the loan as additional working capital. 

Her current family situation is good since her husband is helping her in gaining money for their family. She hopes that they continuously provide for the needs of their children as they grow. She always tries her best to achieve her dreams. She knows that failure is a part of trying but she must not give up trying until she will succeed.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jehly

texts.en:
Jehly B. just had her harvest recently during the time CEVI visited her. She is about to do land preparation in her farm. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase crude oil, herbicides, and complete fertilizers. She hopes that with her loan she will have better harvest next time. 

CEVI provides not just loans to clients. It also gives training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase crude oil, herbicides, and complete fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a business-woman from the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is now 27 years old and already married to Lacer D., who helps her in their present business. They have been gifted with three children. Two of the children are studying in elementary level while the youngest is just a seven-month-old baby. 

Jennifer started her snack vending business when she got married while her husband has been operating their passenger tricycle, which serves as their source of income. Sometimes, they use their tricycle as their service in vending and they are gaining a net average income of 300 pesos daily. Their income is not enough to sustain the family with their daily needs and to maintain their tricycle business. For this, she is hoping to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 ($US 125) to be used in purchasing more products to sell and to be able to have a greater income for the future use of their children in school and in their home necessities. The loan will be of big help also for the maintenance of their tricycle transport business. She is happy that her husband is always supporting her by accompanying her in selling. She hopes that with the sacrifices she makes, together with her husband and with the help of our God, they could be able to support the studies of their children and meet the daily expenditures of their family. Jennifer aims for a better living and she believes that by working hard and having patience in work, her goals will be possible to attain.

loans.use: Business improvement and motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is already 33 years old and married to Robert V., who is working in a furniture shop. They live peacefully in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. They have been blessed with four children. The eldest is Juanito, 14 years old, he is an elementary graduate and he doesn’t continue his studies because he is eager to work to earn an income. Second child is Roan, 12 years old, just graduated in elementary level and hoping to pursue her studies in high school next school year. Third is Marites, 10 years old, she is in grade five level. Youngest child is Rubelyn, 3 years old. 

Joan is busy in buying and selling vegetables in their village, which serves as her source of income. She has been in this kind of business for almost four years. She purchases vegetables in Cauayan City public market and sells them in their village. She has many customers but she was not able to provide for her customer’s demands due to lack of funds. To have additional capital, she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP 4,000 to purchase additional vegetables to sell and to maintain her vending activity. She wants to expand her vending business in order to provide her children with their needed assistance in their studies. With her vending business, she is earning an income of PHP 200 everyday. This is really of great help to sustain the needs of her family.

According to Joan, it is better to give than to receive, especially when it is for the benefits of her children. She will do and give her very best to make her vending productive and to be able to make their living progressive, also to send her children to school and finish college course someday.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and business maintenance.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy C., 33-year old mother of three children, shared her life story to CEVI. She says she has been a tenant farmer for a long time already. Some of their harvest goes to the owner of the farm that they are working. They want to buy their own farm. She needs to expand her harvest to realize that dream.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers, herbicides and 40 liters of gasoline. She hopes that by availing a loan to finance her farm, she will be able to improve their harvest.

CEVI aims to help small business grow. They provide credit assistance, training and insurance to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers, herbicides and 40 liters of gasoline.

loans.name: I Nengah Sunantra

texts.en:
I Nengah Sunantra - (DNR.M-0673) is a 54 year-old male living in the town of Brawantangi - Melaya. He is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, I Nengah Sunantra owns & operates a business raising livestock.  His business is primarily raising pigs for sale. I Nengah Sunantra has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, I Nengah Sunantra joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities.  I Nengah Sunantra successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for the his livestock.  I Nengah Sunantra now requests a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by I Nengah Sunantra from DINARI.  I Nengah Sunantra plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


I Nengah Sunantra - (DNR.M-0673) merupakan 54 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Brawantangi - Melaya.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, I Nengah Sunantra memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  I Nengah Sunantra sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Nengah Sunantra menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, I Nengah Sunantra bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  I Nengah Sunantra meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk memperluas tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  I Nengah Sunantra berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn dreams that someday her children will finish college and have a better job. She knows that it is not easy but she always tries her best to save her daily income for her children’s future. She believes that God will always be with them to guide and give them spiritual support.

Emilyn is a resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Edwin B. who has been a construction worker in Roxas since 1994. He is employed there with a salary of PHP350.00 daily. They have been blessed with two children who are both studying at present. Edilyn, the eldest child, is 11 years old and in grade six; Mark Andrew is in grade two, and he is 7 years old. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 because she is planning to expand her poultry raising and put up a piggery business. According to her, as soon as she receives her loan, she will immediately buy piglets to fill up her empty pigpen. The loan will also be a big help to maintain her existing poultry business. She wants to help her husband in generating additional income to support the growing needs of their children, especially in their studies. She is happy that they already have their own house and she hopes that their ways of living will be uplifted to experience a better life in the future.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
" I started working on a farm when I got married to a farmer. Everyday we work industriously to be able to have a better yield for our rice so that we can buy everything we need in our family", says  Medina C., a 36-year-old mother of two children. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase six sacks of fertilizer and herbicde. In addition to that, she might as well buy crude oil for farm tractor use. 

CEVI provides their clients credit, training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase six sacks of fertilizer and herbicde

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 23 years old and married to Allan B., who works as a farmer in their village. They are blessed with only one child, named Ashley, who is three years old already. The couple lives happily with their child in Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. According to Leonor, her daughter was her inspiration for her business and she promised to do her best to give everything for her daughter. Leonor believes that time is gold, and as early as possible she wants to have more savings for their family’s necessities, especially for the future of her daughter.

Leonor manages a small general store in front of their house that serves as her source of income. She retails vegetables and other goods. She just started her business a month ago and she hopes it will grow because it helps her family a lot, especially in their daily expenses. Leonor plans to make her store productive to earn more income. In this regard, she is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more groceries and vegetables. She dreams of making her business grow to become successful and able to sustain their daily needs. So far, she is gaining a net income of PHP 3,600.00 monthly, and she is hoping to increase it by having more products to sell. She wants to save funds for her daughter's schooling because her only wish is to provide good education for her child to finish a college course someday.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
"I am a tenant. Most of our harvest go to the owner of the farm that we are tilling. I am married and have four children. Two of my children were already married. Only one is working and one is still studying," shared Lilia D. C., a 46-year old CEVI client of three years.

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 20 liters of diesel and four sacks of fertilizers. She thinks that this will improve their harvest and she will then be able to buy their own farm.

CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 20 liters of diesel and four sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Luzonia

texts.en:
Luzonia is already a widow. She was gifted with seven wonderful children. Their family lives in the distant village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Two of her children are already married while the other five are still single. Her four eldest children are all elementary school graduates while the three youngest are still attending elementary level. Luzonia sometimes feels desperate for not being able to give her children a better education because of financial crisis. She works hard and sacrifices a lot to be able to surpass their financial difficulties. She further said that being a widow with seven children is not an easy responsibility but she believes that with the help of our God, she could be able to make her self strong enough to face life’s difficulties.

Luzonia is currently selling DXN products, which are mostly medicine products. This is her source of income to further support their daily needs. She is hoping for a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more DXN products. So far, she is earning PHP 3,500 monthly. Sometimes this hasn't been enough for her family's budget because some of the children are still studying in elementary school. Sometimes her children don’t have enough allowance in school. This is why Luzonia is really striving to succeed in her business and provide for their needs. She believes that our Father God above will not abandon them because she has faith in Him, and from Him she gets her strength.

loans.use: To purchase more DXN products to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 34-year-old simple businesswoman who is married to Roderick B., who works as a farmer in their village. They live peacefully in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. The couple has been blessed with six children. Reymart is the eldest, 16 years old, and he is in fourth year high school, next is Rachelle who is 13 years old, third is Reymund, 12 years old, Roderick is fourth, and is 10 years old, fifth is Rovie who is 7 years old and Rhea, the youngest is only 5 months old. Marites is happy to have a big family because she has a principle in life that “the more children you have, the merrier the family is”.

Marites is engaged in selling different commodities that serves as her source of income. She has a small table located in front of their house where she retails her goods. Before, she was selling vegetables and barbeque but she thought of changing her vending into bread, soft drinks, food seasonings and other commodities.

She is planning to have a small store to be able to make her vending convenient and comfortable for her customers. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to be used in buying more items to sell so that her income will increase. Thus she will be able to have funds to build her store.

So far, she is earning a net income of 200 pesos daily. She really hopes that she will have more capital to make her business grow. Marites is willing to sacrifice for the benefit of her children, especially now that her eldest will shortly enter high school.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works as a gasoline retailer in their village. Most of her customers are owners of passenger tricycles. She wants to make her business grow to be able to increase her income. She plans to obtain many customers in order to earn her more profit but she doesn’t have enough capital to expand her business.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan of Php 5,000. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase a larger volume of gasoline to retail and she also plans to expand her current business into a village store to further increase her daily income to attain her goals in life.

Her goal is to send her children to school because they are really willing to study, especially her eldest child who is presently in secondary level. She and her husband are hoping to provide their children with their educational needs. And by working hard, they know that they can achieve all their goals for their children’s welfare.

Marites is a 36-year-old businesswoman who is married to Jimmy L. Sr. They live in Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. They are blessed with four children who are all studying at the moment. The eldest is Jimmy L. Jr., he is 15 years old, Mary Joy is 13 years old, Mary Jane is 11 years old and Jerome, the youngest, is 6 years old.

Marites is glad to have a happy and wonderful family. Their family has a strong faith in God and they always help each other both in times of difficulties and in times of happiness.

loans.use: To purchase more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: "I am working with a small rice farm. My husband is a farmer and he is the one managing our business. The income that we get from farming is what we use to send all our children in school and buy the things we need in our home," says Virgincita D., the mother of six children. She is asking a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She heard about Kiva and thought she could obtain a loan to support her farm. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of certified seeds and pesticides as well. CEVI is reaching out to a lot of poor Filipino communities so that the people can have their own livelihood. It provides them with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of certified seeds and pesticides as well

loans.name: Ni Kadek Widiantari

texts.en: Ni Kadek Widiantari (DNR.M-0670) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has a school-aged child. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Kadek Widiantari joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ni Kadek Widiantari is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI. Ni Kadek Widiantari is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Ni Kadek Widiantari - (DNR.M-0670) merupakan 33 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Kadek Widiantari memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Kadek Widiantari sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek Widiantari menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Kadek Widiantari bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Kadek Widiantari telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Kadek Widiantari berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
"Before CEVI came, I was asking for a loan from lenders who charge high interest. I am happy now that I joined the CEVI program and have been their clients for a long time already. My husband and I till 1.5 hectare of land. We use our harvest to buy all the things we need in our family," says Mary Joy E., 34-year-old mother of four children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will truly help her improve her harvest.

CEVI provides borrowers with not just loan, but also gives training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Ni Komang Suwiti

texts.en: Ni Komang Suwiti (DNR.M-0671) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Komang Suwiti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Komang Suwiti - (DNR.M-0671) merupakan 41 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Komang Suwiti memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Komang Suwiti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Suwiti menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Komang Suwiti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Komang Suwiti telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pengobatan bagi ternak peminjam. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Komang Suwiti berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase medication for her livestock

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia F. owns a small parcel of land. She is a 48-year-old mother of four children. She wants to grow her business even more. Her husband, Danilo F., is the one managing their farm. Their harvest is what they use for family consumption and to pay for the needs of their family.

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers. She thinks that by doing so, she can be able to improve her harvest.

CEVI is reaching out to poor Filipino families. Your help could really make a difference in uplifting lives. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Bibirachab

texts.ru: Махмуродова Бибирачаб живет в районе Рудаки. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает на стройке. Бибирачаб с мужем имеет торговую точку на рынке "Сафина". На рынке торгует сама Бибирачаб. Она торгует материалами. Этим видом деятельности она работает более 20 лет. Т.к. заработная плата мужа не хватает, они решили начать свой бизнес. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы купить материалы, т.е. пополнить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Bibirachab Mahmurodova lives in the Rudaki district. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Bibirachab and her husband have a retail outlet at the Safina market. Bibirachab is the one selling fabrics at the market. She has been working in this field over 20 years. Because her husband’s salary was not enough to support the family, they decided to start their own business. Bibirachab wants to obtain the loan in order to purchase fabrics to add to her merchandise assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabrics purchase

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура Рауфова  торгует на рынке города Истаравшана. В ассортимент ее товара входит детская одежда. 
Манзура проживает со своими детьми, мужа у нее нет, поэтому приходиться одной содержать семью, как трудно бы ей не приходилось, она старается работать много.
Привозит товар, продает его на рынке, и снова ездит за товаром. Она хочет увеличить свою прибыль, для этого она планирует арендовать еще одну точку продажи, и реализовывать моющие средства и средства личной гигиены. Для воплощения этой цели, она запрашивает сумму в размере 900 сомони, сроком на 4 месяца, и считает что данная сумма, достаточно поддержит ее в достижении поставленной цели.
texts.en:
Manzura R. has a business at the Istaravshan town market. The assortment of goods she carries includes children's clothing. Manzura lives with her children. She does not have a husband, and as the sole support of her family, no matter how hard it gets, she tries to work a lot. She brings in goods, sells them at the market, and goes on yet another buying trip. Manzura would like to increase her profits, and to do so is planning to rent an additional sale outlet to sell cleaning supplies and personal hygiene products. To realize this goal, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 900 somoni. She believes that amount sufficient to reach the goal she has set herself.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wetri

texts.en: Ni Ketut Wetri (DNR.M-0672) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Ketut Wetri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut Wetri - (DNR.M-0672) merupakan 29 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Wetri memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Wetri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Wetri menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Wetri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Wetri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Wetri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Jesucrifina

texts.en:
Jusucrifina is 55 years old and married to Tamie Lonario, who works as a farmer in their village. They are blessed with two children: the eldest is Jeremie who is already 29 years old and graduated as Electronics Technician, while the youngest is Wilbeth, 28 years old, an undergraduate in college.

Jusucrifina is involved in direct selling of DXN products (DXN is a dietary supplement, food and beverage and personal care products company). She sells her products house to house because she believes that she will have more customers if she is the one who reaches her customers.

She is asking for additional capital from ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) to be able to have more DXN products to sell and thus will increase her income. So far, her monthly income ranges from Php 6,000 - Php 7,000 depending on the availability of the ordered products and the number of customers that she has marketed to.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 so as to be able to purchase additional products that will satisfy her customers’ demands. She believes that the amount she is requesting will be of big help to earn her more profit.

Jusucrifina believes that through her sacrifices and patience in working she will be able to attain her goal in life of having a happy and comfortable living: a life that need not be elegant but a life that is just pretty simple.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ni Komang Budiastri

texts.en:
Ni Komang Budiastri makes a living primarily from raising pigs for sale. She is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has three school-aged children. Ni Komang Budiastri has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Komang Budiastri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from DINARI and would like to borrow 5,000,000 IDR to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her second loan from DINARI. Ni Komang Budiastri plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support  her immediate family.
DNR.M-0673

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Komang Budiastri memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Komang Budiastri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Budiastri menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Komang Budiastri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Komang Budiastri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Komang Budiastri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.
