loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Marmel

texts.en:
Marmel, at the age of 32, has already three children. The eldest is Kimberly Kate: she is 10 years old and studying in a primary school. Next is John Carl who is 5 years old and will be studying next school year in day care while the youngest is Kea, his little baby who is just six months old. Marmel and his family live in Barangay Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.

He patiently operates his “balot” vending business to support his family with their daily needs. A “balot” is a fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. “Balot” vending is his only source of income to be able to sustain the necessities of his family.

He wanted to make his business grow but he doesn’t have enough capital to maintain his business. When he learned about the Kiva lenders, he wanted to borrow Php 4,000 to buy additional “balot” and duck eggs to retail. He wants to have many products to obtain many customers especially at the time of the harvest season.

He sells normally from 8:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. so that he can still do his other work in the morning for his livelihood. He is just earning Php  2.00 for every egg or “balot” that he sells every night. He believes that the loan will be of big help to make his business productive.

According to him, he will be working hard and sacrifices a lot to earn more profit. As a father of three children, he must do his best and give more effort to bring income for his family and save funds for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: To buy additional “balot” and duck eggs to retail

loans.name: Mumin

texts.ru:
Мумин Утанов мужчина 1968 года рождения, женат на Рохат Утановой, имеет 4 детей.
  Занимается Мумин животноводством, откармливает скот дома. Стаж работы в сфере животноводства у Мумина 20 лет.
  Жена Мумина Рохат помогает ему в животноводстве, доит двух коров и перерабатывает молоко, которое продает своим соседям сестра Мумина.Прибыль полученную от продажи  молока делят поплам. Так же, Мумин работает в дехканско-фермерском хозяйстве «Бураген».
  Мумин запрашивает сумму 2400 на 8 месяцев, для закупа дополнительного бычка.
texts.en:
Mumin U. is a man who was born in 1968. He is married to Rohat Utanova, and has four children. Mumin raises livestock, fattening cattle at his home, and has twenty years of work experience in raising cattle. Mumin's wife Rohat helps him with the livestock by milking the two cows and processing the milk, which she sells to her neighbors, Mumin's sister. In addition, Mumin works on the Buragen farm. Mumin is requesting a loan in the amount of 2400 somoni in order to purchase an additional steer.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a steer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has been selling fish for more than two years. Her husband, a farmer, assists her by taking the fish around their village from house-to-house with his motorcycle. Their income is not enough to meet their needs. Mary Jane is planning to open a store in front of their house to earn more profit. She wants to expand her business into a typical village store. She is willing to increase her efforts in order to expand her business.

Mary Jane is just 22 years old and married to Rex. They are blessed with two children. The older, Camil Joy, is 5 years old and she will be starting nursery school next year. Ejay is just 10 months old. Mary Jane is happy that there is cooperation in her family. They always give a helping hand to each other, especially in times of crisis.

Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to have enough capital for her business plan. She aims to provide her children with higher education some day; thus, she is working diligently to attain her desires in life and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To open a store

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas served as one of the Barangay (district) secretaries in their village at Purok 2 (district 2), Cabaruan Naguilian, Isabela where he lives with his family. He is now 57 years old and married to Rufina with whom he has six children.

Arnel, the eldest, is 29 years old; next is Jesus, 27 years old; Cherrylyn is the third, 25 years old; fourth is Lovelia, 23 years old; Nicolas is fifth, 21 years old; and the youngest is Luis who is 19 years old, and he is a high school graduate. Nicolas is very happy that almost all of his children are already working though they are not all graduated with a college degree. He hopes that their success will continue with the help of our God above.

Nicolas joined the Kiva lending program because he wanted to maintain his services to his co-villagers. Nicolas is an electrician and he repairs electrical problems that occur in their neighborhood.

At present, he is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase some needed materials in electronics which are very beneficial to his work. Moreover, some extra amount will be used to start a barbeque and fish-ball vending business in order to have extra income aside from being an electrician. He hopes that his business endeavor will grow and hopefully it will help them to have a more successful life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase electronic materials for his business

loans.name: Puriza

texts.en:
Puriza is already 50 years old and married to Crispin L.. They are blessed with four children. The eldest is Crispin L., Jr., second is Celito, the third is Maria, and the youngest is May-Anne, who is still studying in college and hopefully will finish her studies to have a good employment in the future. The couple lives together with their children in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.

Puriza is engaged in making and selling “labong” in their village. “Labong” is a kind of vegetable that is used in vegetarian dishes. It comes from young bamboo shoots. Puriza is gaining an income of one thousand pesos weekly in selling “labong” in their village. She wants to acquire many customers to be able to earn more profit.

For this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a large quantity of “labong” to sell in their village and in the market. Puriza would also like to revive her old bankrupt store to further generate additional income. Her store has been closed due to lack of funds.

She is hoping to have some savings with the help of ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) and, through her sacrifices, she believes that God will guide her to be able to attain all her goals. She also dreams to send her youngest child to school and have her finish a college course someday. She will be in second year college next school year and it will require more income for her to pursue her studies. Lastly, Puriza shared an inspiring quotation that says; “If others can, why can’t I?”

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of “labong” to sell

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru:
Барно Файзиева проживает в Истаравшане со своим мужем Физылом.
 Барно торгует на вещевом рынке, она реализует женскую одежду. Стаж ее работы в сфере предпринимательской деятельности 5 лет.Муж Барно привозит товар из Кыргызстана, а сама Барно продает его на вещевом рынке.
 Планирует в ближайшем будущем расширить ассортимент своего товара, для чего и запрашивает сумму в размере 4000 сомони сроком на 2 месяца.
texts.en:
Barno F. lives in Istaravshan with her husband Fizyl. Barno has a business at the clothing market, where she sells women's clothing. She has five years of experience in this line of work. Barno's husband brings in the goods from Kyrgyzstan, and Barno herself sells them at the clothing market. In the near future, she is planning to expand the selection of goods she carries, and to do so is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 42 years old and she is already a widow. Her late husband was Federico B. who died three years ago. They were gifted with four children. The eldest is Alvin, 19 years old, who is a high school graduate and presently working as a construction worker in Tabuk Kalinga, Philippines. The second child is Arjay, 17 years old, who was in second year high school when he decided to stop studying due to lack of school allowance. Apple, the third child, is 11 years old and now in grade six. The youngest is Anna Mae, who is 8 years old and studying in primary school.

Rosalinda is thankful that her children are always at her side and very loving to her. She needs to move on and strive for the best towards their better future. She always believes that, even without her husband, she will be able to raise her children well with the help of our God.

Rosalinda has been managing a general store for more than ten years but, due to lack of capital, she had to close her store for a while. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be able to continue her business for the survival of her family. She will be purchasing groceries and other commodities that will satisfy her customers’ demands.

She is also dreaming of enabling her two children to finish their studies until college level. Being a single mother, she is obligated to work hard to support her children’s education. She needs to be more patient and strive harder to succeed in her business endeavor to be able to provide their daily needs. She also wishes that she could find ways to generate more income to buy a tricycle that will be used in a transportation business.

loans.use: To re-open her general store

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian D. is currently selling foodstuffs like rice, beans, fish, meat and many others items at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to extend her restaurant by building another room to accommodate as many customers as possible for the continuous business operation that can lead to great expansion of her business. She is a woman, 38 years old, whose husband is an army officer in the Sudanese People's Liberation Army/Movement (SPLA/M). Lilian has a total of three children who are all boys and all of them go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build another room to accommodate more customers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C., a 49-year old farmer and mother of two children, now owns the land she previously rented, growing rice as her main crop.  Her agricultural income has enabled her to buy appliances such as a refrigerator and television.  Gloria is now requesting a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI to buy 40 liters of crude oil, rice seeds and fertilizers, all of which will really help her improve the harvest. 
	
CEVI provides with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 40 liters of crude oil, rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khun M. is 42 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She earns a living by raising pigs in a stall next to her house. She raises two lots of pigs per year and sells them to the slaughterer every six months. She has been earning an income of approximately $4 a day, since 2003.

She is married with five children: one of them is married and lives independently, while the other four are single and work in different jobs. Her husband is a farmer and also a firewood seller. To help reduce the cost of transportation, Khun M. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo in order to transport firewood to sell. (Mrs. Khun M.'s husband is pictured).

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo to transport firewood

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, a 41-year-old resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela, is married to Wilson A., a farmer in their village. They have four children: Winnie, 21 years old and already married; Wilgel, 19 years old; Williad, 17, a high school graduate, and Wilson, 11, presently attending elementary school. Violeta and her husband work hard for the improvement of their living conditions.

Violeta sells vegetables harvested from their own backyard vegetable garden, earning an average income of PHP300.00 daily. She wants to make her small business more profitable and so is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to maintain and grow it. Violeta dreams of someday having a motorcycle to make her vending easier and enable her to increase her customer base. She also wishes to send her youngest child to high school and then college if given the chance. She believes that through her sacrifices in vending and her strong faith in God, she will be able to attain her dreams.

loans.use: Business maintenance and improvement

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru:
Абдурашит Хочакулов 1967 год рождения, животновод с восемнадцатилетнем стажем работы. Проживает Абдурашит в Шахристанском районе со своей семьей. Жена Сайера и его 4 детей по мере возможности помгают ему в откорме скота.
Сын Абдурашита помогает отцу продавать и покупать скот на рынке. А его дочери перерабатывают молоко и продают его соседям.
Абдурашит подал заявку на получение займа 1600 сомони на 6 месяцев,ля откорма домашнего скота.Кроме животновдства Абдурашит занимается сельским хозяйством, он выращивает лук.
texts.en:
Abdurashit H. was born in 1967, and is a grazier with 18 years of work experience. Abdurashit lives with his family in the district of Shahristan. His wife Sayera and his four children help him as much as possible with rearing the cattle. Abdurashit's son assists his father with buying and selling cattle at the market, and his daughters process the milk and sell it to their neighbors. Abdurashit applied for a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni in order to fatten their domesticated cattle. In addition to raising livestock, Abdurashit is a farmer who grows onions.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Makka

texts.en: Makka J., a 25 year-old-woman, sells charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to open a restaurant for selling tea and bread. Her husband is a policeman and they have two children who both attend school at Buluk "B" primary school in Arabic Pattern. With the extra realizable profits from her loan, Makka intends to build a house that will be rented out. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a restaurant

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy P., 39-year-old mother of seven children, started farming as a tenant. Now, she finally owns the land that she and her husband are tilling. She wants to make it productive. She thinks that her farm proceeds will send all her children to school until college. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase sacks of seed and fertilizer. She thinks that by doing so, she could improve their harvest. CEVI is reaching out to a lot of poor families. It gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn L. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Robelyn is married and has four school-aged children. Robelyn owns and operates a general store, primarily selling food products in the local community. 

Robelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru:
Умед Шерматов родился в 1985 году, недавно женился на Ёркиной. Очень счастлив.Благодаря  животноводству, которым он занимается уже 6 лет, он сыграл свадьбу. Дома у Умеда 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, откормом и перепродажей которых он занимается. Умед хочет купить дойную корову, так как жена Умеда будет перерабатывать молоко и продавать его, чтобы принять участие в доходе семьи.
Для этого, он запрашивает сумму 700 сомони, сроком на 6 месяцев.
Дополнительный доход в их "новоиспеченную" семью приносит работа Умеда методистом в Городском Отделе Народного Образования (ГРОНО).
texts.en:
Umed S. was born in 1985. He recently married Yorkina, and is very happy. Thanks to raising livestock, which he has done for the past six years, he was able to have a wedding. At home Umed has seven head of large-horned cattle, which he raises and resells. Umed would like to purchase a milk cow, so his wife can process and sell the milk and help support the family. In order to do so, Umed has requested a loan in the amount of 700 somoni. Umed brings additional income into their new-fledged family, working as a teaching specialist at the City Board of Public Education.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en:
Suzy M. sells bread and locally-brewed alcohol and is requesting a loan to open a bar to sell locally-brewed alcohol. She is 20 years old, married to a business man and has two daughters, both attending primary school. From the extra profits she will earn, she hopes to buy a taxi for hire. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar to sell locally-brewed alcohol.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch K., 32, is a farmer. She also sells a few grocery items. She earns around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sang Soeurm, farms rice with her. K. buys grocery inventory from the town market and transports everything by bicycle to sell around her village. In order to make more profit, she is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner, HKL, to be used to purchase more inventory to sell. She plans to use half of the loan to buy a cow to plow the farmland and rent out to other farmers. This will provide a more stable income to cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Munhzaya

texts.en:
Munhzaya D. lives with her husband and three teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All three of her children are local high school students.

Munhzaya has a small retail business selling clothing. She rents a small stall in the local market and sells various women’s and men's clothes. She usually buys clothes from Beijing, China. She started her business in 2000, and since then has done very well. Her business capital has increased from 500,000 MNT to 4,000,000 MNT ($1  is approximately 1,400 MNT). She has been running her business for almost a decade and is great at picking clothes that are in demand.

In the future, she would like to own her shop, instead of renting a stall in the market. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.name: Harriet Nakalembe‘S Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of four members of a group. She is 37 years old and married with five children aged between 5 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Harriet takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Harriet sells secondhand clothes in Owino Market. She sells to an average of 15 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. She buys clothes from Owino, one of the busiest markets in Kampala and pays for transport costs to and from work. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and electricity. She has been in this business for the last six years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality.

Harriet has been with MCDT (Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO)  for over six years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working all this long with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes. She is aspiring to own a permanent shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kokougan

texts.fr: Kokougan A. est âgé de 22 ans, célibataire sans enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto. Kokougan est un vaillant garçon et prend au sérieux son activité. Cet emprunt lui servira à payer sa propre moto. Kokougan est optimiste sur le changement des conditions de sa vie grâce à ce crédit.
texts.en:
Kokougan A., 22, is single and has no children. He is a moto-taxi driver. Kokougan is a fine young man and takes his business seriously. This loan will allow him to buy his own motorbike. Kokougan is optimistic that this loan will be able to help him change his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal B. is 70 years old and lives with his 69-year-old wife in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small retail business selling secondhand clothing. He rents a stall in the local market and sells men's and women's secondhand clothes. He travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, once or twice a month and buys secondhand clothes from the wholesale markets. He started his business in 2003 with only 300,000 MNT of working capital (~$215 US) which has increased to 800,000 MNT. In the future, he would like to diversify his inventory. He is requesting a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Zafar Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Kosar parveen baji has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the last 10 years. Multan city is famous for its handmade items and for its shrines. Kosar baji is an uneducated lady who couldn’t get an education because her parents couldn’t afford the education expenses due to little financial resource. She married a man whose name is Z. I. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. Kosar baji is a very hardworking lady. She helps her husband by selling thread. She buys old warm clothes and pulls the thread out from them. Then she washes them and makes a roll. This process takes her a whole day. She sells the thread rolls to the thread sellers and earns an income. Her husband feels proud of her. She is applying for a loan to buy more old warm clothes to increase the profit of her business. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Nazir begum baji and Samina begum baji each want a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) for their decorative embroidery business. Haseena baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Sardaran mai baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy old warm clothes for thread selling business

loans.name: Pathani Ghulam Shabbier Group

texts.en:
My name is Pathani and I have been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Multan city is famous for its handmade items and for its shrines. My husband's name is G. S. and he is a loader by profession. He loads the items on his donkey cart and delivers to the assigned place. He has five years of experience in this business. I operate an embroidery business. I prepare embroidered dresses on order which I collect from the cloth market and earns income. I save my income in a committee and plan to renovate my house with the committee amount. I am applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart because the old cart became rough and rotted.

I am the group leader of four other women from my locality. Khamiran mai baji and Parveen mai baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Iqbal mai baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Tuvshin

texts.en: Tuvshin S. is a widow and lives with her three children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her youngest son is a local high school student and her two other children have their own small businesses. She has a small painting business. She started her painting business in 1999 by painting windows for locals. She had been a good painter as a child and started painting windows, beds, chairs and tables for her clients. Since the start, she has done well and her business capital has increased from 30,000 MNT to 200,000 MNT. Moreover, she has gained abundant experience in the business and some trusted clients. In the future, she would like to expand her business by finding more clients. She requests a loan to purchase more paint for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more paint

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: "I only have a small rice farm until it grows. My husband and I have been tilling our farm since the start of our marriage. All we want is to have an abundant harvest to be able to provide for the needs of our two dear children," says Mrs. Joan D., a 31-year-old farmer from Agusan Del Sur, Mindanao. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase seven sacks of fertilizer and pesticides as well. She thinks that by doing so, she can improve their harvest. CEVI is reaching out to a lot of poor families. It gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seven sacks of ammonium nitrate fertilizer

loans.name: Allen Aakyanzi‘S Group

texts.en:
Allen is the leader of a five-member group. She is the 29-year-old mother of two children aged one week and 4 years. The 4-year-old goes to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day.

Allen resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a ladies’ salon in Lungujja, Kosovo. She works upon an average of seven people a day, mainly women and children. She works seven days a week.

Allen does her shopping from shops in Kampala. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity and medication. She has been in this business for the last four years. Her main challenges are defaulters and seasonality.

Allen has been with MCDT for over four years and is servicing her tenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more steaming dryers and more tins of creams. Allen is hopeful of opening up other branches of salons in different areas.

loans.use: To buy a steaming dryer and more creams

loans.name: Holik

texts.ru: Рустамов Холик - мужчина 47 лет, женат имеет четверых детей.Работает в колхозе водителем управляющего.Его заработная плата не хватает на проживание его семьи,поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход с откорма и перепродажи скота.Холик закончив первый кредит хочет получить повторно займ на закуп скота и корма для коров.Холик после первого кредита увеличил оборотный капитал скота.Его жена занимается отдоем и продажей домашнего молока.Она благодарит Микроинвест за предоставившую её семье увеличить в кредит численность домашнего скота.
texts.en:
Holik R. is a 47-year-old man, who is married and has four children. He works on a collective farms as a driver for the manager. His salary is not sufficient to support his family, so he makes additional income from raising and selling cattle. Having repaid his first loan, Holik would like to take out another loan to purchase cattle and cattle feed. With his first loan, Holik increased his working capital for cattle. His wife does the milking and sells the home-produced milk. She is grateful to MicroInvest for giving her family a loan to increase the size of their herd of domesticated cattle.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: "Farmer, that is me. We have been tilling our rice field, me and my husband, to be able to support the needs of our children. Our harvest is intended for family consumption. When there is extra, we sell some of our rice to our neighbor at Php 37.00 per kilo," says Susan F., 48-year-old mother of six children from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase five sacks of fertilizers and four sacks of seed. She thinks that by doing so, she will be doing something to improve their yield and income. CEVI gives not just loans to their clients. It also offers training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and 4 sacks of seed

loans.name: Lomalo Medeke

texts.fr:
En 1995, cette femme a commencé à exercer  comme activité le commerce de produits congelés en détail en 1995 ; son ancienneté dans ce commerce fait qu’elle le maîtrise, elle a beaucoup de clients dont la plupart des restaurateurs ou des tenanciers de cafétéria. Son stock de marchandises étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de viande de dindon, 2 cartons de poulets, 2 cartons de cuisses de pintade.
Elle est mariée et mère de 01 enfant.
texts.en:
In 1995, this woman began doing commerce in frozen goods at the retail level. Her seniority in this business means she has a command of it. She has a lot of customers, most of whom are restauranteurs or cafeteria owners. Because her stock of merchandise is exhausted, she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy two boxed of turkey meat, two boxes of chicken, and two boxes of pintade (Guinea hen) thighs. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of turkey, chicken, and pintade meat

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie A. was a laborer before. Now, he is managing a small farm for his family. His wife is helping him work in the farm  to provide all their family needs.  He is 29 years old. He married early and has one child. He wants to grow his farm and wants to buy another farm to improve their family economic condition.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer, 16 liters of crude oil for the tractor and to pay the laborers. The loan will help his family improve their harvest even more and have a better income. 


CEVI provides people with a chance to start and have their own business. It provide not just loans to their clients but also training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer, 16 liters of crude oil for the tractor and to pay laborers

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур- мужчина 39 лет, женат имеет двоих детей. Он работает электриком в колхозе,заработная плата очень низкая, помимо этого он работает на вызов по домам на ремонт электрических линий.Из-за низкого уровня проживания Сомгарского района ему платит население за ремонт очень маленькие суммы.Поэтому Баходур занимается откормом и продажей мелкорогатого скота.Он покупает на рынке дешёвый скот . откормив его перепродаёт подороже.С чего и имеет небольшой доход на жизнь.Сейчас, когда скот дешёвый на рынке Баходур хочет закупить несколько голов молодого скота.Для чего и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a 39-year-old man, who is married and has two children. He works as an electrician on a collective farm, but his salary is low, so he additionally works part-time doing home electrical repairs. Due to the low standard of living in the district of Somgor, people pay him very little for the repairs, so Bahodur raises and sells small-horned cattle. He purchases the cattle inexpensively at the market, fattens them and resells them for more, making a small profit for living expenses. Now, Bahodur would like to purchase several head of young cattle at the market while they are cheap, and for this reason has come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Sugran Mai Umar Hayyat Group

texts.en:
Sugran mai baji has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the last 10 years. She owns a two-room brick house in this city. She feels herself a very lucky person because she belongs to a city which is famous for its shrines. Her husband's name is U. H. and he runs a clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from the famous bazaars of Multan city and sells to the community to earn an income. Sugran baji always motivates him and gives him strength in every circumstance. Her husband feels very comfortable with her. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to increase her husband's profits. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Aziz mai baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, cloth and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business. Manzooran mai baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Riffat baji wants a loan to buy embroidered scarves to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Yudeta

texts.en:
Yudeta K. currently sells beans and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and rice to sell. She is a 45-year-old woman whose husband was shot dead during the 21 year liberation war in southern Sudan. She has five children: two are in Juba day secondary school and three are in primary school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. 


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice le commerce de produits d’alimentaton générale, elle exerce ce commerce dans sa boutique qu’elle a appelé «  AMENUVEVE », elle a beaucoup de clients et attire tous les jours de nouveaux clients par sa manière d’accueillir sa clientèle. Son stock de marchandises a un peu diminué, elle s’adresse alors à WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 05 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 04 cartons de savons « BF », 06 cartons de spaghetti, 20 tomates en boîtes, 06 cartons de sucre, et des cartes de recharge. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et a commencé ce commerce en 2008.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns an income from commerce in grocery items. She works out of her shop she called “AMENUVEVE”. She has many customers and attracts new customers each day because of her way of accommodating them. Her stock of merchandise has shrunk a bit. So she is inquiring with WAGES and requesting her first loan to buy 5 sacks of rice, 10 drums of oil, 4 boxes of “BF” soap, 6 boxes of spaghetti, 20 cans of tomatoes, 6 boxes of sugar, and some recharge cards. She supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She began this business in 2008. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items
